title: Full-time Unit Nurse RN - Dialysis
description:
Doral Health and Wellness is seeking a skilled and compassionate **Full-time Unit Nurse** to join our healthcare team. The Unit Nurse will provide high-quality nursing care to patients undergoing dialysis treatment for kidney failure or other renal conditions. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in nephrology nursing, possess excellent clinical skills, and be dedicated to delivering exceptional patient care.

**Responsibilities:**

* Conduct comprehensive assessments of patients before, during, and after dialysis treatment, including vital signs, fluid status, and overall well-being.
* Administer medications, including intravenous medications, as prescribed by the physician during dialysis treatment, ensuring accuracy and adherence to medication protocols.
* Monitor patients' dialysis treatment, including machine setup, access cannulation, and monitoring of dialysis parameters to ensure safe and effective therapy.
* Assess and manage patients' vascular access sites, such as fistulas, grafts, or catheters, including care, assessment for complications, and infection control measures.
* Collaborate with the interdisciplinary healthcare team to develop and implement individualized care plans for each patient, ensuring continuity and coordination of care.
* Educate patients and their families about dialysis treatment, including the purpose, procedure, and potential complications, as well as self-care techniques and dietary restrictions.
* Perform routine and specialized nursing procedures related to dialysis, such as blood sampling, fluid removal, and dialyzer reprocessing, adhering to established protocols and infection control measures.
* Monitor and document patients' response to dialysis treatment, including vital signs, laboratory results, and any adverse reactions or complications, maintaining accurate and thorough documentation.
* Respond promptly and effectively to medical emergencies that may arise during dialysis treatment, implementing appropriate interventions and alerting the healthcare team.
* Provide emotional support and counseling to patients and their families, addressing their concerns, promoting a positive and supportive environment, and facilitating patient engagement in their care.

**Qualifications:**

* Current registered nurse (RN) license in New York State.
* Experience in nephrology or related field, with a focus on dialysis nursing is preferred.
* BLS (Basic Life Support) certification required; additional certifications such as ACLS (Advanced Cardiac Life Support) or CDN (Certified Dialysis Nurse) preferred.
* Knowledge of dialysis principles, techniques, and equipment, including hemodialysis and/or peritoneal dialysis.
* Proficient in performing vascular access cannulation and care.
* Excellent assessment, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills.
* Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to establish rapport with patients, families, and the healthcare team.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, multidisciplinary environment.
* Commitment to ongoing professional development and staying updated with advancements in nephrology and dialysis nursing.

**Compensation**

* Salary - $55 per hour depending on experience
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Dental Insurance
* 401(k)
* Vision insurance
* Life insurance
* Disability insurance
* Parking spot
* Other

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $55.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Geriatrics

Physical Setting:

* Clinic

License/Certification:

* NYS RN license (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Organizational Change Manager, Grade-23 - Lower Hudson Valley, New York City and Long Island Region
company: New York State Department of Motor Vehicles
description:
**Minimum Qualifications**

To apply, you should have:

* A bachelor’s degree in any field + seven years of experience working on a project team or managing projects + three years of supervisory experience + certification in an established OCM Model (Prosci, Acuity, Cornell, etc.).

OR

* A master’s degree in any field + five years of experience working on a project team or managing projects + one year of supervisory experience + Certification in an established OCM Model (Prosci, Acuity, Cornell, etc.).

It would be great if your professional experience includes working on a project team or collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data.

**Additional Qualifications**

* Experience with major transformational change and organizational change projects.
* Experience with large-scale organizational change effort
* Requires minimal instruction on day-to-day work and general direction on more complex tasks and projects.
* Ability to effectively lead change initiatives, as well as the personal skills required to be an effective leader and communicator.
* Demonstrate excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and oral.
* Ability to collaborate and build strong relationships with stakeholders.
* Highly organized, detail-oriented, and can multitask and prioritize effectively.
* An in-depth understanding of how people go through a change and the change process experience.
* Must possess problem solving, strong analytic and decision-making abilities.
* Ability to influence others and move toward a common vision or goal.
* Driven to solve complex challenges and support all stakeholders through change.
* Proficiency in Excel, Word, Outlook, Teams, SharePoint, and WebEx.

**Preferred Qualifications**

You will be a great candidate if you are:

* Highly self-motivated.
* A reliable motivator for your team.
* A critical thinker.
* Able to solve problems or find out-of-the-box ways to achieve the agency’s goals.
* A great communicator-both written and oral.
* Excellent at facilitating conversations and guiding a group on professionals to achieve a common goal.
* Detail-oriented and accurate in analysis.

We would love to hear from you if you have:

* A positive attitude and the ability to influence people around you.
* Great analytical skills and ability to collect, analyze, and interpret data.
* Experience using Excel, Word, Outlook, Teams, SharePoint, and WebEx.
* An understanding of graphic design and experience creating or editing media.
* Organizational Change Management (OCM) experience.
* Experience engaging stakeholders and managing relationships with business partners.

**Overview & Responsibilities**

The Department of Motor Vehicles (DMV) is an agency dedicated to delivering innovative solutions and exceptional service to our customers. We are committed to fostering a collaborative and inclusive work environment that empowers our employees to achieve their full potential.

DMV operates in a dynamic environment marked by ongoing change. At the heart of our efforts is the Change Management Office (CMO). Our CMO assist with enabling change within the agency by developing structured approaches to help acclimate employees and the agency to the future state of the organizational change.

Joining the CMO means becoming part of a team dedicated to shattering the perceptions of the DMV. You will be a valued member of a team of collaborators with the common goal of driving DMV forward. We proudly promote a respectful, empowering, and inclusive work environment where there is room for growth and new opportunities to help drive your career forward.

This position is based in Manhattan – New York City. You can expect to lead change activities in the lower Hudson Valley, New York City and Long Island Region as well as Capital Region and Central and Western NY Region areas as needed. The incumbent will report to the Organizational Change Manager for the Lower Hudson Valley, New York City and Long Island Region.

What will you do?

* Lead change initiatives for the agency covering New York City, Long Island, and Westchester and Rockland Counties.
* Participate in the active execution of engagements, focusing on the people side of change for organizational changes and processes.
* Work with senior management on change initiatives and help strategize and promote positive learning journey across the organization.
* Assist in managing the change management process and help to create and implement a strategy to support adoption of the changes required by a project or initiative.
* Develop and initiate activities to support change and transition through impact and readiness change assessments, conducting analyses, and identifying key stakeholders.
* Partner with key stakeholders, including senior leadership, to support the growth and transformation of the organization, measure efficacy of initiatives, manage communications and evaluate implementations that support organizational change.
* Collect and analyze data related to organizational changes.
* Track and measure the effectiveness of change initiatives using feedback and other metrics to adjust and improve our strategies.
* Engages stakeholders and build relationships to support change efforts.
* Conducts and evaluate impact assessments and develop change management strategies and associated materials for regional needs.
* Identify barriers and propose recommendations to eliminate resistance, overcome barriers and gain acceptance of the change among stakeholders.
* Supervise a team of Organizational Change Analysts in your region.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

What’s in it for you?

* 13 paid holidays
* Paid vacation and sick leave
* Flexibility and work-from-home opportunities
* Affordable health insurance plans
* Family dental and vision benefits
* Membership in the New York State Employees’ Retirement System (ERS)
* Access to New York State Deferred Compensation to help save extra money for retirement.
* Opportunities for student loan forgiveness and tuition assistance programs
* Promotional opportunities to grow your career.

Hours of the position will be discussed at the time of interview, including questions regarding flextime, compressed work week and telecommuting. Telecommuting, if granted, is a maximum of 50%.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $84,156.00 - $106,454.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY 10007 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY 10007: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Porter
description:
**Overview:**

Rose Associates is your gateway to an exhilarating realm of real estate innovation. Our dynamic services platform spans development, management, leasing, and marketing, catering to private and institutional property owners globally. In the unparalleled market of New York City, where unique needs and challenges abound, we've solidified our position as the go-to industry leader.

Established in 1925, Rose Associates boasts almost a century of New York real estate expertise, continuously expanding across the tri-state area. Join us on the forefront of innovation and growth – Rose Associates is where excitement meets opportunity!

We are seeking a highly motivated and customer-focused Residential Property Porter to join our vibrant team and contribute to the overall satisfaction and well-being of our residents.

**Essential Functions:**

* Maintain the property’s aesthetic appeal and perform routine tasks on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis, encompassing activities such as vacuuming, cleaning, and meticulously detailing common areas, including hallways, lobbies, and recreation spaces, outdoor grounds and landscaping clean and well-maintained.
* Assist in snow and ice removal during inclement weather and put out / remove rain mats to ensure safe pathways for residents.
* Collect and dispose of trash from common areas and ensure proper recycling procedures are followed.
* Work closely with maintenance staff to address minor repairs, painting, water intrusion cleanup, minor damage and other related service requests.
* Clean out vacant units to prepare for apartment turns.
* Provide excellent customer service to residents, responding to inquiries and addressing concerns in a timely and professional manner, and cover front desk / concierge staff and deliver packages to tenants as necessary.
* Comply with workplace safety and OSHA regulations.
* Must be present on-site and be able to move throughout the building to address building related matters and meet with tenants, staff, vendors and visitors.
* Ability to ascend and descend stairs, as well as positioning oneself in small spaces for building inspections and maintenance repairs and lifting and moving large or heavy objects in excess of 50 pounds.
* Must be comfortable with exposure to varying environmental climates and circumstances.

**Qualifications:**

* High School diploma or equivalent and / or previous experience in a similar role is preferred.
* Ability to operate and maintain landscaping and maintenance equipment.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Must be able to work a flexible schedule to include days, nights, weekends, holidays.

Rose Associates requires all colleagues to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless there is an approved religious or medical exemption.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $21.50 per hour

Expected hours: 15 – 30 per week

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Application Question(s):

* Will you now or in the future require sponsorship to work in the United States?
* Are you fully vaccinated against Covid-19?
* What is your desired base salary?

Work Location: In person
company_addresses:
200 Madison Avenue, 5th Floor
New York, NY 10016

title: Hiring CHHA'S like YOU TODAY!
description:
**About Us:** Maya Home Care is a boutique PCA/Companion agency dedicated to providing exceptional home care services throughout New Jersey. Our unique company culture prioritizes compassion, excellence, and personalized care, setting us apart from any other agency. We are looking to expand our team with dedicated HHA certified caregivers who are passionate about making a difference in the lives of our clients.



Job Description: We are seeking HHA certified caregivers to join our growing team at Maya Home Care. As a caregiver, you will provide high-quality personal care and companionship to our clients, ensuring their comfort, safety, and well-being in their home. This is an exciting opportunity to work in a supportive and innovative environment where your contributions are valued. We give you patients around your area!


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Assist clients with daily living activities, including bathing, dressing, grooming, and meal preparation.


* Provide companionship and engage clients in meaningful activities.


* Perform light housekeeping tasks to maintain a clean and safe environment.


* Monitor and report any changes in clients' health status to the care coordinator.


* Follow individualized care plans and provide care with compassion and respect.


* Ensure clients' comfort and safety at all times.


* Maintain accurate and timely documentation of care provided.


**Qualifications:**


* HHA certification in the state of New Jersey.


* Previous experience in home care or a related field is preferred.


* Strong interpersonal and communication skills.


* Compassionate, reliable, and dedicated to providing excellent care.


* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


* Valid driver's license and reliable transportation are preferred.


**What We Offer:**


* Competitive compensation.


* Aggressive Bonus structure


* A supportive and positive work environment.


* Opportunities for professional growth and development.


* Flexible scheduling to accommodate your needs.


* Comprehensive training and ongoing support.


* A company culture that values and appreciates its employees.


**How to Apply:**



If you are a compassionate and dedicated caregiver looking to join a unique and supportive home care agency, we would love to hear from you! Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter explaining why you are the ideal candidate for this position.



Maya Home Care is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

  



Apply today and become a valued member of the Maya Home Care family!


**Requirements**  

**Pass background check**  

**High school diploma/GED**

  


**Must be CHHA certified in the state of NJ**

title: Oncology Nurse Practitioner - 2562848
description:
**Position Overview:**


We are seeking a compassionate and motivated Nurse Practitioner (NP) to join our dynamic oncology team. This contract position is open to experienced practitioners who possess a strong commitment to oncology care.

**Responsibilities:**

* Conduct comprehensive assessments of patients with cancer, including medical history review, physical examinations, and symptom management.
* Develop and implement individualized treatment plans in collaboration with the supervising physician and multidisciplinary team.
* Perform procedures such as bone marrow biopsies, lumbar punctures, and central line insertions under the guidance of the supervising physician.
* Monitor patient response to treatment, adjust therapy as needed, and provide ongoing education and support to patients and their families.
* Participate in patient rounds, tumor boards, and interdisciplinary meetings to contribute to care planning and coordination.
* Document patient encounters accurately and timely in the electronic medical record system, ensuring compliance with regulatory standards and institutional protocols.
* Stay informed about the latest advancements in oncology research, treatment modalities, and supportive care interventions.
* Collaborate with community resources and support services to facilitate continuity of care and enhance patient outcomes.
* Actively participate in quality improvement initiatives, clinical research projects, and professional development activities.

**Requirements:**

* Master's degree in Nursing (NP) or Physician Assistant Studies (PA) from an accredited program.
* Current licensure as a Nurse Practitioner or Physician Assistant in the state of New York.
* Board certification as an ANP, FNP, or PA required.
* Strong interest in oncology care with a genuine commitment to improving the lives of patients with cancer.
* Ability to work collaboratively within a multidisciplinary team environment.
* Demonstrated critical thinking, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities.

**Job Type**: Full-time / 13 weeks

**Benefits:**

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

**Medical Specialty:**

* Oncology

**Experience:**

* Oncology: 2 year(s) experience required

**License/Certification:**

title: X-Ray Technician
description:
**Job Title**: X-Ray Technician (Radiologic Technologist)

**Location**: New York, NY

**Job Summary**:

The X-Ray Technician, or Radiologic Technologist, is responsible for performing diagnostic imaging procedures using X-ray equipment. This role involves ensuring high-quality imaging while maintaining patient safety and comfort. The technician will work closely with radiologists and other healthcare professionals to provide accurate diagnostic information.

**Key Responsibilities**:

* Prepare and position patients for X-ray examinations, explaining procedures and ensuring patient comfort.
* Operate X-ray equipment, including selecting appropriate imaging techniques and settings.
* Ensure proper radiation safety practices are followed, including the use of protective gear and proper exposure settings.
* Review and process X-ray images to ensure they meet quality standards and assist with diagnostic interpretation.
* Maintain accurate records of imaging procedures, patient information, and radiation dose.
* Collaborate with radiologists and other healthcare professionals to obtain additional images or adjust techniques as needed.
* Keep the imaging area clean and ensure all equipment is properly maintained and calibrated.
* Follow infection control procedures and maintain a sterile environment as required.
* Provide excellent patient care, addressing any concerns and answering questions related to the imaging process.

title: Social Worker (SW) -Dialysis
description:
Doral Dialysis Center is seeking a **Nephrology Social Worker** to join our team.

**Main Functions:**  
Nephrology social work services support and maximize psychosocial functioning and adjustment of patients who are experiencing end-stage renal disease (ESRD) and their families.

These services are provided to ameliorate social and emotional stresses resulting from the interacting physical, social, and psychological concomitants of ESRD, including shortened life expectancy; altered lifestyle with changes in social, financial, vocational, and sexual functioning; and the demands of a rigorous, time-consuming, and complex treatment regimen.

Social work functions are a part of the interdisciplinary team (IDT) and are responsible for fostering a positive treatment environment policy and routines that are attuned to cultural, religious, and ethnic differences among patients and families and show respect for the individuality, independence, and choice of each patient.

**Essential Job Functions:**  
1. Conduct initial patient psychosocial assessment and comprehensive plan of care as well as prepare appropriate documentation for review by the interdisciplinary team.  
2. Provide support, information, and assistance in treatment planning.  
3. Develop and continue to monitor psychosocial goals for plan of care.  
4. Counsel new patients and families on pre-dialysis education, including treatment options (e.g. transplantation).  
5. Act as an advocate on behalf of the patient and family.  
6. Complete and document initial and ongoing comprehensive assessments, evaluations and quarterly notes, along with documenting and monitoring ongoing psychosocial issues and patient goals and readjust when goals are not met.  
7. Notify the interdisciplinary team of patient psychosocial issues affecting treatment.  
8. Facilitate and/or refer patients and families to support/education groups, whenever possible.  
9. Facilitate education on Advance Directives and treatment modalities.  
10. Coordinate and participate in patient/family care conferences with interdisciplinary team.  
11. Analyze and provide information and facilitate referrals to community, private, state and federal agencies based on psychosocial need (e.g. financial programs, medication assistance programs, Vocational Rehabilitation Programs, transportation resources, mental health and chemical dependency resources and home health/homemaking agencies.)  
12. Provide crisis intervention expertise as necessary.  
13. Provide assistance to patient and family in adjusting to dialysis and altered life-style, and provide resource information.  
14. Arranges patient travel arrangements for both guest and permanent patients and ensure completion of arrangements.  
15. Coordinates patient transfers/ visit to other facilities.  
16. Assistance regarding health insurance:

* Assist patients with financial concerns for National Kidney Foundation, American Kidney Fund, state renal programs, Veterans Administration, etc.
* Support patient questions regarding Medicare and Medicaid.
* Coordinate patient Medicare and/or Medicaid assistance entitlements and all appropriate documents.
* Assist patients in answering billing questions.
* To help answer commercial insurance questions for patients.
* To provide facility education on commercial insurance economics.

17. Comply with policy and procedures and in accordance with state and federal regulations for patient care and services. (Medicare, OSHA, OIG, or other governing agencies)  
18. Maintain patient confidentiality.  
19. Participate in QAPI teams, facility team meetings, and in-services.  
20. Administer patient quality care in a considerate, respectful manner.  
21. Communicate with ESRD Network  
22. Complete and submit all ESRD Network reporting requirements. (CROWNWEB, QIPS)  
23. Distribute and collection of patient satisfaction survey and KDQOL data input and analyzing data.  
24. Coordinate and arrange for annual CAHPS survey.

**Standards of Caring Behavior:**  
1. On all occasions, to approach the patients, families and all visitors in a courteous, friendly manner with respect to their rights and concerns.  
2. To reduce patients, families and visitors anxieties by introducing self, explaining all procedures and possible delays in schedule, orienting them to the facility, and maintaining a neat, professional appearance.  
3. To converse with patients and their families to ascertain any specific problems that need attention and refers them to appropriate sources when indicated: i.e. Physician, Administrator, Nurse, Dietitian and Social Worker.  
4. To maintain the confidentiality and privacy of all patients by providing an area for confidential conversation and screening when necessary.  
5. In general, demonstrates Caring Behaviors through making eye contact, smiling, initiating conversation and sharing a genuine concern for the situation.

**Physical, Emotional and Sensory Requirements:**  
1. Must be able to cope with mental and emotional stress of the position.  
2. Must function independently, have flexibility, personal integrity and the ability to work effectively with the patients, staff, family members, visitors and support regulatory agencies.  
3. Must be in good general health and demonstrate emotional stability.  
4. Must demonstrate a caring attitude and be able to relate to and work with the ill, disabled, elderly, emotionally upset, and at time hostile people within the facility.  
5. Must adhere to dress code and maintain a high level of personal hygiene and cleanliness.  
6. Ability to read, write, understand and speak English and basic math skills in a clear and concise manner.  
7. Must have communication and interpersonal skills to work effectively with a wide variety of individuals

**Job Qualifications:**

* Hold a master's degree in social work with a specialization in clinical practice from a school of social work accredited by the Council on Social Work Education; or
* Have 2 years of social work experience, 1 year of which in a dialysis or transplant program prior to 9/1/1976, and a consultative relationship with a social worker meeting the above requirements
* State license in Clinical Social Work
* Strong interviewing skills for patient evaluation, problem-solving, and recording
* Possess strong analytical skills to assist patients in problem-solving and resolution
* Capable of communicating clearly and effectively with all types of physically and mentally challenged patients and their families
* Professional, flexible, and a team player

**Compensation**

* Salary - $40 per hour depending on experience
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Dental Insurance
* 401(k)
* Vision insurance
* Life insurance
* Disability insurance
* Other

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $40.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* On call

Experience:

* Social work: 1 year (Required)
* Dialysis: 1 year (Required)

Language:

* Spanish (Preferred)

title: Power & Renewables Analyst
description:
Power & Renewables Analyst


**Requisition ID:** 47059
**Business Unit:** Fitch Solutions
**Category:** Credit Analysis & Research
**Location:**New York, NY, US
**Date Posted:** Sep 17, 2024
**Fitch Solutions is currently seeking a Power & Renewables Analyst based out of our New York office.**  


The Power & Renewable Research team produces written and data-centric analysis of company-, technology- and sector-level developments for a global audience of public and private sector clients. Client presentations and advisory research projects also form part of the regular workload.  


**What We Offer:**
* Great development opportunities for someone looking to become a subject matter expert in power markets, renewable technologies and the wider energy transition.
* Potential to get in front of our clients to present research views and assist them with investment projects.
* Develop a holistic ‘connected thinking’ approach to analysis through collaboration with analysts covering different industries undergoing the Energy Transition.

  


**We’ll Count on You To:**
* Take ownership of a suite of region-specific reports, datasets and 10-year forecasts.
* Identify and analyse key power market and renewable trends and articulate the risks and opportunities facing sector stakeholders up and down the value chain.
* Produce insightful and actionable research and contribute to ad hoc reports and special projects as you become a subject matter expert.
* Interact with and support our global sales team and with clients to communicate our industry views and drive engagement with our data.
* Support team leaders in the development of new research initiatives evolving with the industry.

  


**What You Need to Have:**
* Bachelor’s degree with a focus on Energy, Economics, Finance, International Relations or a related field.
* Relevant experience in power markets, renewable technology related analysis and research, or at least demonstrable interest and a willingness to learn in these fields.
* Demonstrable ability to solve problems using critical, rational and creative thinking.
* Strong writing and numeracy skills are essential; Microsoft Excel and Powerpoint skills also desirable

  


**What Would Make You Stand Out:**
* Existing knowledge of power market dynamics, electricity prices, transmission grids, power storage, renewables and broader topics such as decarbonisation.
* Ability to write clearly and concisely, while being able to convey key points effectively.
* Ability to work as part of a larger team and being willing to take on projects at short notice

  


**Why Fitch?**  


At Fitch Group, the combined power of our global perspectives is what differentiates us. Our global network of colleagues comes together to accomplish things greater than they ever could alone.  


Every team member is essential to our business and each perspective is critical to our success. We embrace a diverse culture that encourages a free exchange of ideas, guaranteeing your voice will be heard and your work will have an impact, regardless of seniority.  


We are building incredible things at Fitch and we invite you to join us on our journey.  


Fitch Solutions is a leading provider of insights, data and analytics. It informs investment strategies, strengthens risk management capabilities and helps identify strategic opportunities. Its analysts, lawyers, journalists and economists offer in-depth views on credit markets, credit risk, ESG, developed and emerging markets, industry sectors and individual credits.
Fitch Group is a global leader in financial information services with operations in more than 30 countries. Wholly owned by the Hearst Corporation, we are comprised of three main businesses: Fitch Ratings | Fitch Solutions | Fitch Learning.  


For more information please visit our websites  


Fitch is committed to providing global securities markets with objective, timely, independent and forward-looking credit opinions. To protect Fitch’s credibility and reputation, our employees must take every precaution to avoid conflicts of interests or any appearance of a conflict of interest.  


Fitch Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluatequalified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law.  


**FOR NEW YORK ROLES ONLY:** Expected base pay rates for the role will be between $65,000 and $75,000 per year. Actual salaries will be determined on an individualized basis and may vary based on factors including but not limited to education, training, experience, past performance, and other job-related factors. Base pay is one part of Fitch’s total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, discretionary bonuses, long-term incentives, and other benefits sponsored by Fitch.  


#LI-RA1 #LI-SOLUTIONS #LI-HYBRID  

  

**Nearest Major Market:** Manhattan
  

**Nearest Secondary Market:** New York City
company_description: Fitch Solutions provides data, research and analytics that help clients excel at managing their credit and financial risk through meaningful market insights.

The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing office activities and financial tasks to ensure smooth daily operations. This person must be meticulous and an organized bookkeeper to manage the financial records of our small business. The ideal candidate will be proficient in QuickBooks online and other cloud-based accounting software applications with a strong understanding of accounting principles. They will be responsible for routine report generation on financials and processing transactions daily to reconcile accounts receivable, accounts payable, and varied statements to our ledger.

**Key Responsibilities:**

● **Financial Data Entry:** Accurately input financial transactions into our accounting software, including invoices, payments, and bank statements.

● **Accounts Receivable:** Manage accounts receivable, including sending invoices, tracking payments, and following up on overdue balances via email, text, and direct phone calls.

● **Accounts Payable:** Process accounts payable, including reviewing and approving vendor invoices, cutting checks, and managing vendor relationships.

● **Bank Reconciliation:** Reconcile bank statements monthly to ensure accuracy and identify any discrepancies. Closing the reconciliation within five business days of the month.

● **Payroll Processing:** Prepare payroll, including calculating wages, deductions, and taxes, and ensuring timely payment to employees.

● **Financial Reporting:** Generate financial reports, such as income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements, to provide insights into the business's financial performance.

● **Tax Preparation:** Assist with tax preparation by gathering necessary documents and providing information to the accountant.

● **Data Management:** Maintain accurate and organized financial records, ensuring compliance with accounting standards and regulations.

● **Administrative Tasks:** Manage administrative tasks related to bookkeeping, such as filing, scanning, and data backup.

**Qualifications:**

● **Proficiency in QuickBooks/Cloud Based Accounting Software:** Strong working knowledge of QuickBooks accounting software is essential.

● **Accounting Fundamentals:** Understanding of basic accounting principles, including debits, credits, and the accounting cycle.

● **Diligence:** Meticulous diligence is crucial for accurate financial recordkeeping.

● **Organizational Skills:** Ability to prioritize tasks, manage deadlines, and work efficiently in a challenging environment.

● **Reporting Capability:** Ability to Microsoft Office/Google software to develop/present reports.

● **Critical Thinking Skills:** Capacity to identify and resolve financial issues or discrepancies.

● **Communication Skills:** Effective communication skills, both verbal and written, to interact with team members, clients, and vendors.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

● Experience working in a small business environment.

● Experience working in a start-up expanding business.

● Experience preparing and submitting tax filing and business financial reports to regulatory agencies i.e., IRS, DEP, etc.

● Certification in QuickBooks online or other cloud-based accounting software packages.

**Additional Qualifications**

● Bachelor’s degree in business administration/accounting or a related field.

● Alternately have 5 to 8 years’ experience of accounting industry related experience.

● 3-5 years of experience in office management and/or consumer goods distribution depot management.

● Strong organizational and time management skills.

● Excellent communication and people skills.

● Excellent orientation to detail and scrupulous about tracking dollars and cents.

● Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite/Google Application.

● Experience with Pet Meadow Path, Shopify, and other web-based industry software.

title: Production Assembler
description:
**Job Brief**
-------------



Production Assembler



**About Air Techniques, Inc.**  

Founded in 1962, Air Techniques, Inc. set out to manufacture first-rate products for the dental industry. Over 62 years later, Air Techniques has grown from a small company into a successful corporation. At our New York headquarters, we design and build two main groups of products: utility room and digital imaging products. Our products are manufactured in a vertically integrated factory where compliance with the Food and Drug Administration Good Manufacturing Practices is paired with stringent Quality Standards. In-house engineering staff designs our products for the dental market. We are proud to maintain the ISO-13485 registration certification which reinforces our pledge to quality and customer satisfaction. At Air Techniques, we have earned our reputation in the dental industry through our commitment to quality and ensuring customer satisfaction. We are proud that Air Techniques represents superior quality to dealers and dentists worldwide.



 This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed. This position is required to follow any other instructions and to perform any other duties requested by the supervisor.


**Position Description:**



Responsible for performing repetitive bench or line assembly operations to produce medical device products, for primarily the Dental industry, such as air compressors and vacuums with limited supervision.


**Essential Functions and Responsibilities:**


* Produce complicated components needed, subassemblies, and final assemblies in related area to blueprint and work instructions.
* Work under the direction of supervisors, or more experienced personnel, with minimal supervision.
* Setup and operate all equipment and tools in related area to produce product to specification requirements.
* Must follow all environmental policies and procedures when working with chemicals and substances.
* Must follow all safety procedures and wear required P.P.E. at all times.
* Maintain high quality and production standards and keep records accurately.
* Assist lower classification personnel and be willing to cross train as needed.
* Understand and use measuring equipment.
* Setup and operate necessary equipment in related area.
* Complete all necessary paperwork and records required.
* Produce and measure product to insure compliance to engineering drawings and work instruction specifications.
* Maintain clean, neat, and safe work area.
* Assists with the training of co-workers.
* Maintain a clean, neat, and healthy work environment.
* Work safely following all safety procedures.
* Willing to work overtime as required.
* Performs other duties, as assigned


**Core Skill Requirements:**


* Thoroughness: shows attention to detail and takes great care.
* Teamwork Orientation: work cooperatively with others on a team.
* Time Management and attendance: the ability to work quickly and methodically, dedicated to getting the job done.
* Technical Capacity: knowledgeable and having the skills to perform specialized tasks.
* Ability to perform basic assembly functions and possess the skills needed to use basic hand tools
* Must follow verbal and/or written instructions and take direction from their supervisor or lead person.
* Understanding of basic mechanical and electrical drawings, in the form of Work Instructions, Method Sheets and Bills of Material.
* Capability to communicate clearly both written and verbally.
* Must be able to lift up to 40 lbs on a consistent basis.
* Ability to maintain an organized and neat work area.

**Work Experience Requirements:**


* 2-3 years of experience as an Electro-mechanical assembler in a dental, medical or military equipment company preferred.
* Knowledge and use of basic assembly hand tools i.e. screw drivers, wrenches, drills, etc.


**Education Requirements:**


* High School Diploma or equivalent required or related experience.


**Salary:**



$16.00- $18.00 per hour



Please note that the actual compensation may vary from posting based on geographic location, work experience, education and/or skill level.

title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)
description:
Every BCBA needs something else.



Our support is individualized to YOU!



Work side by side with our Clinical Director who is a BCBA for over 20 years and get the respect you deserve.


**Enjoy Our Amazing Benefits That Include**


* Health Insurance

Links ABA is dedicated to hiring qualified, caring BCBA therapists to provide the highest standard of care to children with Autism. Links ABA offers some of the most exciting and rewarding positions in the industry. We understand the importance of working with each therapist and their interests individually. We realize that for a therapist to do their best in helping a child reach their highest levels of performance, we must do our best to help make their job as rewarding as possible.



We strongly value work-life balance!



It's easy to say those words but to actually do it is what makes us different.



It starts with taking away ALL administrative tasks that BCBAs hate to deal with and keeping your travel time minimum. We also focus on giving you the cases that fit your skillset and fits your comfort zone.



Everything is software-based, flexible hours, with the ability to make your own schedule. Bonus opportunities are available as well. Our goal is, that you should love what you do!



Your job at Links ABA as a Board Certified Behavior Anaylst/BCBA:

* Applicants well-suited to this position will be highly organized, self-motivated, flexible, positive, and work well in teams.

* Bonus opportunities

title: Retail Sales Associate
description:
LOVE TO HELP OTHERS LOOK AND FEEL GORGEOUS? JOIN OUR TEAM!


Are you passionate about people and beauty? Are you naturally confident and outgoing? Does the idea of earning excellent commission drive you? If so, you need to join our team!


Turn your passion into a rewarding role with our growing team at European Wax Center! We're in the business of Revealing Beautiful Skin, and with your help, we'll give guests a reason to walk in, and strut out.

*Here’s why you should come work with us:*

* We believe that happy employees make happy guests, so you can expect a fun, upbeat, flexible work environment.
* We believe work should be interesting, so we’ll help you continuously develop new skills.
* We believe in promoting from within, so you’ll have opportunities for advancement.

*Here’s what you need to bring to the table:*

* An upbeat attitude & commitment to delighting our guests and—of course—having fun while being awesome!
* Educating guests on the benefits of waxing and our wax packages.
* Scheduling and confirming appointments and managing guest flow throughout the day.
* Ability to work in a fun, fast-paced environment.
* Ability to work a flexible schedule including nights and weekends, because that’s when we’re busy.
* As a Beauty Advisor/Sales Associate, you'll have the drive and dedication to hit the ground running. Our comprehensive training will provide you with all the tools you will need and to show our appreciation, we offer great pay and performance incentives throughout your career!

*Benefits:*

* Paid training provided for the right candidate.
* Competitive pay that consists of: bi-weekly, no cap, commission and an hourly base
* Health, Dental, and Vision Benefits for full time associates
* 401K Planning
* Paid sick time off
* PTO on your birthday!!
* Employee of the month program
* Complimentary, unlimited, eyebrow waxing + discounts on all other waxing services and retail products
* Career growth opportunities (assistant manager, center manager, regional trainer, regional manager)
* A fun, well-managed, successful work environment


About European Wax Center


European Wax Center, Inc. is the largest and fastest-growing franchisor & operator of out-of-home waxing services in the United States providing guests with an unparalleled, professional personal care experience administered by highly trained wax specialists within the privacy of clean, individual waxing suites. European Wax Center, Inc. continues to revolutionize the waxing industry with their innovative Comfort Wax® formulated with the highest quality ingredients to make waxing a more efficient and relatively painless experience. Delivering a


360-degree guest experience, they also offer a collection of proprietary products to help enhance & extend waxing results. Founded in 2004, European Wax Center, Inc. is headquartered in Plano, Texas. Its network includes 944 centers in 45 states as of December 31, 2022. For more information about EWC, visit: http://www.waxcenter.com/careers.

*We are an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants equally without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or disability status.'*


European Wax Center began as a family-owned business. Since 2004, we've provided our guests with a first-class waxing experience centering around:
  

* Our proprietary Comfort Wax®
* Private waxing suites
* A crisp, clean environment
* And the most professionally trained estheticians in the industry


From day one, we've been putting our values into action to delight our guests with an exceptional waxing experience.

title: Business Analyst
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Technical Business Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will manage product development, analyze business requirements, and translate them into technical specifications. You will play a key role in defining the product roadmap, driving enhancements, creating user stories, and ensuring a high-quality user experience. Additionally, you will collect and analyze user feedback to refine the product roadmap and provide support to data producers and consumers on our marketplace. Also, Plan and coordinate various testing activities, including User Acceptance Testing (UAT), to ensure that the product meets the required standards. Track and manage defects, working with the development team to resolve issues. A high level of experience with Collibra, including its data model and functionalities, and proficiency in SQL are essential for this role.

Business Requirements Analysis: Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and analyze business requirements. Translate business needs into technical specifications that guide development. Raise any further questions with the product lead and/or business stakeholders

•Enhancements and Stories: Identify opportunities for product enhancements. Write detailed user stories and acceptance criteria for development.

•User Acceptance Testing (UAT): Plan and coordinate UAT activities to ensure that the product meets user requirements and expectations. Facilitate UAT sessions with business stakeholders and users.

•User Experience (UX): Collaborate with UI/UX designers to create intuitive and user-friendly interfaces. Focus on optimizing the user experience at every touchpoint.

•User Feedback: Collect and analyze feedback from users. Reflect user feedback in the product roadmap to ensure continuous improvement.

•Support for Data Producers and Consumers: Provide comprehensive support to data producers and consumers on the data marketplace. Communicate roles, responsibilities, and "how-tos" effectively.

* Business-Facing Skills:

oExcellent communication and interpersonal skills.

oAbility to interact effectively with business stakeholders.

* Business Literacy:

oUnderstanding of business processes and terminology.

oAbility to bridge the gap between business and technology.

* Business Analysis (BA) Skills:

oProficient in requirements gathering, analysis, and documentation.

oStrong problem-solving and analytical abilities.

* Technical Skills:

oHigh level experience with Collibra, including its data model and functionalities, is essential.

oProficiency in SQL is required.

oExperience with tools like Collibra and Starburst.

oFamiliarity with data management and analytics tools.

* Jira:

oProficient in using Jira for managing projects and tracking progress.

* UI/UX:

oUnderstanding of user interface design and user experience principles.

oAbility to work closely with designers to create user-centric solutions.

Job Type: Full-time

title: Behavior Tech
description:
**Company Overview:**



Join our dedicated team committed to providing high-quality applied behavior analysis (ABA) services to individuals with autism spectrum disorder (ASD) and other developmental disabilities. We are a leading provider of behavioral health services focused on promoting positive behavior change, enhancing skill acquisition, and improving the quality of life for our clients and their families. As a Behavior Technician with our organization, you will have the opportunity to make a meaningful difference in the lives of individuals with special needs while receiving comprehensive training and support.


**Position Overview:** We are seeking compassionate and motivated individuals to join our team as Behavior Technicians. In this role, you will work directly with clients under the supervision of a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) to implement individualized behavior intervention plans and teach essential life skills in various settings, including homes, schools, and community settings. Behavior Technicians play a crucial role in delivering evidence-based interventions, collecting data, and supporting clients in achieving their goals.


**Responsibilities:**


* Implement behavior intervention plans (BIPs) developed by the BCBA to address clients' specific needs and goals.
* Provide one-on-one direct instruction to clients using applied behavior analysis (ABA) techniques, including discrete trial training (DTT), naturalistic teaching strategies, and behavior management techniques.
* Collect data on client progress and behavior using designated data collection tools and methods.
* Assist clients in acquiring and practicing functional skills across various domains, including communication, socialization, self-care, and independent living.
* Foster a supportive and positive learning environment for clients, promoting engagement, motivation, and independence.
* Collaborate with the BCBA and interdisciplinary team members to review client progress, adjust intervention strategies as needed, and ensure consistency across settings.
* Communicate effectively with clients, families, caregivers, and other team members, providing updates on progress and sharing relevant information.
* Participate in ongoing training and professional development opportunities to enhance skills and knowledge in the field of applied behavior analysis.


**Qualifications:**


* Ability to follow instructions, implement behavior intervention plans with fidelity, and collect accurate data.
* Reliable transportation and willingness to travel to clients' homes, schools, or community settings as needed.
* Commitment to upholding ethical standards, maintaining client confidentiality, and promoting a positive and inclusive environment.
* Compassionate, patient, and dedicated to supporting individuals with special needs in reaching their full potential.


**Benefits:**


* Beginning $30/Hr


*Equal Opportunity Employer: We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace and welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds.*

description:
A Growing Homecare Company is currently seeking compassionate and experienced **Nurse Practitioners** to do home visits for our patients in all boroughs especially Manhattan and the Bronx.

Our goal is to provide superior, compassionate home care workers and healthcare services for elderly and disabled individuals in the comfort and dignity of their homes. We work closely with hospitals, physicians, and private caregivers for hire to develop and coordinate an individual plan of care while maintaining their independence at home.

The Nurse Practitioner is responsible for providing professional nursing care to patients requiring in-home care.

**Responsibilities**

* Assess the patient/family situation for nursing and health-related problems.
* Educate the patient/family regarding the disease process, self-care techniques, and prevention strategies.
* Document on a timely basis, all nursing services provided to patients as well as periodic reports to coordinate care and remain in compliance with state/federal regulations.
* Instruct and supervise patients, caregivers, and home health aides in aspects of patient care as appropriate.
* Perform other related duties as assigned.

**Qualifications**

* 1-2 years of experience in Homecare or Long-term care preferred.
* New York State Nurse Practitioner License
* Strong Assessment and Clinical Skills
* Bilingual in Spanish preferred.
* Professional Liability Insurance
* Able to drive an automobile in good working order and available for use in the field.

title: Registered Dietitian (3 days onsite 2 days remote)
description:
***Join Our Team of Remote Hybrid Registered Dietitians at NutraCo!***

Are you a compassionate and driven Registered Dietitian seeking a rewarding career in clinical nutrition?

NutraCo, a leading provider of Clinical Nutrition Services to Long Term Care facilities across the United States, has an exciting opportunity for you!

We are currently seeking a motivated individual to join our ***Remote Hybrid Registered Dietitian*** **Team;** **.\\*** Please apply to find out more!\\*

***Why Choose NutraCo?***

At NutraCo, we pride ourselves on delivering compassionate care with respect and dignity to residents in Long Term Care facilities nationwide. When you join our team, you become part of a supportive environment where your contributions are valued and acknowledged.

*Here are just a few reasons to consider a career with NutraCo:*

* **Room for Growth:** We offer development opportunities and upward mobility within the company, empowering you to advance your career.
* **Collaborative Environment:** Join a network of dedicated dietitians who support and interact with each other, fostering a sense of community and teamwork.
* **Valued Professionalism:** Your work as a professional is highly valued and acknowledged at NutraCo, where your voice is heard, and feedback is encouraged and supported.
* **Clear Expectations**: We provide clear goals, directives, and feedback, ensuring you have the resources and support needed to excel in your role.
* **Opportunity for Relocation:** With multiple locations throughout the United States, NutraCo offers the flexibility to relocate if needed, allowing you to grow with us wherever life takes you.

***Responsibilities:***

As a Registered Dietitian at NutraCo, you will have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the lives of our residents by addressing nutrition-related health problems through clinical nutrition treatment.

*Your responsibilities will include:*

* Providing compassionate care and support to residents, focusing on their nutritional needs and well-being.
* Collaborating with other dietitians and facility clinical team to deliver personalized nutrition plans and ensure the highest level of care.
* Completing necessary clinical assessments, charting within the EMR system, and attending meetings to discuss resident care and progress.
* Conducting meal rounds if/as needed, completing sanitation audits, and signing off on dietary menus to maintain quality standards.

***Requirements:***

*To succeed in this role, you must meet the following requirements:*

* Minimum on year experience in long term care post dietetic internship.
* Registered Dietitian with the Commission on Dietetic Registration (CDR) ***Note:*** *Registered Dietitian Eligible (RDE)* ***not*** *accepted for remote positions*
* Must have a full home office including high speed internet, a designated working area without distractions and computer to work remotely for NutraCo.
* State licensure guidelines must be met, along with facility vaccination requirements if onsite visits are required.
* Strong communication skills, effective teamwork, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, highly regulated environment.

***Salary and Benefits Offered Include:***

* Remote with onsite requirements salaries start at $70,000yr. DOE
* 100% remote position salaries start at $50,000yr. DOE
* Comprehensive Benefits Package Options Include:
* Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance options,
* Company Managed 401(k) Program
* Paid Time Off
* Company Paid Holidays
* Continuing Education Credits
* Life and Disability Insurance Options
* Employee Discounts.

*Are you a dedicated Registered Dietitian looking to join a supportive team and make a difference in the lives of residents?* ***We want to hear from you!***

***Apply now*** *to join NutraCo and embark on a rewarding career journey in clinical nutrition!*

title: Catering Specialist
description:
As a Catering Specialist, you are the “owner” of all things catering within your restaurant. This includes coordinating successful order preparation, set up and delivery, recruiting, hiring, training and scheduling delivery drivers, partnering with


your RM and RCSM to build catering sales from the restaurant level, and


administrating all client contact.


Your Role as a Catering Specialist


Additionally, you should have:


* Knowledge of catering menu and rewards
* Passion for our food and offerings
* A “Customer first” attitude
* Be a leader within the restaurant, representing the six elements of success
* Proficiency in computer skills

Qualifications

* Completion of Team Lead training
* Must have a Vehicle.
* Must be 18 years or older.
* Delivery Driver Agreement signed and on file with Driver’s license, and proof of insurance
* Full time/day and nighttime availability
* Prior experience in a management and/or customer facing role
* Adheres to uniform standards

Daily Responsibilities


Beginning of Shift:


* Verify computer/email and Monkey Media have been checked and all orders for the

day have been printed.


* Review food preparation needs with cook and/or team members and Manager
* Double check any pre staged paper products, completing if needed, and setting up

any new orders


* Review the day’s delivery schedule with Manager on Duty and delivery drivers

(including confirmation with Deliver That if applicable)


Mid Shift:


* Assist in preparation and packaging of orders
* Validate orders are complete, using a highlighter to double check all items to be

included in order with the prep sheet.


* Manage deployment of delivery drivers, and the pickup of any pickup orders
* Assist with deliveries as needed, riding along with driver for all orders over 75 guests

End of Shift:


* Verify all orders for next day have been printed
* Complete Pre-calls/Confirmations for all next day orders
* Complete Post-calls/Follow Ups for all previous day orders
* Set up pre staged paper products for all next day orders
* Review food prep needs with RM and cook for next day orders
* Review delivery schedule with RM and drivers for next day orders, calling in additional

drivers and requesting drivers with Deliver That if applicable.


Weekly Responsibilities

* Partner with RM in recruiting and hiring delivery drivers as needed. CS to conduct.

initial new driver interview, RM to conduct second interview and make final decision.


* Coordinate orientation and training for all new delivery drivers
* Minimum 1 ride along per driver on delivery per week, evaluating presentation and

drivers conduct during delivery.


* Submitting pre and post call tracker to DM weekly
* Minimum 3 chip chats or marketing blitzes per week, submitting business cards to

RCSM and conducting follow up emails and/or calls to new prospects.


* Collection of business cards from Fishbowl on Fridays
* General communication to restaurant team of all catering initiatives and updates
* Resolution of all Catering Customer related VOG and guest concerns

Working at QDOBA is about more than just food. It’s about working together to accomplish something great with the people we care about. We bring this to life by supporting our local communities, protecting the world’s resources, and hiring flavorful people who personify our three cultural pillars of hospitality, positivity, and performance.


Pay: $15.50 / hour

* Commission pay
* Tips


Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Vision insurance
* 401(k) matching


Job Type: fulltime, parttime


Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekend availability


Education: High school degree

**Visit** Gardenview Home Care Careers **to submit your application.**


**Or contact us at:**


**Phone:** 609-793-8100


**Email:** info@gardenviewhhc.com



Gardenview Home Care is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Per Diem Urgent Care Nurse Practitioner NP / Physician Assistant PA
description:
At **Doral Health & Wellness**, we take pride in being a multi-specialty facility with five state-of-the-art locations. Our top priority is to provide exceptional care to our patients, and it serves as the foundation of our work. We are committed to delivering integrated, high-level, and high-quality healthcare services that align with our mission and values.

Our unwavering dedication to patient satisfaction is reflected in our online reviews, which demonstrate the positive experiences shared by those we serve. We understand the importance of ensuring that every patient receives the best possible care, and we strive to exceed their expectations.

Join our team at Doral Health & Wellness as a **Per Diem** **Urgent Care Nurse Practitioner or Physician Assistant**, where you can be part of a dynamic healthcare environment that values excellence and patient-centered care.

**Responsibilities:**

* Diagnose and treat acute, episodic, or chronic illnesses
* Prescribe all necessary medications and treatments
* Perform comprehensive physical examinations of patients
* Develop and implement patient management policies and procedures
* Facilitate referrals to other healthcare professionals and medical facilities
* Communicate with collaborating physician or specialist regarding patient care

**Qualifications:**

* Master's degree or higher in Advanced Practice Registered Nursing (APRN)
* Current state Nurse Practitioner / Physician Assistant license, valid and in good standing
* Nationally certified as a Nurse Practitioner / Physician Assistant with prescriptive authority
* Knowledge of medical terminology and pharmacology
* Excellent communication skills and ability to work well with a team, especially in stressful situations
* Ability to work well with a team
* Ability to maintain professionalism with patients and teammates

**Compensation:**

* Pay rate: up to $90 / hour

Job Types: Part-time, Per diem

Pay: $90.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Urgent Care

Experience:

* Urgent Care: 1 year (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Own malpractice Insurance (Preferred)
* Medicare/Medicaid Provider ID number (Preferred)
* NYS Nurse Practitioner license (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Per Diem Home Care Nurse Practitioner NP Bronx up to $130 per Visit
description:
A Growing Homecare Company is currently seeking compassionate and experienced **Nurse Practitioners** to do home visits for our patients in all boroughs especially Manhattan and the Bronx.

Our goal is to provide superior, compassionate home care workers and healthcare services for elderly and disabled individuals in the comfort and dignity of their homes. We work closely with hospitals, physicians, and private caregivers for hire to develop and coordinate an individual plan of care while maintaining their independence at home.

The Nurse Practitioner is responsible for providing professional nursing care to patients requiring in-home care.

**Responsibilities**

* Assess the patient/family situation for nursing and health-related problems.
* Educate the patient/family regarding the disease process, self-care techniques, and prevention strategies.
* Document on a timely basis, all nursing services provided to patients as well as periodic reports to coordinate care and remain in compliance with state/federal regulations.
* Instruct and supervise patients, caregivers, and home health aides in aspects of patient care as appropriate.
* Perform other related duties as assigned.

**Qualifications**

* 1-2 years of experience in Homecare or Long-term care preferred.
* New York State Nurse Practitioner License
* Strong Assessment and Clinical Skills
* Bilingual in Spanish preferred.
* Professional Liability Insurance
* Able to drive an automobile in good working order and available for use in the field.

**Compensation**

* Initial assessment visit = $130.00
* Reassessment visit = $100.00
* Resumption of Care visit = $100.00
* Supervisory visit = $80.00.

*\\*\\*Per Diem positions available.*

Job Types: Part-time, Per diem

Pay: Up to $130.00 per hour

* Home Health

Language:

* Spanish (Preferred)

title: First Responder / Lead Home Care Professional
description:
Are you someone who thrives on motivation, with a deep commitment to supporting others and optimizing operational effectiveness? Do you view caregiving as a valued profession, deserving of respect and acknowledgment for its significance? Do you advocate for seniors' rights to age gracefully in their own homes, receiving top-notch care? If this resonates with you, Home Matters Caregiving might just offer the perfect fit. Come join us in our quest to deliver compassionate care and assistance to those who require it.



Company Overview:



Home Matters Caregiving stands as a premier provider of in-home care services, committed to empowering professional caregivers to deliver purpose-driven care to seniors residing in their homes. Specializing in delivering top-tier, individualized home care solutions, we prioritize aiding individuals in preserving their independence and enhancing their quality of life.



Our consistent dedication to excellence has earned us the esteemed title of "Employer of Choice" by our caregiving team for the past four years, and "Provider of Choice" by our clients for six of the past seven years.

  


**Job Description:**



We are seeking a reliable candidate who is equally passionate about caregiving as they are about business, to assume the position of First Responder / Lead Home Care Professional. This role is a great way of getting your feet wet in business and management while continuing to provide the best care for seniors within our home care agency.

  




This role is vital to delivering top-notch care to our clients and leading our team of caregivers. The preferred candidate should be capable of working independently, showing flexibility, maintaining personal integrity, and collaborating effectively with clients, family members and staff.

  




**Responsibilities:**



 Office Administration:



§ Organize and schedule appointments, meetings, and travel arrangements as needed.



§ Matching and scheduling the best combination of client and caregivers



§ Track check-in and check-out and take mitigation action as required



 Human Resources Support:



§ Assist with recruitment efforts, including posting job openings, screening resumes, and scheduling interviews.



§ Onboard new hires and facilitate training sessions for office staff.



§ Maintain employee records.


 Clients Relations:



§ Assist in initial assessments and create care plans for clients.


§ Provide direct care in the home setting with meal prep, ADL’s and more (see Home Care professional job description)



§ Caregiving shifts can range from 4 hours to 12-hour shifts.



§ Provide administrative support to our office team in the event shift coverage is not needed at that time.



§ Serve as a point of contact for clients and their families, addressing inquiries and concerns promptly and professionally.



§ Coordinate client schedules and communicate with caregivers to ensure optimal care delivery.



§ Maintain confidentiality of client information and uphold privacy standards.



**Qualifications:**



§ Proficiency in office software applications (e.g., Microsoft Office suite, Google Workspace, WellSky / ClearCare).



§ Strong organizational and multitasking skills, with attention to detail.



§ Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.



§ Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.


**Experience:**



§ Caregiving: 2 years (Required)



§ Valid driver’s license and reliable vehicle



§ Strong communication skills, both verbal and written



§ Strong work ethic and compassion for the senior population



§ Flexibility to work various shifts, including evenings, weekends, and holidays



**Benefits:**


* Competitive salary based on experience.
* Opportunities for professional development and growth within the company.
* Comprehensive benefits package, including employer matched 401K and paid time off.
* Rewarding work environment focused on making a difference in the lives of clients and their families


Join our team as a First Responder / Lead Home Care Professional and take your career to the next level.



**Note:** This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the position. Other duties may be assigned as necessary to meet the needs of the company.

title: Director of Nursing-RN
description:
Our residents hold a special place as cherished members of our extended family.  


Choosing a dependable team of caregivers, committed to their promises, is a significant and difficult life decision for any family. As a collective, we take pride in being a sanctuary where individuals in our community can discover compassionate support along their health journey. As a **Di****r****e****c****t****or** **of** **N****u****r****s****i****n****g****-Registered Nurse-RN** on our team, you will make a meaningful impact on the lives of our extended family. In turn, we are dedicated to ensuring our team of caregivers feel the same compassion provided to the residents.  


If any part of this message resonates with you, then **Complete Care** wants to hear from you!  


**Di****r****e****c****t****or** **of** **N****u****r****s****i****n****g****-Registered Nurse-RN** Qualifications & Responsibilities:

* Associates or Bachelor’s Degree in Nursing
* Current, Unencumbered New Jersey Registered Nurse License
* Previous long-term care experience as a Director of Nursing is preferred, but not required.
* Prior experience managing staff required.
* Ensure that all nursing personnel in our facility comply with established standards, practices, and regulatory requirements for the highest quality of resident care.
* Overseeing the implementation of nursing department budgets in coordination with the facility administration.

**Di****r****e****c****t****or** **of** **N****u****r****s****i****n****g****-Registered Nurse-RN** Schedules & Benefits:

* Opportunities for advancement.
  


**Complete Care** is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Case Manager
description:
**Position Title**: Case Manager

**Reports to**: Director, Assistant Director or Supervisor- Case Management Unit

**Catchment Area**: East 59th Street to East 142nd Street, Fifth Ave to East River + Roosevelt Island

**Status**: Full-Time

**Compensation**: $60,000 annually or $65,000 for those who hold a Master’s degree

**About CBN**: Carter Burden Network promotes the well-being of older adults 60 and older through a continuum of services, advocacy, arts and culture, health and wellness and volunteer programs, all oriented to individual, family and community needs. We are dedicated to supporting the efforts of older people to live safely and with dignity.

For further information about CBN, please visit www.carterburdennetwork.org

Carter Burden Network is partially funded by NYC Aging (formally NYC Department for the Aging)

**Position Summary**: CBN’s Case Management Unit serves homebound older adults in Upper Manhattan and Roosevelt Island and is searching for Case Managers for our team who will provide key client supports. Case Managers will assess the needs of older adults, provide information on appropriate services and programs, and make referrals for services as needed. They will also assist with the collection of documents, complete necessary paperwork for benefits, and provide linkages with other service providers. The Case Managers will work directly with the Case Management Unit Program Director, Supervisors, Intake Coordinator, and interface with organization staff, partners and subcontractors.

**Primary Responsibilities**:

 Maintain an ongoing caseload of 65 clients and maintain appropriate contact as per NYC Department for the Aging requirements

 Conduct comprehensive assessments of clients, develop care plans, and work with clients, families, caregivers, and other professionals in coordinating the care plan. This will include, but not be limited to, coordination of entitlements, referral for supportive services, advocacy and follow-up regarding additional needed services, and ongoing monitoring and reassessment of care with modifications in plan.

 Complete approximately 1,500 case management hours per year

 Maintain compliance with NYC Aging regulations regarding service provision, deadlines, and documentation

 Utilize online platform to maintain detailed client records including case notes, referrals, and client assessments

 Participate in weekly and agency-wide staff meetings, agency events, in-services trainings and conferences

 Participate in case conferences as an advocate for clients as needed

 Attend the required number of trainings as outlined by NYC Aging standards

 Meet with Case Management Unit Director, Assistant Director or Supervisor once weekly for formal supervision and at other times as indicated

 Exhibit awareness of agency and community resources and effectively utilize both in the course of working with staff and clients

 Make referrals to relevant organizations and agencies to assist clients and improve overall quality of life

 Initiate and maintain contact with representatives of the community and government agencies on behalf of clients

 Provide crisis intervention as needed

 Exhibit ability to incorporate Mission Statement philosophy in work with staff and clients

 Exhibit ability to work well within agency and engage appropriately with co-workers within and outside of the Case Management Unit

 Accept other assignments, as appropriate, to meet the needs of the program and individual clients

**Required Qualifications**: MSW/LMSW or Bachelor’s degree with relevant experience. Spanish or Mandarin fluency highly desirable. The Case Manager should have an affinity for working with older adults, have strong interpersonal skills, and work well with clients and colleagues. They should be good communicators with strong written skills, attention to detail, and a facility with data input. The Case Managers should have the capacity to manage a caseload, meet deadlines, and travel, as necessary, to meet with clients in their homes on the Upper East Side, Roosevelt Island, and/or East Harlem.

**CBN offers a generous benefits package for Full Time employees, which includes:**

 Health and dental coverage with 100% employer-paid options

 Generous PTO including 15 vacation days, 4 personal days, and 10 sick days accrued annually, in addition to holidays

 Retirement plan with 3% employer contribution plus up to 2% match after one year of service

**To apply**: Please submit a cover letter and resume to jurenkoa@carterburdennetwork.org

It is the policy of CBN to provide equal employment opportunity to qualified individuals for employment or advancement without discrimination because of race, color, religion, creed, political association, ancestry, gender, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, domestic violence or stalking victim status, national origin, citizen, age, veteran status, pregnancy, handicap disability, genetic, genetic characteristics, or other protected status.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $60,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person
