title: Director, Creative Services, NBC & Telemundo New York
description:
**Company Description**  

We create world-class content, which we distribute across our portfolio of film, television, and streaming, and bring to life through our theme parks and consumer experiences. We own and operate leading entertainment and news brands, including NBC, NBC News, MSNBC, CNBC, NBC Sports, Telemundo, NBC Local Stations, Bravo, USA Network, and Peacock, our premium ad-supported streaming service. We produce and distribute premier filmed entertainment and programming through Universal Filmed Entertainment Group and Universal Studio Group, and have world-renowned theme parks and attractions through Universal Destinations & Experiences. NBCUniversal is a subsidiary of Comcast Corporation.


Here you can be your authentic self. As a company uniquely positioned to educate, entertain and empower through our platforms, Comcast NBCUniversal stands for including everyone. Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion initiatives, coupled with our Corporate Social Responsibility work, is informed by our employees, audiences, park guests and the communities in which we live. We strive to foster a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture where our employees feel supported, embraced and heard. Together, we’ll continue to create and deliver content that reflects the current and ever-changing face of the world.

 **Job Description**  

NBC 4 New York is seeking a highly motivated and dynamic Director, Creative Services to lead the Marketing and Creatives Services team. As the flagship duopoly stations of the NBC Owned Television Stations, WNBC and WNJU serve the Tri-State area with an unparalleled commitment to broadcast excellence. The stations feature New York’s largest investigative reporting team (*I-Team/Investiga*) and the station’s weather teams, *Storm Team 4 y La Autoridad en el Tiempo*, are committed to accurate forecasts and keeping the Tri-State region viewers informed and safe.


Responsibilities:

* Lead and manage the creative team, overseeing the day-to-day functions and production schedules for the department. This includes creative assets across all platforms: on air, digital, streaming and out of home.
* Holds strong relationships and works closely with the teams at our sister station, Telemundo 47, as well as the HQ, NBC network and syndicators on all projects.
* Work with, anticipate needs for, and share ideas with content leads and creators in News and Digital
* Oversee script writing/review and the workflow process.
* Create effective department workflow for projects, ensuring technical quality and creative output.
* Supervise production of all on-air/video materials.
* Work with producers to develop multi-platform station image campaigns from conception to air.
* Manage studio and out of house shoots as well as working efficiently with external production companies.
* Ensure that marketing initiatives are executed in a manner that supports and extends the brand.
* Supervise and execute the placement of outside media, including detailed delivery of print, cable and digital buys.
* Works closely with Technology & Operationson software and hardware upgrades and needs; act as lead on workflow and process transitions introduced by HQ

**This position is also responsible for developing strategies and plans to define brand on air and off channel. Working with field research, candidate must come with ideas to build awareness and drive consumption. Must have strong knowledge of outside media landscape. This position will report to the VP, Marketing and Creative Services to develop and execute promotional strategy.**

  

  

**Qualifications**  

* Bachelor’s Degree (preferably in marketing, advertising, communications, or finance) or equivalent work in same field.
* A minimum of 7-10 years local Television marketing and promotion experience.
* Candidate will oversee the daily operations of the creative team and must be a strong leader with a passion for coaching and communication. Previous management experience is essential.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
* Must be able to think conceptually and oversee execution of creative in detail.
* Ability to lead a team to achieve the station objectives.
* Must understand and thrive in a Newsroom culture.
* Strong understanding of technology, shooting and editing equipment, software is required.
* Demonstrate the ability to oversee conceptual assignments and have excellent writing skills, and a keen eye for editing and design.
* Must understand Digital Marketing across established and emerging platforms.
* Must have advanced understanding of FCP, Premiere and After Effects to be able to coach and guide editors and graphic designers.
* Adapts to change rapidly, handles multiple assignments well, functions well under pressure, and reprioritizes quickly without compromising quality.
* Successful candidate is highly organized and excels at planning and executing.
* Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills.
* Must be willing to work in Fort Lee, NJ/New York, NY
* Must be at least 18 years old.
* Must have unrestricted work authorization to work in the United States.
* Salary Range: $100,000 - $185,000

  

**Additional Information**  

NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants  

and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity  

or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual  

orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed  

services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.


If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the  

right to request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your  

ability to use or access nbcunicareers.com as a result of your disability. You can  

request reasonable accommodations by emailing AccessibilitySupport@nbcuni.com.

title: Pharmacy Technician
description:
Job Summary:

To deliver a great customer experience while assisting the Pharmacist in providing medication and other healthcare products to patients/customers accurately and with the highest level of customer care.

Minimum Required Qualifications:  
The minimum required qualifications for this position include, but are not limited to, the following:

* Must be 18 years of age or older.
* Must maintain proper state licensing or certifications.
* Ability to proficiently read, write, speak, analyze, interpret, and understand the English language.
* Ability to perform mathematical functions, including ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions and decimals.
* Ability to stand/walk for the duration of a scheduled shift.
* Ability to fill prescriptions by possessing necessary finger/hand dexterity.
* Ability to identify and distinguish colors, shapes, and sizes.
* Ability to stand, bend, twist, reach, push, pull and regularly lift 25 lbs., and occasionally lift 50 lbs.
* Ability to work in varying temperatures.
* Ability to tolerate dust and chemical agents during routine housekeeping duties
* Ability to interact with Customers in a friendly and helpful way.
* Ability to work cooperatively with others.
* Ability to work all assigned work schedules and comply with all time and attendance policies.
* Ability to proficiently use all required computer hardware and software.
* Must preserve confidentiality of information.
* Must comply with all company policies and procedures.

Essential Job Functions:  
Performance of the essential functions of this position require the Associate to possess the minimum qualifications listed above. These functions include, but are not limited to, the following:

* Greet all Customers and provide them with prompt, courteous service and assistance.
* Accurately and quickly collect proper payment and provide proper change.
* Collect and input a patient’s information for processing a prescription.
* Assist the Pharmacist in processing a prescription, counting and labeling a prescription.
* Organize and stock pharmaceuticals as directed by Pharmacist.
* Help customers locate over-the-counter stock.
* Be knowledgeable of products carried in the department.
* Maintain appropriate security of Pharmacy Department.
* Interact with physicians and utilize reference material to gain information on Customers and prescriptions and to resolve any issues that arise.
* Maintain a clean, neat, organized and safe work environment.
* Clean and sanitize all work surfaces, utensils and equipment in accordance with Department of Sanitation and QA standards.
* Keep floor clear of debris and spills.
* Comply with State and Federal drug laws as regulated by the state Board of Pharmacy, HIPAA, the Drug Enforcement Agency and the Food and Drug Administration.
* Exhibit the utmost professionalism and confidentiality when dealing with patients and their health information.
* Regularly lift, pull, push and rotate merchandise that weights 25 lbs. and that occasionally weights up to 50 lbs.
* Stand at work station for duration of scheduled shift, which may exceed 8 hours per day.
* Check prices and be knowledgeable about location of items in the store.
* Promote for sale any current charitable promotions to Customers.
* Understand and adhere to Company shrink guidelines as relates to departmental operations.
* Perform duties in accordance with the Company’s HAZCOM program and adhere to manufacturer’s label instructions for the safe and proper use of all chemical products.
* Perform all duties in accordance with Local, State and Federal regulations as they pertain to the Pharmacy operation.
* Perform all duties in accordance with Company rules, policies, safety requirements, and security standards and all Local, State and Federal health and civil code regulations.
* Utilize and maintain equipment as required by department; report any equipment problems immediately.
* Complete all applicable department training programs.
* Perform all duties in accordance with all ShopRite Service Priorities (Safety, Friendliness, Presentation, and Efficiency).
* Maintain punctual and regular attendance.
* Work overtime as assigned.
* Work cooperatively with others.
* Perform other duties as assigned.

Job Type: Part-time

Schedule:

* 4 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Evening shift

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Experience:

* Pharmacy Technician Experience: 1 year (Preferred)
* Customer Service: 1 year (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Hillsborough, NJ 08844: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Head Medical Oncology Strategy and Portfolio Support
description:
Role Description
Position Purpose* To develop and lead the medical oncology strategy for both Rx and Dx therapeutic areas.
* Responsible for providing best in class support for VMRD, GCD and commercial colleagues, leading a cross functional team.
* Be the global medical face of our oncology program both internally to stake holders and senior leaders and externally to global groups of veterinary oncologists, general practitioners and the industry and large.
* Together with the other GMA leaders, VMRD, GCD and the markets ensure our scientific activities create and deliver unparalleled value to our customers and therefore become a major differentiator, create competitive advantage and contribute to the growth objectives of Zoetis’ CA oncology category.
* Drive global technical excellence in CA oncology clinical studies, medical education and all commercial messaging and with the objective to deliver on the Customer Experience vision to give customers confidence that they’re making the right decision for the animals and their business with our experience and expert guidance, backed by science, across the Continuum of Care.


Primary Responsibilities* Set and lead our medical oncology strategy in collaboration with VMRD, GCD and commercial leadership
* In collaboration with VMRD, GCD and commercial leadership identify, prioritize and help execute an annual program of clinical studies / initiatives to create high impact value messages for key and future brands
* Plan, implement and coordinate above-market KOL management plans (incl. clinical activities and study grants) for category
* Lead global representation and messaging strategy to external scientific and clinical stakeholders (e.g. universities) and at international congresses/fairs
* Plan and coordinate field observation projects to increase understanding and effective use of existing portfolio products & solutions together with customers
* Develop and execute medical strategies and tactics to support market growth objectives by leveraging VET OPs expertise enhancing customer experience
* Deliver and present findings, actionable insights and recommendations to Commercial Leadership
* Contribute to above-market digital strategy & management for category.
* Coordinate needs / input of global markets for phase 3 and phase 4 projects for category.


Organizational Relationships
Internal:* All members of the GMA LT and team
* GCD, VMRD, ZTD
* Cluster Leads, country VPs/GM’s, in market technical leadership


External:* KOL’s and specialists across the globe
* Veterinary practitioners
* Regulatory authorities and AH trade associations
* Experts in similar areas within the animal health industry


Resources Managed* as per annual budget
* ensure ongoing tracking & planning
* frequent international travel


Education and Experience
Level of education and qualification:* Doctorate in Veterinary Medicine (DVM/VMD or equivalent degree) required
* Board Certified in Clinical Oncology by the ACVIM or ECVIM required


Professional experience/capabilities:* At least 5 years of clinical experience in Medical Oncology.
* Broad industry experience and proven leadership
* Experience leading large scale complex projects and managing / influencing teams in diverse locations
* Operating budget management skills
* Experience working with, leading or influencing cross-functional teams in developing and executing technical strategies, programs and/or tactics.
* Proven track-record of leading teams through transformation and having instilled a strong culture of performance and enthusiasm, even in difficult times.
* Demonstrated track-record of operational excellence with a sharp sense of vision that translates into an ability to identify new opportunities
* Experience in managing relations with a wide diversity of stakeholders including (but not limited to) Technical leaders, Enabling and Global functions, customers and senior leaders
* Other specific know-how: Good knowledge of Word, Excel, Power point. Basics of clinical studies conduct and evaluation of scientific publications.


Languages: Fluency in spoken and written English are a must, mastering other languages is a plus.
Skills and Core Behaviors
SKILLS & CAPABILITIES* Lead without authority
* Ability to simplify highly technical issues
* Demonstrates ability to own the medical oncology space: anticipates customer needs and technical/scientific trends in the category. Eager to permanently keep up to date with the latest scientific information in the category and to transfer knowledge
* Ability to influence leadership and to obtain buy-in and credibility
* Capability to influence KOL’s
* Logical and pragmatic thinker
* Good analytical skills
* Excellent communication (‘teacher’) skills; strong verbal and written presentation skills


CORE BEHAVIORS
Our colleagues make the difference* Is a team player and leads project teams with inclusion. Make decisions and take action that brings people along with you
* Is self-aware and learns from mistakes
* Define best practice across and empower others to deliver it


Always do the right thing* Ethical in all dealings with stakeholders
* Accepts personal responsibility without blaming others. Pursue personal growth and learning
* Walks the talk, do things with conviction and commitment – follow it through


Customer obsessed* Knowledgeable about market trends, invests in relationships and networks
* Acts with customer experience in mind always, acts quickly to deliver value to customers
* Seeks continuous improvement to deliver superior services/products


Run it like you own it* Demonstrates ownership and accountability
* Use resources efficiently
* Speaks positively about the company


We are one Zoetis* Aligned with the company mission, working in the best interest of the company
* Shares resources, practices open and direct communication building trust through transparency and honesty
* Engage with colleagues regularly to learn, plan, act, celebrate and look forward


Full time
Regular
Colleague
Any unsolicited resumes sent to Zoetis from a third party, such as an Agency recruiter, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Zoetis mailing address, fax machine or email address, directly to Zoetis employees, or to Zoetis resume database will be considered Zoetis property. Zoetis will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.
Zoetis will consider any candidate for whom an Agency has submitted an unsolicited resume to have been referred by the Agency free of any charges or fees. This includes any Agency that is an approved/engaged vendor but does not have the appropriate approvals to be engaged on a search.
Zoetis is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status or any other protected classification. Disabled individuals are given an equal opportunity to use our online application system. We offer reasonable accommodations as an alternative if requested by an individual with a disability. Please contact Zoetis Colleague Services at zoetiscolleagueservices@zoetis.com to request an accommodation. Zoetis also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act. All applicants must possess or obtain authorization to work in the US for Zoetis. Zoetis retains sole and exclusive discretion to pursue sponsorship for the acquisition or maintenance of nonimmigrant status and employment eligibility, considering factors such as availability of qualified US workers. Individuals requiring sponsorship must disclose this fact. Please note that Zoetis seeks information related to job applications from candidates for jobs in the U.S. solely via the following: (1) our company website at www.Zoetis.com/careers site, or (2) via email to/from addresses using only the Zoetis domain of “@zoetis.com”. In addition, Zoetis does not use Google Hangout for any recruitment related activities. Any solicitation or request for information related to job applications with Zoetis via any other means and/or utilizing email addresses with any other domain should be disregarded. In addition, Zoetis will never ask candidates to make any type of personal financial investment related to gaining employment with Zoetis.

title: Inventory Control Specialist - Logistics - Roosevelt Field
description:
### **Job Description**


The ideal Inventory Control Specialist is independent, flexible, motivated, results oriented and committed to providing outstanding customer experiences every day that drive sales. This is a data driven and highly analytical role with the focus on maintaining item and financial accuracy in the store network.

**A day in a Life…**

* Work in the eye of the storm, keeping the stockrooms and sales floor organized, re-stocked and tidy as shoppers hunt for the great deals they’re looking for
* Be the keeper of the merchandise, completing all inventory processes and making sure merchandise is properly checked in and is accurately ticketed
* Assist the team with inventory control initiatives

**You own this if you…**

* Are all about accountability, accuracy, initiative and having a high level of ownership
* Thrive in a fast-paced environment thanks to your professionalism, organizational skills, attention to detail and ability to prioritize multiple tasks
* Have solid math, verbal and written communications skills
* Are able to frequently lift and carry up to 25 pounds and occasionally up to 50 pounds
* Embrace working a flexible schedule

**We’ve got you covered…**


Our employees are our most important asset and that’s reflected in our benefits. Nordstrom is proud to offer a variety of benefits to support employees and their families, including:

* Medical/Vision, Dental, Retirement and Paid Time Away
* Life Insurance and Disability
* Merchandise Discount and EAP Resources


A few more important points...


The job posting highlights the most critical responsibilities and requirements of the job. It’s not all-inclusive. There may be additional duties, responsibilities and qualifications for this job.


Nordstrom will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.

title: Maintenance Person, Exp. Plumbing, Electric, Painting, MUST DRIVE, Bay Ridge Brooklyn Fulltime
description:
***Apply Though the Link Below:***

https://recruiting.paylocity.com/recruiting/jobs/All/26f9685c-f538-40e8-943f-1bf323fac2fe/THE-GUILD-FOR-EXCEPTIONAL-CHILDREN

**The Guild For Exceptional Children In Bay Ridge, Brooklyn** is seeking a Temporary to Permanent **Maintenance Staff Person**. Driver Required. GEC seeks a self-motivated maintenance staff that will assist with the maintenance and repair of GEC physical premises, equipment, and systems. Maintenance staff should be able to make facility repairs that do not require a licensed craftsman.

**Ability to perform general plumbing**  
1. Replacing, faucets, sinks, piping.

2. Repairing and replacing drain lines.

3. Clearing out internal drain lines (sinks and toilets).

4. Removing and re-seating toilet bowls when necessary to clear drain line.

5. Replacing toilet bowl components, valves, floats, flushometers etc.

6. Repairing water damage to areas under sink, around sink etc.

7. Drain and keep track of boiler maintenance.

Ability to perform general electrical work  
1. Replacing outlets and switches.

2. Re-setting circuit breakers/ replacing fuses.

3. Replacing facility lighting fixtures and bulbs etc.

4. Repair/replace door bells.

5. Replace/install light fixture ballast’s.

**Ability to perform general carpentry**  
1. Repairs banisters.

2. Maintaining, repairing and replacing door, frames, hardware including hinges, locks, doorstops, strike plates etc.

3. Repairing/installing shelves.

4. Maintaining windows ensuring that they open and close properly, are properly caulked and that any cracked or damaged panes are appropriately replaced.

**Ability to perform general painting**  
1. Painting, taping, Sheetrock work.

2. Re-finishing cabinets and doors.

3. Pressure washing and water proofing/refinishing decks and patios.

4. Thoro-sealing exterior surfaces of buildings.

**Ability to perform general exterior work**

1. Sweeping off roofs and cleaning out gutters, clearing roof drains.

2. Emergency patch work for roof until roofing contractor can respond.

3. Repairing leaders and gutters, cleaning out and repairing downspouts.

4. Small scale concrete patch work.

5. Maintaining exterior doors ensuring that they operate properly and that they are appropriately sealed and caulked.

**Ability to perform seasonal work**

1. Installing and removing air conditioners, ensuring that they are working properly upon installation and properly stored upon removal.

2. Snow removal and salting.

3. Sweeping leaves.

**Ability to perform general moving & assembly**

1. Assemble sheds, barbecue grills, furniture, tents, and office furniture.

2. Moves furniture, equipment, and boxes, etc. (up to 50 lbs.) as needed.

Ability to perform general tiling

1. Replacing ceiling tiles.

2. Replacing vinyl floor tiles.

3. Ensuring that bathroom stalls and fixtures are kept in good repair and are clean and graffiti free.

4. Remove graffiti, debris from exterior walls and buildings.

Safety & security responsibilities

**1. Provides general security when needed as requested.**

**2.** Practices preventative maintenance and notifies management of any issues.

**3.** Assisting with monthly fire alarms.

**4.** Assisting with all building inspections. (fire, sprinkler, elevator)

**5.** Keeping basements in proper order and up to code for fire department regulations/inspections.

**6.** Ensuring all buildings are safe for service recipients in our care.

Performs other related duties as assigned.

EOE

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $17.85 - $19.35 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Referral program
* Retirement plan

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* On call

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Experience:

* Plumbing: 1 year (Preferred)
* Drywall: 1 year (Preferred)
* Painting: 1 year (Preferred)
* Electricial: 1 year (Preferred)
* Maintenance: 2 years (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Human Resources Associate
description:
Seeking an experienced Human Resources associate to join our team of professionals at our recently rennovated New Rochelle, NY Assisted Living Facility.



Duties and Responsibilities include but are not limited to:


* Providing support to all employees and managers as it relates to HR services, including Insurance, Retirement, Benefits, Absence and Leave Management, Recruitment, Evaluations etc.
* Time Off Plans, Focus performance, pre-boarding, general HR and other components of the employee life cycle.
* Pre-boarding tasks to include: Compliance, Employment verification, certification/license verification etc.
* Conducting one on one (walk in support), on the spot and scheduled group trainings for HR services and solutions processes and activities. Prepares training material as well as training resources for continued use.
* Onboarding tasks to include: review background check results, medicals, meet new hire for processing, complete i-9, take new hire picture, copy secondary verifications, scan/upload documents into EMR and have completed file reviewed for compliance
* Works with and educates employees, managers and other HR colleagues to address missing/incorrect/conflicting data as well as recurring processing issues. Advises the appropriate parties as technical issues arise.
* Triage and escalate issues and understand why escalations occur and recommend ways to avoid future escalations.
* Participating in special projects as requested, and ensures all assigned tasks are completed timely. Reports on status regularly and seeks clarification when necessary.
* Addressing all employee inquiries (email, phone or walk in for example) in a pleasant and courteous manner. Answers routine inquiries professionally, accurately and completely, and refers non-routine inquires to appropriate colleague.
* Helping to implement continuous improvement projects, which could include process, procedure and knowledge documentation to enhance how support is delivered.
* Maintaining annual compliance for all employees with medicals, evaluations, licenses etc.
* Attending regular office meetings.
* Create ID Badges for new employees and assist with Fingercheck
* Review and understand all forms and departments of the agency.
* Scan all required documents in computer system and maintain in house files.
* Maintaining open job positions on Apploi, schedule interviews and post jobs when needed.
* Assisting with monthly audits of employee files.
* Assisting with Orientations and In-Services, as needed.
* Assisting with agency job functions as needed due to absence and/or agency overflow.


Salary commensurate with expeirence. Must have prior experience in HR management.

title: Head Chef
description:
**Job Summary**

We are seeking an experienced **Head Chef** to join our team at Robbinsville Bar and Grill! The Head Cook + Kitchen Manager is a flexible and motivated individual that is responsible for overseeing the entire day-to-day operations of the kitchen, supervising kitchen staff and ensuring the kitchen area meets health and safety requirements while reporting to the General Manager. This role supports the GM in the planning, organizing, training, and leadership necessary to achieve kitchen objectives in food production, costs, employee hiring and retention, food quality, cleanliness and sanitation.

**Responsibilities:**

* Directing kitchen operations to ensure staff follows cooking procedures, recipes, and portions according to the Menu Builds
* Prepare daily production and prep list
* Control and direct the food preparation process and any other relative activities
* Construct menus with new or existing culinary creations ensuring the variety and quality of the servings
* Delegating kitchen tasks and resolving issues as they arise
* Assign, coordinate and supervise the set-up and food production areas within the kitchen to maximize productivity and minimize waste
* Ensure that all food and products are consistently prepared and served according to the restaurant’s recipes, portioning, cooking, presentation, and serving standards
* Provide timely and constructive feedback and coaching to employees regarding their performance. Ensure both positive and negative performance is documented and communicated accordingly
* Ensure all stations remain stocked before and during the meal period
* Keep kitchen, dish, and storage areas clean and organized
* Conduct inventory to minimize orders and keep food costs inline
* Ensure proper inventory procedures are followed (FIFO)
* Place food and supply orders as directed by the General Manager
* Receive product, verify invoice and freshness of merchandise. Ensure credits are applied where needed
* Prepare all required paperwork, including forms, reports and schedules in an organized and timely manner
* Train Kitchen employees to company standards
* Actively participates as a member of the management team
* Manage kitchen staff scheduling keeping labor costs in line
* Manage staffing levels throughout the shift
* Hold Kitchen Staff accountable for job performance
* Smile and maintain a positive and respectful attitude at all times
* Perform food preparation duties
* Facilitate communication in kitchen to ensure food service is coordinated and timely
* Act as Expeditor, check food for quality and presentation that follow Menu Builds before serving
* Ensure food is handled in a sanitary manner
* Assist with cleaning, sanitation, and organization of kitchen, walk-in coolers, and storage areas
* Ensure line is kept clean at all times
* Complete beginning, change, and end of shift side duties
* Plan and execute food menu for events which may include non-menu offerings
* Keep food costs in line with budget
* Additional tasks as assigned

**Required Skills/Qualifications:**

* Proven experience (minimum 5+ years) as a Head Chef or in a similar role in a high-volume and high-paced dining establishment.
* Culinary degree or relevant certification preferred.
* Strong knowledge of culinary techniques, kitchen equipment, and food safety standards.
* Excellent leadership and team management skills.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Creative and passionate about food, with a keen eye for detail.
* Strong communication and organizational skills.
* Flexibility to work evenings, weekends, and holidays as needed.
* Exceptional proven ability of kitchen management
* Ability in dividing responsibilities and monitoring progress
* Outstanding communication and leadership skills
* Up-to-date with culinary trends and optimized kitchen processes
* Good understanding of useful computer programs (MS Office, restaurant management software, POS)
* Credentials in health and safety training

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $50,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year

Expected hours: 50 – 70 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance

Shift:

* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Night shift

Ability to Commute:

* Windsor, NJ 08561 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Windsor, NJ 08561: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Vetco Veterinary Assistant (Full Time)
description:
Create a healthier, brighter future for pets, pet parents and people!


If you want to make a real difference, create an exciting career path, feel welcome to be your whole self and nurture your wellbeing, Petco is the place for you.


Our core values capture that spirit as we work to improve lives by doing what’s right for pets, people and our planet.


* We love all pets like our own
* We’re the future of the pet industry
* We’re here to improve lives
* We drive outstanding results together
* We’re welcome as we are


Petco is a category-defining health and wellness company focused on improving the lives of pets, pet parents and Petco partners. We are 29,000 strong and operate 1,500+ pet care centers in the U.S., Mexico and Puerto Rico, including 250+ Vetco Total Care hospitals, hundreds of preventive care clinics and eight distribution centers. We’re focused on purpose-driven work, and strongly believe what’s good for pets, people and our planet is good for Petco.


As a Vetco Veterinary Assistant, you will meet your veterinary team at our local dispatch office, then travel to your assigned Petco clinic locations for the day. At the clinics, your team of veterinary assistants will greet the pet parents and recommend the veterinary services that will best protect their pets. The Veterinary Assistant will assist the Veterinarian so the services can be administered and thank the pet parent for protecting their pet!  

  

Essential Job Functions:  

The incumbent must be able to perform all of the following duties and responsibilities with or without a reasonable accommodation.  

* Must love dogs and cats...and people too!
* Team player who thrives on supporting the team in every way.
* Make educated recommendations to our clients and providing exceptional customer service.
* Works hard and has fun doing it!
* Eager to learn.
* Ability to work in changing environments, traveling throughout our Market.
* Responsible and accountable individuals.
* A can-do attitude.

Petco Animal Supplies, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, protected veteran status, or any other protected classification.

title: CLINIC ADVISOR
description:
Create a healthier, brighter future for pets, pet parents and people!


If you want to make a real difference, create an exciting career path, feel welcome to be your whole self and nurture your wellbeing, Petco is the place for you.


Our core values capture that spirit as we work to improve lives by doing what’s right for pets, people and our planet.


* We love all pets like our own
* We’re the future of the pet industry
* We’re here to improve lives
* We drive outstanding results together
* We’re welcome as we are


Petco is a category-defining health and wellness company focused on improving the lives of pets, pet parents and Petco partners. We are 29,000 strong and operate 1,500+ pet care centers in the U.S., Mexico and Puerto Rico, including 250+ Vetco Total Care hospitals, hundreds of preventive care clinics and eight distribution centers. We’re focused on purpose-driven work, and strongly believe what’s good for pets, people and our planet is good for Petco.


Our vision at Petco is Healthier Pets. Happier People. Better World. We’re making things better for pets, people and the planet through our Think Adoption First philosophy, the Petco Foundation and other important initiatives that focus on putting animals first, educating pet parents and reducing our carbon footprint. The journey starts with knowledgeable, passionately engaged associates who are proud to recommend Petco as a place to work, who believe in our Vision and who are committed to delivering a superior customer experience. From our retail stores and our network of Distribution Centers to our Corporate offices, you'll work with others who share your values and commitment. We seek individuals who are passionate about animal welfare, have great people skills and are driven to grow and advance in their careers with us. Our ongoing growth is creating exceptional opportunities for professional development and personal enrichment throughout our organization. As a Vetco Customer Service Team member, you will meet your team at our local dispatch office, then travel to your assigned Petco clinic locations for the day. At the clinics, you and your team will greet the pet parents and recommend the services that will best protect their pets. The Customer Service Team will assist the Veterinarian so the services can be administered and thank the pet parent for protecting their pet with Vetco! title: Dialysis/Nephrology Nurse RN (Willing to Train)
description:
Doral Health and Wellness is seeking a skilled and compassionate **Full-time Dialysis Nurse** to join our healthcare team. The Dialysis Nurse will provide high-quality nursing care to patients undergoing dialysis treatment for kidney failure or other renal conditions. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in nephrology nursing, possess excellent clinical skills, and be dedicated to delivering exceptional patient care.

**Responsibilities:**

* Conduct comprehensive assessments of patients before, during, and after dialysis treatment, including vital signs, fluid status, and overall well-being.
* Administer medications, including intravenous medications, as prescribed by the physician during dialysis treatment, ensuring accuracy and adherence to medication protocols.
* Monitor patients' dialysis treatment, including machine setup, access cannulation, and monitoring of dialysis parameters to ensure safe and effective therapy.
* Assess and manage patients' vascular access sites, such as fistulas, grafts, or catheters, including care, assessment for complications, and infection control measures.
* Collaborate with the interdisciplinary healthcare team to develop and implement individualized care plans for each patient, ensuring continuity and coordination of care.
* Educate patients and their families about dialysis treatment, including the purpose, procedure, and potential complications, as well as self-care techniques and dietary restrictions.
* Perform routine and specialized nursing procedures related to dialysis, such as blood sampling, fluid removal, and dialyzer reprocessing, adhering to established protocols and infection control measures.
* Monitor and document patients' response to dialysis treatment, including vital signs, laboratory results, and any adverse reactions or complications, maintaining accurate and thorough documentation.
* Respond promptly and effectively to medical emergencies that may arise during dialysis treatment, implementing appropriate interventions and alerting the healthcare team.
* Provide emotional support and counseling to patients and their families, addressing their concerns, promoting a positive and supportive environment, and facilitating patient engagement in their care.

**Qualifications:**

* Current registered nurse (RN) license in New York State.
* Minimum 2 years of experience in nephrology or related field, with a focus on dialysis nursing preferred.
* BLS (Basic Life Support) certification required; additional certifications such as ACLS (Advanced Cardiac Life Support) or CDN (Certified Dialysis Nurse) preferred.
* Strong knowledge of dialysis principles, techniques, and equipment, including hemodialysis and/or peritoneal dialysis.
* Proficient in performing vascular access cannulation and care.
* Excellent assessment, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills.
* Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to establish rapport with patients, families, and the healthcare team.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, multidisciplinary environment.
* Commitment to ongoing professional development and staying updated with advancements in nephrology and dialysis nursing.

**Compensation**

* Salary - $55 per hour depending on experience
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Dental Insurance
* 401(k)
* Vision insurance
* Life insurance
* Disability insurance
* Parking spot
* Other

* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

title: Full-time Medical Assistant (MA)
description:
At **Doral Health & Wellness**, we are proud of our commitment to the Brooklyn, New York Community to provide integrated interdisciplinary health services in an innovative medical facility dedicated to the health and well-being of our patients.

We are seeking a **Medical Assistant** to join our supportive and encouraging team!

**Responsibilities:**

* Helps patients by providing information, services, and assistance.
* Maintains medical supplies inventory and performs preventive maintenance to keep medical equipment operating by following operating instructions, troubleshooting breakdowns, maintaining supplies, performing preventive maintenance, and calling for repairs.
* Verifies patient information by interviewing patients, recording medical history, and confirming the purpose of the visit.
* Prepares patients for examination by performing preliminary physical tests; taking blood pressure, weight, and temperature; and reporting patient history summary.
* Saves doctors’ time by helping with office procedures.
* Secures patient information and maintains patient confidence by completing and safeguarding medical records; completing diagnostic coding and procedure coding; and keeping patient information confidential.
* Counsel patients by transmitting physician’s orders and questions about surgery.
* Schedules surgeries by making arrangements with the surgical center; verifying times with patients; and preparing charts and pre-admission and consent forms.
* Maintains a safe, secure, and healthy work environment by establishing and following standards and procedures and complying with legal regulations.
* Keep supplies ready by monitoring inventory stock, placing orders, and verifying receipts.
* Keeps up to date with industry best practice
* Serves and protects the practice by adhering to professional standards; facility policies and procedures; and federal, state, and local requirements.

**Qualifications:**

* Medical Assistant Certification
* 2-3 years of experience in a medical office
* Experience with EMR (electronic medical records), medical terminology

title: Activity Coordinator - Team Lead (WEEKENDS REQUIRED)
description:
**Please do not contact the store regarding your application, we will reach out to you for an interview if we feel that we are a good match.**

The Rage Cage is a unique place for people to have fun and relieve stress by smashing things! You will be responsible for guiding guests through the experience from beginning until end. You will also be in charge of responding to questions and dealing with appointments in-person, through email, or on the phone. We like to keep a relaxed environment but many times we do get busy and you will have to juggle multiple interactions at once.

We are looking for someone who:

* Is a people person and loves interacting with people from all different backgrounds
* Is comfortable managing multiple groups of people (sometimes more than 10 guests at once!)
* Can think on the fly and can keep clients on schedule
* Can juggle multiple tasks at once in a busy environment
* Is reliable and punctual
* Is OK with light cleaning (dusting and sweeping) throughout the day
* Has experience directing other team members

Your main duties include:

* Greeting and checking in clients for their appointments
* Guiding clients through our safety process and going through rules
* Answering general client inquiries through in-person, phone, and email interactions
* Keeping the front area tidy and assisting with clean up if necessary
* Cleaning and disinfecting safety equipment after use
* Keeping track of inventory and supplies, reporting to the Manager when running low

**This job is for**

**Tuesdays and Wednesdays from 2:15-9:15pm as well as Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays 12:15-9:15pm, you MUST have this availability.**

Starting pay is $18 with a paid 30-45 minute lunch break. After a probationary period of 1-3 months your pay will increase based on performance and duties. You will also receive a portion of all tips from guests depending on the hours you've worked for the month (this is usually about $30-$90 a month).

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.00 - $19.00 per hour

Shift:

* 8 hour shift

Application Question(s):

* What days and hours are you available to work every week?

Work Location: In person

title: General Manager
description:
Main Responsibilities of a Store Manager
  

* Responsible for every aspect of everyday supervision of store outlets
* Responsible for resources management
* Takes care of stock, staff, and sales management

Store Manager Job Description
  

We are looking for an experienced and skilled store manager with remarkable skills, who will run a store effectively and with attention to detail.
  

Our store manager candidates are required to be in constant contact with the staff and customers. They need to be able to ensure their staff provides the highest quality customer services and monitor the overall financial performance of the store.
  

The responsibilities of a store manager are to greet the staff and customers, provide them with what they need, give intelligent recommendations and suggestions, build customer and brand trust, assist the staff with anything they need and make sure the customers have a great shopping experience.
  

More importantly, a perfect store manager candidate should be reliable, accommodating, courteous, and friendly to ensure that the customers are fully satisfied.
  

Responsibilities of a Store Manager
  

* Recruiting and appraising staff
* Training and supervising staff
* Managing budgets
* Maintaining financial and statistical records
* Dealing with customer complaints and queries
* Overseeing stock and pricing control
* Maximizing profitability and productivity
* Motivating staff to meet sales targets
* Setting sales targets
* Ensuring compliance with safety and health regulations
* Preparing promotional displays and materials
* Liaising with management
* Taking care of promotional prospects, benefits, and salaries of their staff
* Providing opportunities for staff advancements

* Commercial awareness
* Confidence
* Resourcefulness
* Organizational skills
* Teamworking skills
* Verbal communication skills
* Numerical skills
* Excellent IT skills
* Enthusiasm
* Executive skills

* Showing initiative

title: Human Resources Assistant
description:
**LOCATION:** Syosset
  
  

**REPORTS TO:** HR Recruitment Manager
  
  

**DEPARTMENT:** Human Resources
  
  

**SCHEDULE:** Full Time
  
  

**AGENCY BACKGROUND:**  

MercyFirst is a not-for-profit human and social service agency that has been serving children and families in need since we were founded by the Sisters of Mercy/Hermanas de las Misericordia in 1894. Today our agency continues to address the emotional and physical needs of children and families in Brooklyn, Queens and across Long Island through innovative treatments and life-changing interventions. We provide community-based prevention and family foster care services, group homes in the community for struggling children and families within the child welfare and juvenile justice systems, and short-term residential services for unaccompanied migrant children. Each year, MercyFirst serves more than 3,000 children, teenagers and families overcome enormous obstacles, re-imagine their futures and develop their full potential.
  
  

**PROGRAM BACKGROUND:**  

The Human Resources Department is responsible for managing the employee life cycle beginning with recruiting, hiring, onboarding, training, benefits administration, employee relations, staff training and development, performance management to separation.
  
  

**POSITION SUMMARY:**  

Responsible for assisting with recruitment and various duties in the human resources department.
  
  

**PROGRAM BACKGROUND:**  

The Human Resources Department is responsible for managing the employee life cycle beginning with recruiting, hiring, onboarding, training, benefits administration, employee relations, staff training and development, performance management to separation.
  
  

**REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:**  

* Bachelor's degree in human resources or related field from an accredited college or university.
* Excellent computer skills and knowledge of computerized human resources software strongly preferred.
* Bilingual Spanish a must.


**Brief outline of Essential Tasks:**  

* Recruit and Onboard for specific departmental needs of business.
* Conduct pre-hire tasks regarding all necessary background checks.
* Conduct employee reference check.
* Assist in scheduling interviews.
* Maintain current knowledge of and trends for new human resources developments such as laws.
* Make use of ongoing professional consultation, institutes, and conferences.
* Maintain appropriate competency with all required vendor software necessary to position responsibilities.
* Assist in audits.
* Assist in other administrative duties when needed.


**BENEFITS/PERKS:**  

* A comprehensive health insurance package including medical, dental and vision plans for you and your family (fulltime required)
* 403B retirement benefits
* Employer-paid life insurance and long-term disability insurance
* Generous paid time off (vacation, personal, 12 paid holidays for fulltime, sick leave based on hours worked)
* Free employee assistance program through National EAP
* Insurance discounts for our staff and their families
* Trainings to support professional and personal development
* Employee wellness program
* Employee recognition activities


**Salary Range:**  

$38,000-$40,000
  
  

MercyFirst is an inclusive, anti-racist, multicultural organization and an Equal Opportunity Employer who welcomes prospective employees from diverse backgrounds for all levels at the agency. We strive for a workforce that is reflective of the communities we serve, and do not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived race, color, national origin, alienage or citizenship status, religion or creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, disability, age (18 and over), military status, prior record of arrest or conviction, marital status, partnership status, care giver status, pregnancy, genetic information or predisposition or genetic characteristic, unemployment status, status as a victim or witness of domestic violence, sex offenses or stalking, consumer credit history, or any other status protected by federal, state, and/or city law. This includes, but is not limited to, employment actions against and treatment of employees and applicants for employment.

We work closely with hospitals, physicians, and private caregivers for hire to develop and coordinate individual care plans, all while upholding our clients' independence at home.

title: Service Inspector
description:
**Company Description** **About Veolia North America**


A subsidiary of Veolia Group, Veolia North America (VNA) offers a full spectrum of water, waste and energy management services, including water, and wastewater treatment, commercial and hazardous waste collection and disposal, energy consulting and resource recovery. VNA helps commercial, industrial, healthcare, higher education, and municipality customers throughout North America. Headquartered in Boston, Mass., Veolia North America has approximately 10,000 employees working at more than 350 locations across the continent. Please visit our website www.veolianorthamerica.com.

 **Job Description** **Pay Rate:** $31.45 per hour.

**BENEFITS**


Veolia's comprehensive benefits package includes paid time off policies, as well as health, dental and vision insurance. In addition, employees are also entitled to participate in an employer sponsored 401(k) plan, to save for retirement. Pay and benefits for employees represented by a union are outlined in their collective bargaining agreement.

**Primary Duties/Responsibilities:**

* Under the general direction of the Supervisor, the incumbent shall perform duties in connection with installation, operation, and maintenance of Company system structures, including, but not limited to:
* Cutting and laying of pipes, joint fittings (all sizes); tapping mains (all sizes); installing service lines (all sizes); setting up, and opening patent connection machine; setting hydrants and valves (insertion and other); rock excavation; pick and shovel work.
* Load and unload, operate forklift; transport and store material, as directed.
* Install, service and maintain mains, service lines, hydrants, valves, etc.
* Maintain, adjust, and repair small equipment, and tools normally done on the job as required.
* Must perform valve packing.
* Use of leak detection equipment to locate leaks. Employees required to use leak detection equipment must be able to successfully pass a company-paid hearing examination. Examination will be given as deemed necessary.
* Inspection, operation (including flushing), repair, adjustment, lubrication, testing, and maintenance of water pipes, valves, regulators, hydrants, meters, recording equipment, valve boxes, and other related equipment of the Company.
* Marking out locations for installations of mains, services, hydrants, and marking out locations of existing facilities, and measuring pavement restorations.
* Take chlorine residual measurements as necessary.
* Work closely with contractors to prevent damage to company system structures.
* Makes investigations on customers' premises in connection with high and low pressure, water quality, leaks, etc.
* Will substitute for the Leader, Transmission & Distribution position first, in order of seniority.
* When changing a meter with AMR or other technology during working hours, will reconnect and test such equipment. When performing emergency meter-related work on a scheduled emergency standby, and AMR is not installed, and there is a problem requiring a meter to be changed, the Inspector (if directed) will install and test an AMR installation.
* Performs snow removal as required.
* Must perform scheduled emergency standby duty.
* Performs similar, related, or lesser duties as required.

  

**Qualifications** **Education/Experience/Background:**

* High School Diploma/GED is required.
* Must drive heavy automotive equipment and operate power equipment.

**Required Certification/Licenses/Training:**

* Must have valid State Driver's License with CDL and applicable endorsement as set by state or federal agency.
* Employees holding a valid D license can perform chlorination and sampling of new and repaired mains, as required by supervision.

  

**Additional Information**  

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer! All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.


Disclaimer: The salary, other compensation, and benefits information is accurate as of the date of this posting. The Company reserves the right to modify this information at any time, subject to applicable law.

title: Associate Mechanical Assembler
description:
We are looking for an Associate Mechanical Assembler to be a part of our fantastic Production team!
  
  

If you're looking for your next role to be where there's great culture, high employee tenure, amazing benefits, and growth opportunities, we encourage you to apply!
  
  

KNF Neuberger, Inc. is an international engineering and manufacturing organization, specializing in high quality pumps and compressors, with an excellent reputation in the medical device, research and environmental industries.
  
  

This Trenton (Hamilton, NJ) based position will support our business, manufacturing and cultural goals of the company and of the Assembly team while reporting to the Assembly Supervisor.
  
  

This position will assemble products, such as pumps and compressors, partially or completely, using blue prints, working at a bench, workstation, test booth or on the shop floor, to meet product specifications and schedules. This position will also be responsible for trouble-shooting on the assembly line or in a test booth. This position will work under the guidance of more experienced assembly personnel.
  
  

**Essential functions include:**  

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  
  

* Assembles sub-assemblies and complete pumps as per drawings, work instructions, and verbal instructions
* Operates mechanical presses, automatic tube and wire cutting machines, and semi-automatic wire crimping and assembly machines to create sub-assemblies and final assemblies
* Operates various mechanical hand tools and fixtures to assemble products
* Performs manual gluing operations
* Operates electrically and pneumatically driven screwdrivers to install fasteners
* Produces high quality products consistently in a manual assembly environment
* Performs operations in an efficient manner by completing assigned tasks within assigned time allocation and schedule constraints. Identifies opportunities to improve efficiency
* Tests sub-assemblies and finished products using pneumatic gauges, flow meters, and associated fitting hardware while applying AC or DC power
* Performs occasional maintenance work including maintaining work area and equipment in a clean and orderly condition. Maintains an organized and efficient work area using 5S practices
* Paints finished pumps and/or pump components as required
* Follows all applicable safety procedures and processes
* Acts as a team player in a dynamic manufacturing environment
* Acts in accordance with company policies and cultural programs (LEITBILD and The KNF Way).


To qualify for this position, the ideal candidate will possess these skills and experiences:
  
  

* Ability to read and understand drawings is a plus
* Takes initiative, and works well in a team environment
* High school diploma/GED preferred
* Mechanical aptitude a plus


**Benefits at KNF:**  

* Exceptional medical, vision, and dental coverage with super low employee premiums
* 401k plan
* Paid time off
* Company wide bonus plan
* Full on the job training and support


Full-time hours are generally 7:00am-3:30pm, Monday-Friday (after initial training, hours may vary slightly).
  
Occasional overtime work is required during busy times of the year and as production cycles require.
  
  

**Physical Demands:** Ability to work on and lift pumps that weigh around 20 pounds.
  
  

KNF Neuberger Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.
company_description: At KNF, employees are part of an international family! KNF’s independence, solidity, and growth offer an inspiring workplace and career opportunities in a positive, future-oriented atmosphere.

title: Luxury Fitness Center | (Part-Time) Front Desk - Jackson Park, LIC
description:
The Wright Fit
  
  

**The Pathway to an Extraordinary Quality of Life:** The Wright Fit has established itself as the premier Luxury Fitness and Amenities Management Company operating facilities in some of the most iconic residential and commercial buildings in New York City. By managing the facilities within residential and commercial buildings, we're given direct access into people's homes and workplaces, allowing us the opportunity to show them pathways to an extraordinary quality of life.
  
  

Job Summary
  
  

**The Wright Fit Team:**  

As an emerging leader in the fitness industry, there's no better place to gain first-hand experience at the crossroads of hospitality, health, wellness, and fitness. If you are a self-starter, customer focused, and a team player with a passion for fitness, then The Wright Fit is the right fit for you!
  
  

**Your Impact:**  

Our Luxury Fitness Center Attendants are responsible for delivering the highest quality customer service to all residents and guests through effective communication and extensive knowledge of The Wright Fit services and holistic approaches. Through relationship development, they will be able to proactively meet the needs of residents and guests and provide them with a platform to succeed!
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Provide high level customer service and hospitality to residents.
* Provide floor supervision and maintenance of the fitness center and equipment.
* Assist residents with any questions about the fitness center through knowledge of the equipment and services.
* Coordinate Personal training and other fitness services.
* Provide support to The Wright Fit specialists to ensure best service experience.
* Assist in organizing and managing events at the fitness center.
* Attentively and promptly respond to resident needs.
* Assist management in daily tasks and projects.
* Maintain a positive attitude and take initiative.
* Work as a cohesive team with all The Wright Fit team members to ensure efficiency and camaraderie.
* Maintain in conduct and actions The Wright Fit aesthetic, appearance, atmosphere, culture, vision, purpose and values.
* Compliance with quality assurance expectations and standards that may require you to sit, stand, or walk for extended periods of time, as well as lift and move heavy objects.


**What we're looking for:**  

* Hospitality or Customer Service experience preferred.
* A passion for fitness, health, and wellness.
* Strong interpersonal, communication, and organization skills.
* Customer focused, able to manage conflict.
* Excellent time management, able to multi-task in a dynamic environment.
* Attention to detail, a self-starter and personally accountable.
* A positive attitude, team oriented.
* Ability to maintain the highest level of discretion and privacy.
* Attend and pass internal lifeguard certification.


**What you'll get:**  

* A supportive and passionate team of coworkers.
* Encouraging managers and leaders to learn from.
* Access to cutting edge information about the industry.


**Salary Range:** $17/hour
  
  

The Wright Fit is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. The Wright Fit does not discriminate on the basis of disability, veteran status, or any other basis protected under federal, state, or local laws.

title: Assistant Operations Director
description:
Thank you for your interest in a career opportunity with Chick-fil-A. We are an organization that strives for excellence and desires to create a remarkable experience for our guests and our team. Our Chick-fil-A offers a leadership development program that emphasizes personal growth and allows Directors to play a major role in the influence and decision making of a multi-million dollar business.


Our Assistant Operations Director will work alongside the Operations Director. The Assistant Director will be responsible for assisting in managing a team of 30+ team members, coaching that team in Chick-fil-A standards, and building morale among team members in a fast and demanding environment.


This is an operationally hands-on position. As part of the daily management duties, Assistant Operations Directors are responsible for: food quality and safety, inventory, labor hours, cleanliness of the store, maintenance of the facility, customer service, and food cost control. We are recruiting for results-oriented individuals who desire to be part of a successful business.


We offer competitive starting pay, performance-based advancement, development opportunities, tuition reimbursement and scholarships, health insurance, 401K and paid time off.

**Benefits:**

* Health/Dental/Vision Insurance
* Paid Time Off
* 401K
* $2,000 yearly professional development/tuition reimbursement program
* Paid leadership training and development opportunities
* Emphasis on work-life balance

**Responsibilities:**

* Ability to troubleshoot, problem solve, and make quick decisions on a daily basis
* Set goals and motivate a team towards achieving them
* Desire to develop people of all ages and skill levels
* Ability to work in a fast-pace, high volume environment
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Proven leadership skills
* Desire to grow and be developed on an individual level
* Attention to detail
* Passion for excellence
* Servant leadership mindset


Chick-fil-A, Inc. is a family owned and privately held restaurant company founded in 1967 by S. Truett Cathy. Devoted to serving the local communities in which its franchised restaurants operate, and known for its original chicken sandwich, Chick-fil-A serves freshly prepared food in more than 2,300 restaurants in 47 states and Washington, D.C.


Pay: $19 - $24 / hour


Benefits:

* Paid time off
* Health insurance
* Dental insurance
* Vision insurance
* 401(k)


Job Type: fulltime

title: Per Diem Medical Assistant $27 per hour
description:
At Doral Health & Wellness, we are proud of our commitment to the East New York community to provide integrated interdisciplinary health services in an innovative medical facility dedicated to the health and well-being of our patients. This will primarily entail periodic telephonic outreach calls to each patient to address any urgent needs, confirm medication adherence, assuring alignment across the patient's entire care continuum, and assess various aspects of overall health.

* Secures patient information and maintains patient confidence by completing and safeguarding medical records; completing diagnostic coding and procedure coding; and keeping patient information confidential.
* Counsel patients by transmitting physician’s orders and questions about surgery.
* Serves and protects the practice by adhering to professional standards; facility policies and procedures; and federal, state, and local requirements.
* Enhances practice reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests, and exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.

* Verbal communication
* Infection control
* Creating a safe, effective environment
* Organization

* Professionalism

* Confidentiality

* Medical teamwork

* 1+ years in a medical office
* Experience with EMR (electronic medical records), medical terminology

title: Nature, Mission and Sustainability, MBA Intern
description:
About the job

Our **Summer Internship Experience (SIE)** is a 10-week program that allows students to dive into a project relevant to their studies to further grow and develop their learnings. During our 10-week program you will participate in trainings, development sessions, as well as lots of exciting programming!

  


**The dates of our 2025 Program will be June 2nd, 2025 – August 9th, 2025.**

  



At Danone, we are a purpose-driven organization. Our mission is to bring health through food to as many people as possible. Simply put, we believe in contributing to a healthier world! With initiatives around sustainability and transparency, we are aligning our corporate mission to a greater sense of responsibility and purpose.



We are a growing global leader in the food and beverage industry seeking new talent to achieve our mission! Our culture and core values foster individual professional growth. Looking to make an impact? We reward entrepreneurial spirit and teamwork.



Here's an opportunity for you to align your personal mission of health and wellness with your day job! Interested to learn more? See below to gain a better understanding of what we're looking for....

  


**Why do we exist?** The Mission and Sustainability (M&S) team develops and enables the implementation of all of Danone North America’s mission and sustainability efforts. To deliver on Danone’s mission to bring health through food to as many people as possible, we must connect several integrated impact efforts across:

  


* Nature (e.g., regenerative agriculture, water, carbon, circularity, etc.)
* Health (e.g., nutrition, transparent and responsible marketing, positive impact of food on health, etc.)
* Communities (e.g., human rights, thriving communities, future skilling our value chain, etc.)

  



The M&S team provides strategic oversight, direction, and governance across these topics for Danone North America and ensures a deep collaboration with our Global Danone counterparts. We partner with multiple cross-functional internal stakeholders (e.g., procurement, sales, research and innovation, etc.) and external stakeholders to deliver on our strategy. The team is integrated into the heart of the business and sits within the Enterprise Strategy and Transformation Team (ES&T) in North America.

  



Danone has a deep partnership with B Lab. 70% of Danone’s global sales are now covered by B Corp™ certification, marking significant progress towards Danone’s ambition to become one of the first fully certified multinationals by 2025.

  


**What do we do?** The Mission and Sustainability team sets the umbrella strategy for all mission and sustainability related efforts, cascading our key priorities across Danone North America by working side-by-side with business leads to implement and measure progress.

  

DEVELOP STRATEGY AND BUSINESS CASE –



The M&S team partners with category teams and across the business to set the strategy and roadmap for impact priorities that will drive business results and societal impact. This means understanding current and future trends and mission-critical needs across the planet, our health, and our communities where Danone North America can make a difference. We use this strategic insight to prioritize commitments and programs that have the highest impact through deep analyses of costs, risks, ROI, feasibility, and tradeoffs.

  



PLAN, DO, AND REVIEW –



We collaborate with teams across Danone North America (e.g., procurement, sales, research and innovation, scientific affairs, HR, marketing, etc.) to develop and implement roadmaps for our impact programs. We identify short- and long-term milestones, resourcing plans, clear business ownership and accountability mechanisms. We also identify a simple and streamlined set of targets/goals, and actionable and measurable KPIs for tracking progress that are balanced to respond to both business and impact needs. We provide subject matter expertise and technical expertise to large-scale, cross-functional projects that often span research and innovation, sourcing, supply chain, etc. and a multitude of topics such as circularity, regenerative agriculture, healthy living, and affordability of and access to nutritious foods. We set up mechanisms to measure and report on our impact so that we can constantly refine our strategy and programs to deliver the highest impact. We stay in constant contact with our Global Sustainability Team to ensure that our work and impact “ladders up” to the broader mission and impact priorities of Danone.

  


**What will you do?**



The MBA Intern will support and own delivery of key Nature deliverables, which would likely include topics such as the below, based on needs of the team at the time:

  


* Develop rigorous quantitative modeling and qualitative problems solving to refine strategies and tactics for delivering on DNA’s Nature pillar (levers, goals, KPIs) and implementation roadmaps (programs, roles/responsibilities, financials, measurement).
* Collaborate with multiple cross-functional senior stakeholders (e.g., Public Affairs, , Research and Innovation, Procurement, Brand teams, Analytics and Insights, etc.) to identify and co-create solutions and influence P&L and implementation roadmap
* Collaborate with M&S Director of Nature and other cross-functional leaders to ensure strategies and roadmaps are communicated, tracked, and updated across the business
* Assist in financial analysis, competitive analysis, pricing analysis and category analysis. Identifying key trends and brand implications.
* Lead research and case studies to inform deep understanding of key Nature topics (e.g., carbon accounting, innovative materials, circularity, regenerative agriculture practices) to improve strategy development and execution


Collaborate with M&S Director on Partnerships and Impact Measurement and other cross-functional leaders to ensure strategies and roadmaps are communicated, tracked, and updated across the business through a strategic review process


About you

We are looking for a leader with a passion and track record for leveraging strategic insights and analytics to unlock transformational impact for business and for society. Someone who focuses on strategy-first but is also able to drive the full scope of project implementation needs independently. Someone with high tolerance for dealing with ambiguity and “getting to the answer” without a traditional starting point. Someone with passion for and subject matter experience in decarbonization and at least one of our other Nature priorities

  


**Key Experience:**


* 5-7 years of relevant experience, with minimum 2-4 years at a top-tier strategy consulting or social impact consulting firm, in an internal strategy or mission/impact team, or other relevant CPG industry experience; and/or banking, sustainable finance, or ESG
* B.S./B.A. (required) in Business or Social Impact/Sustainability, or related field
* MBA (preferred) in Strategy and/or Social Impact/Sustainability

  


**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities (required):**


* Strong problem-solving capabilities to generate actionable insights from a wide array of qualitative and quantitative inputs and data in the spirit of “getting to the answer”
* Ability to set the strategic framework for what data and analyses are needed to answer a “big picture” question, and fluency in Excel and with modeling to deliver on the analyses and generate senior leadership presentations and communications
* Able to flex between “leader” and “do-er” across topics and needs; proactive and independent
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, particularly in developing presentations and directly leading action-oriented conversations with the C-Suite
* Significant subject matter expertise in carbon/decarbonization and at least 1 other nature topic, either directly through technical/programmatic work or through an advisory role
* Experience in developing and implementing sophisticated impact measurement frameworks
* Fluency in applying commercial and private-sector skills (strategy, market analysis, financial modeling, etc.) to social sector Nature contexts
* Demonstrated track record leading cross-functional teams and understanding and problem-solving for competing needs and roles by building deep relationships and influencing the outcomes
* Flexible/adaptable in a highly dynamic business environment with competing priorities (i.e., impeccable time management, organizational and prioritization skills); comfortable with ambiguity

About us

At Danone, we believe that every time we eat or drink, we vote for the world we want. As a leading food and beverage company, we make healthy, sustainably-produced foods and beverages that nourish people’s lives. Some of our brands include *Dannon, Activia International Delight, Silk, Oikos, So Delicious Dairy Free, Stok, Light + Fit, Evian and more!* And as one of the largest Certified B Corporations® in the world, we are committed to redefining success in business to ensure that through our brands we create real benefits for people, our communities, and the planet.

  



With headquarters in Broomfield, CO and White Plains, NY, Danone North America employs over 6,000 professionals in the U.S. and Canada, operating numerous manufacturing facilities across North America. Our team enjoys competitive compensation, leading benefits, and a shared commitment to business success and social impact. Join us at Danone North America to be part of a global team dedicated to promoting a healthier world through food.

  

Danone North America doesn’t just welcome what makes you unique, we value it. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All hires to our team are based on qualifications, merit and business needs. We recruit, employ, train and promote regardless of race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, veteran status, genetic characteristic or any other protected status. Faithful to our values of openness and humanism, all of our employees share in the commitment to engage one another with dignity and respect.

  



The base compensation for this position ranges from $45 to $50 per hour.

  



#LI-NORAM
