title: Part-time Multi-Modality Ultrasound Technician
description:
Doral Health & Wellness seeks a highly skilled and dedicated **Multi-Modality Ultrasound Technician** to join our dynamic healthcare team.

As a Multi-Modality Ultrasound Technician, you will perform high-quality ultrasound examinations, ensure accurate diagnostic results, and provide excellent patient care. This is an excellent opportunity for an experienced ultrasound professional seeking a challenging and rewarding career path.

**Responsibilities:**

* Perform diagnostic ultrasound examinations as prescribed by physicians and healthcare professionals.
* Prepare patients for procedures, explaining the process, and addressing any concerns or questions they may have.
* Operate ultrasound equipment and utilize imaging software to capture images and generate reports.
* Ensure the accuracy and completeness of patient data, maintaining detailed records and documentation.
* Collaborate with physicians and other healthcare professionals to interpret and analyze diagnostic results.
* Adhere to established safety and infection control protocols, ensuring the well-being of patients and staff.
* Maintain and calibrate ultrasound equipment, promptly reporting any malfunctions or discrepancies.
* Stay up to date with industry trends, advancements, and best practices in ultrasound technology.

**Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or equivalent; completion of an accredited ultrasound technology program.
* Current certification as a Multi-Modality Ultrasound Technician.
* Proven experience in performing a wide range of ultrasound procedures, including:

a) Cardiovascular studies (Echo, Vascular, Carotids)

b) Women’s Health (Transabdominal, & Pelvic)

c) Men’s Health (Prostate, Scrotum)

d) General Ultrasound (Abdomen, Renal)

* Proficiency in operating ultrasound equipment and imaging software.
* Strong knowledge of anatomy, physiology, and medical terminology.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to provide compassionate patient care.
* Attention to detail and strong organizational skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team, with a focus on delivering exceptional patient outcomes.
* Flexibility to work varying shifts, including weekends and holidays.

**Compensation:**

* Pay Rate: $40-50 per hour depending on experience.
* Comprehensive benefits package, including health insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, life insurance, and disability insurance.
* Paid time off and holiday pay.
* 401(k) retirement plan.

Join our team at Doral Health & Wellness and be a vital part of our commitment to providing outstanding patient care and diagnostic services. We look forward to welcoming you into our dedicated healthcare community.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $40.00 - $50.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Cardiology
* Ob/Gyn
* Radiology

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift

Experience:

* Cardiovascular studies (Echo, Vascular, Carotids): 1 year (Preferred)
* Women’s Health (Transabdominal, & Pelvic): 1 year (Preferred)
* Men’s Health (Prostate, Scrotum): 1 year (Preferred)
* General Ultrasound (Abdomen, Renal): 1 year (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Ultrasound Certification (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Commercial Kitchen Appliance Field Technician
description:
Service Plus is seeking experienced A+ Commercial Kitchen Equipment Repair Technicians to service a growing customer base with commercial kitchen equipment both in and out of warranty. Our service territory covers most of New Jersey, Eastern Pennsylvania, and parts of New York. This is an excellent opportunity to join the leading Commercial Kitchen Equipment Repair Company in the state.

As a Commercial Kitchen Appliance Technician, you will have the opportunity to repair and service Ranges, Fryers, Salamanders, Griddles, Charbroilers, Stock Pot Ranges, Pizza Ovens, Deck Broilers, Chophouse Broilers, Convection Ovens, Steamers, Combi Ovens, Heated Cabinets, Tilting Skillets, Kettles, and much more.

Our diverse customer base includes hospitals, restaurants, nursing homes, pizzerias, deli's, banquet halls, corporate cafeterias, fire departments, and any other establishments with commercial kitchens.

**Responsibilities:**

* Providing timely and quality repairs of customer's kitchen equipment
* Maintaining high-quality customer service and care
* Promoting additional products and services, such as preventative maintenance plans
* Providing knowledgeable and courteous repair service
* Maintaining truck stock inventory within the prescribed company guidelines and standards
* Following the truck maintenance schedule and keeping a clean, organized truck

**Qualifications and Skills:**

* Strong plumbing, mechanical, and electrical knowledge
* Knowledge of the installation and diagnostics of commercial kitchen equipment, preferred but not required for the right candidate
* Working knowledge of tools and test equipment
* Ability to perform accurate repair of customer product
* Ability to follow directions and specific process steps to ensure quality workmanship
* Flexibility to work variable and flexible hours, including overtime
* Must possess and maintain a valid state driver’s license with a clean driving record
* Must be at least 18 years of age

**Benefits:**

* Medical, dental, and vision plans available (We cover 75% of insurance costs for full-time technicians!)
* Company service van
* Dispatched from home (leave your house in the morning with van, return at end of day with van)
* The latest industry training and certification opportunities
* Career opportunities providing growth and advancement
* Company matching IRA
* Company uniforms
* Company iPhone
* Career opportunities providing growth and advancement, including the latest industry training and certification opportunities
* PTO

**Compensation:**

* Apprentice level technician starting at 40K yearly, and up to 100K yearly for A+ level technicians, all based upon experience.

Pay: $40,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year

Service Plus Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

description:
**Salary:** Salary range is $18.55-$22.00 per hour


**Location:** Whitestone, Queens, NY, USA


**Home Health Aide (HHA) and Personal Care Aide (PCA)** **Benefits:**


* Medical insurance
* 401(k) plan with employer matching
* Weekly Paycheck
* Immediate pay available after a shift
* Flexible scheduling
* $100 bonus with each new caregiver referral
* Paid training and development
* Caregiver recognition and rewards


Right at Home Nassau North Shore, In-Home Care & Assistance is seeking to hire certified Home Health Aides (HHA) and Personal Care Aides (PCA) to join a dynamic care team providing clinical expertise in-home. You can make a difference in your career by helping people stay in the comfort of their homes. We are one of the top-rated agencies in the area. Annually, we receive the Employer of Choice Award by Home Care Pulse, and a Caring Star Top Rating.

  


**Responsibilities and Duties:**



Licensed caregivers (HHAs/PCAs) will provide the following types of services to our clients:


* Assisting with ADLs and IADLs
* Ambulation
* Bathing
* Personal hygiene
* Continence / toileting
* Dressing / shaving
* Eating / feeding
* Transferring
* Prepares meals and snacks according to instructions
* Accompany patient on errands or medical appointments
* Performs housekeeping activities including, but are not limited to vacuuming, dusting, sweeping or mopping floors, doing dishes, changing bed linens, doing laundry, and cleaning bathroom
* Performs client-specific activities that are taught by a Right at Home nurse includes, but are not limited to:
* Medication reminders
* Assisting with the prescribed range of motion exercises
* Measuring and preparing special diets
* Understanding dementia care
* Incontinence care

  


**Qualifications and Skills:**


* HHA / PCA certification
* High school graduate or G.E.D. certificate preferred
* Experience as a caregiver preferred, but not required; experience can be in personal homes or facilities
* The ability to read, write, speak and understand English is required
* Possess a valid driver’s license and insured automobile is a plus but not required

  



Right at Home’s mission is simple ... to improve the quality of life for those we serve. We accomplish this by providing the Right Care, and we deliver this brand promise each and every day around the world. However, we couldn’t do it without having the Right People. Our care teams are passionate about serving our clients and are committed to providing the personal care and attention of a friend, whenever and wherever it is needed.


*This franchise is independently owned and operated by a franchisee. Your application will go directly to the franchisee, and all hiring decisions will be made by the management of this franchisee. All inquiries about employment at this franchisee should be made directly to the franchise location, and not to Right at Home Franchising Corporate.*

We offer a very comprehensive benefit package with competitive salary.

You must also prepare EMR/charts for surgical procedures and work closely with the physicians to assure continuation of care. Must be able to review and order lab testing ,and demonstrate good documentation and communication skills with patients and hospitals.

title: Analyst, Investment Banking - Power & Utilities
description:
**Requisition ID:** 204230

**Salary Range:** 110,000.00 - 120,000.00

*Please note that the Salary Range shown is a guideline only. Salary offered may vary based on factors, including, but not limited to, the successful candidate’s relevant knowledge, skills, and experience.*

  

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 **Analyst, Investment Banking - Power & Utilities**

 **Global Banking and Markets**


Global Banking and Markets (GBM) is a leading Canadian Capital Markets and Investment Banking business with a growing platform in the US and Latin America, operating globally for over 100 years. Scotiabank’s strong U.S. presence provides our clients an important bridge to this key global market for trade and investment flows across the Americas and the world.


Global Banking & Markets provides a full range of investment banking, credit and risk management products and services relevant to the financing and strategic development needs of our clients. Our products include debt and equity financing, mergers & acquisitions, corporate banking, institutional equity sales, trading and research, fixed income products, derivatives, energy, foreign exchange and precious & metals. We also cross-sell the full range of wholesale products and services offered by the Scotiabank Group.


Be part of an innovative, Global Capital Markets and Investment Banking business with a unique geographic footprint that puts capital to work for our clients across industries! We work together to drive ambition for every future!

 **Position Highlights:**


Analysts in Investment Banking enjoy a stimulating and challenging work environment in which they execute a broad range of transactions. A high degree of responsibility is afforded to those demonstrating initiative and the desire to take on such responsibility.

  

Scotiabank’s Power & Utilities Investment Banking team is a leading renewable energy investment banking platform. The team is actively involved with a wide array of renewable investors, developers and regulated utilities. The Analyst will have the opportunity to immediately and meaningfully contribute to live transactions including sell-side renewable asset/portfolio sales and capital raises for leading renewable platforms.

  

  

A significant amount of effort, diligence and initiative is required to properly execute assignments. The complexity of clients’ financial requirements coupled with the intense competitiveness of the investment banking industry necessitates a full commitment to the task at hand. Standards are very high as most work is presented to senior executives at client firms and supervision is provided only to the extent that it is required.

  

With a limited hierarchy of professionals and a small project team approach, Analysts have ample opportunity for career growth and development. On any given project, Analysts will interact with other departments of the firm such as Corporate Banking, Equity Capital Markets, Global Fixed Income and Global Equity Derivatives gaining knowledge and understanding of both investment banking and the capital markets.

 **Responsibilities:**

* Evaluating and analyzing the financial needs of corporate clients, including the development of financial models
* Creating marketing materials and presentations
* Supporting transaction structuring and execution efforts, with increasing levels of responsibility and accountability over time
* Identifying and developing business opportunities with clients

 **Major Activities Include:**

* Perform comprehensive financial statement analysis and create and maintain models
* Collect, consolidate and interpret company and industry data
* Financial and written analysis of companies and industries
* Preparing client presentations, including compiling data and assembling presentation materials
* Supporting drafting of prospectuses, related documentation and marketing materials for transactions
* Applying product and capital markets knowledge to help clients achieve their financial objectives

 **Requirements:**

* 0 - 2 years’ work experience in Investment Banking or the power/utilities sector preferred
* Bachelors or Masters Degree in Business, Finance, Math, Engineering, Economics, Science or Technology
* Proven record of outstanding achievement in academic and extracurricular activities
* Strong quantitative skills focused on financial analysis, accounting and financial theory
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Excellent command of Microsoft Suite, with an emphasis on Excel
* A high level of attention to detail
* The ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while maintaining a high standard of work
* The ability to excel under pressure amid demanding deadlines
* The ability to perform effectively in a team environment
* High professional standards including a strong sense of personal integrity and teamwork
* Demonstrated ability to quickly adapt to new situations
* A high level of energy and a keen desire to learn new concepts

 **Interested?**


At Scotiabank, every employee is empowered to reach their fullest potential, respected for who they are and, embraced for their differences. That’s why we work to grow and diversify talent and engage employees in a performance-oriented culture.

 **What's in it for you?**


Scotiabank wants you to be able to bring your best self to work – and life, every day. With a focus on holistic well-being, our many flexible benefit programs are designed to help support your unique family, financial, physical, mental, and social health needs.


Location(s): United States : New York : New York City


Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.


At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Chef de Cuisine
description:
We are looking for an incredible CDC to lead our kitchen at INDAY All Day, our full service restaurant in Williamsburg, BK! This is the ideal role for an experienced culinary leader (CDC, Sous Chef or Kitchen Manager) that is looking to head the kitchen at an exciting new brand and make their mark on the NYC food scene. As the CDC of INDAY All Day, you will have the opportunity to work with our culinary team to brainstorm new menu ideas, lead the kitchen team, and serve as the culinary face press & media.

INDAY All Day is an all day restaurant inspired by the vibrant flavors, warm hospitality and rich culture of the modern Indian table. From morning chai’s, to a bustling lunch and evening cocktails, INDAY All Day is designed to be a welcoming restaurant to serve the neighborhood.. Our menu spans from traditional home-cooked recipes to unique interpretations of classic dishes, including items such as fire-roasted kebabs, breads, warming curries, fresh salads, and delectable cocktails.

The CDC will manage day-to-day culinary operations and drive excellence in the kitchen. Our culinary ethos is built on the idea of ‘food karma’: that how your food is sourced, who cooks it and the space in which it is served impacts how it makes you feel. This guides every aspect of our hospitality and business practices, from the mindfulness rituals that begin our daily routine, to sourcing high quality produce that reflects the vitality of the season.

The ideal candidate has a robust background (3-5 years) and track record of success leading fine-casual or full-service kitchens. You will report to the VP of Operations, work very closely with our General Manager, and collaborate with our CEO on developing and executing our new concept and building a vibrant and positive work community in our kitchen. Experience with Indian food is highly preferred, though not required.

**What you’ll do:**

* Hire, train and develop BOH professionals through mentorship and hip-to-hip coaching
* Manage BOH controllables including labor and cost of goods. This includes food ordering, inventory and scheduling BOH
* Maintain food quality through constant tasting and engage in a process of continuous improvement with all recipes and products
* Ideate, create and innovate --- our culinary program is constantly evolving. You will be a part of a fun R&D pipeline to keep the menu fresh and interesting
* Manage and maintain the INDAY all day recipe book, tracking adjustments, tweaks and improvements and updating existing materials
* Maintain the physical restaurant space and ensure that the restaurant is DOH compliant at all times

**Specific Responsibilities**

* Ensure prep, service, and day-to-day kitchen operations run smoothly and efficiently.
* Make sure that recipes are being followed and executed properly everyday and that company tools and systems (cooling logs, time stamps, order guides, production guides, prep lists) are being filled out and properly used.
* Check food quality before lunch and dinner service and do daily line checks for mise en place.
* Oversee ordering, prep lists and production.
* Maintaining a clean and organized work environment both on the line and in the prep kitchen.
* Ensure that the restaurant is compliant with all health and safety code requirements at all times.
* Work with the General Manager to manage food and labor costs so the restaurant can hit its financial targets.
* Expedite and fill in on stations as needed.
* Maintain an environment of respect and learning consistent with our company values

**Skills + Requirements**

* 3-5 years of senior-level culinary management experience in a fine-casual or full-service dining environment or similar, working with a variety of foods
* Experience with Indian food highly preferred
* Open availability on nights and weekends is required
* Ability to multi-task and maintain a calm demeanor under pressure
* Solid track record of success in previous assignments demonstrating upward career tracking
* Ability to work 10 hour shifts with the ability to stand, sit or walk for extended periods of time and to grasp, lift and/or carry up to 50 lbs as needed
* Strong communication skills, including fluency in English (Spanish a plus)
* DOH Food Safety Certificate

**Why you’ll love working at INDAY All Day**

* We get to be creative and entrepreneurial every day and build an amazing company together
* We have an outstanding team and company culture that you'll love being a part of and you’ll get to play a critical role in making it even better
* We offer a competitive salary ($80-90K + bonus) for this position
* We have tons of opportunities for growth and advancement, from roles at other restaurants to company-organized trainings
* We believe in supporting a balanced lifestyle - we offer all holiday closures (Thanksgiving, Christmas Eve and Christmas Day, New Years DAy)
* Lots of benefits include high quality medical, dental and vision insurance (with company paying 75% of costs), 401K plan, and commuter benefits

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $70,000.00 - $90,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Food provided
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Shift:

* 10 hour shift
* Evening shift

Supplemental Pay:

* Bonus opportunities

Experience:

* Kitchen management: 2 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Brooklyn, NY 11211 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Service Technician, Appliance Repair
description:
**Appliance and Refrigeration Repair Technician**  

Why an **Appliance Repair Technician** career might be right for you:* **You like solving problems** – Each repair is different. You enjoy diagnosing problems and figuring out solutions.
* **You like fixing things** – Getting things working again is a satisfying outcome. You did that!
* **You like helping others** – You’re the hero of the home, fixing essential appliances and lifting that weight off the shoulders of grateful homeowners.
* **You like to be on the move** – You’re on the road and welcomed into customers’ homes every day.

  

Why a career with **Sears Home Services** is right for you:* **Great hourly rates** – $20- $26 / hourly base rate, depending on experience, certification and location.
* **Benefits** – Comprehensive set of medical, dental, and vision benefits with an additional employer-paid health care subsidy for any dependent tier medical plan enrollment under the Transform Health and Welfare Plan. Specifically, each eligible employee may receive up to $4,000 annually towards the cost of your dependent tier health coverage each year, prorated throughout the plan year.
* **401k match** – Opportunity to contribute to 401k plan, with an employer match calculated on your before-tax contributions, 100% on the first 3% of salary.
* **More ways to earn** –Technicians have the opportunity to earn additional performance bonuses & sales incentives throughout the year.
* **Year-round work** – With Sears large scale and wide product range, Sears cross trains techs and keeps them busy year round.
* **Expert training** – Best in class training program. Tens of thousands of repair techs have been trained by Sears Technical Institute in the past 60 years.
* **Peer mentoring** – Onboarding buddy and mentor technicians to help you grow your skills.
* **Career advancement** – Many ways to advance and cross-train to keep growing your career. Our average tenure is >12 years!
* **Tools Provided** – Sears provides company vehicle, uniforms, specialty tools, mobile phone & industry-leading app that eliminates paperwork and provides technical support.

**Responsibilities/Skills/Experience Requirements**


**Job responsibilities:*** Drive to multiple customer’s homes daily to diagnose and repair a variety of home appliances with high levels of quality and efficiency; appliances may include refrigerators, washers, dryers, dishwashers, and microwaves
* Deliver excellent customer experience that exceeds expectations consistently
* Provide customers with value-added solutions that help make their home more clean, comfortable & protected
* Keep company truck well-maintained & organized, and help manage parts efficiently
* Performs other duties as assigned

**Requirements:*** High school diploma or general education degree
* Mechanical knowledge and aptitude, including use of testing & repair tools
* Experience repairing and diagnosing a variety of home appliances preferred
* Can follow directions and processes for quality workmanship
* Can use smartphone, including use for part ordering
* Successfully pass a background & drug screen
* Valid driver’s license for the state(s) in which you work
* Ability to travel up to 100%
* Ability to work variable and flexible hours, including required overtime
* Ability to read, understand, and apply written text of a technical nature to answer questions, solve problems, and complete job tasks
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written; Ability to read, write, and speak English
* Ability to constantly lift, carry, push, or pull up to 20 lbs (frequently lift, carry, push, or pull 50 lbs; occasionally lift, carry, push, or pull 100 lbs)
* Ability to constantly reach outward, handle and finger objects, stand, walk, sit and type using a keyboard
* Ability to frequently bend, squat, kneel, twist, turn, stoop, climb, and crawl
* Ability to occasionally reach above shoulder
* Ability to drive automatic transmission vehicle

title: Store Manager - Intimissimi at one of our Manhattan, NYC locations ($63k-$68k)
description:
Intimissimi is searching for a passionate Store Manager for one of our Manhattan, NYC locations!

**THE ROLE**

The Store Manager is a people and business-oriented profile, which is the key reference point for the store team and will be responsible for overseeing the efficient operations of the store. Our Store Managers always lead their teams by sharing their passion for client service and expertise in fashion. With a people-oriented mindset, Store Managers strive to effectively train and develop their teams to become future leaders.

**LIFE OF THE STORE MANAGER**

The Store Manager sets the tone for the store team and is crucial in creating a memorable in-store experience that builds lasting relationships with customers and solves their lifestyle needs. This role is critical in supporting the execution of the store strategy to achieve performance goals and drive profitable sales growth through all aspects, including customer and product operations, merchandising, and talent development. The Store Manager approaches challenges with an innovative mindset and sees the big picture executing the mission with a positive attitude and great professionalism.

Be a mentor for your team! **You always demonstrate Oniverse’s Key Values: Open Minded, Authentic, Passionate, Dynamic, Team Player, Pragmatic!**

**OPEN MINDED**: Open to learning and receiving guidance and feedback from store leadership. You embrace new ideas, are receptive to customer feedback, and approach challenges with a willingness to explore innovative solutions. You understand the diverse needs and preferences of guests and colleagues, fostering an inclusive and welcoming atmosphere within the store. You actively engage with guests, adapt to ever-changing trends, ensuring a personalized shopping experience.

**AUTHENTIC**: Be real! Honesty is key and always working together with integrity. Store Managers embody genuineness and sincerity. You enjoy authentically connecting with guests, sharing your passion for the brand while fostering loyal and long-lasting relationships with guests and colleagues. **#WeAreOne** We support and encourage a respectful and inclusive team atmosphere by welcoming Diversity, Inclusion and Equity for all team members and guests.

**PASSIONATE**: Share your excitement and promote brand loyalty with guests and store team. As a Store Manager you have firsthand experience with new fashion collections and can share newness with all guests. Share your passion for Intimissimi by building brand loyalty with each guest! Your goal is ensuring each guest has a memorable experience in our shops.

**DYNAMC**: Store Managers thrive in a fast-paced environment, embracing change and adaptability. You will be able to navigate busy hours, responding with care to guests’ inquiries and requests, supporting with visuals updates, assisting with stock management practices, and overall contributing to a seamless shopping experience for guests and efficient environment for colleagues.

**TEAM PLAYER**: We are all in this together! Our Store Managers believe in teamwork through all day-to-day activities to ensure high quality experience for guests, but also supporting each other every step of the way. You collaborate effectively with colleagues, fostering a positive and cooperative atmosphere in the shop. Being part of Intimissimi means lending a helping hand to colleagues, being a mentor for new colleagues, creating a unified and motivated network that delivers high quality guest experience.

**PRAGMATIC**: You are a problem solver! You approach challenges with practicality and resourcefulness, finding effective solutions together with your colleagues and store leadership that align with the store’s goals and guests’ needs. Always balancing creativity and efficiency, while following company policies and procedures.

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Ensure compliance with company policies and procedures.
* Demonstrate sales leadership by playing an active role on the sales floor through customer engagement with top clients, ensuring the highest level of customer service is provided.
* Enforcing exceptional customer service, maximizing and expanding customers’ portfolio utilizing your ability to multi-task projects in a dynamic, fast-paced work environment
* Ensure Clients follow-up by the Sales Team, with customized proposals specifically tailored for their needs
* Achieve and exceed personal sales and productivity goals agreed upon with the District

Manager

* Always representing the brand’s standards for a high-level customer experience
* Be a mentor for your team, inspiring and leading them through product knowledge and brand awareness
* Manage a team of 8-10 individuals
* Proactively follow current competitors and fashion trends
* Attract, recruit and retain a high performing team in an inspiring work environment
* Promote brand awareness, establish store presence and capture competitive market share through community outreach and company sponsored events

**Operations**

* Oversee the processing of daily incoming and outbound merchandise requests and shipments to coordinate the stockroom
* Implement business action plans in collaboration with the District Manager to enhance sales for each product category and client tier segment
* Manage and support stock levels through direct communication with the District Manager to maintaining a high sell through as well as alignment with new product launched
* Able to successfully operate our POS system, conduct email, opening and closing procedures
* Store Cleanliness: at our stores, we take great pride in providing our customers with a clean and well-maintained shopping environment. This includes the cleanliness and organization of the store: including but not limited to the salesfloor, fitting rooms, cash desk area, and backroom areas such as bathroom and stockroom. As a retail employee, you are expected to take the initiative of upkeeping the cleanliness in the store.

Teams will be required to conduct daily cleaning tasks included but not limited to:

* Dust and clean shelves, furniture, fixtures and decor
* Clean doors, window glass, mirrors (exterior and interior)
* Pick up and empty trash cans and garbage taking it to the dumpster as needed
* Sweep and mop hard floors
* Wipe and sanitize sinks, countertops, shared common areas and equipment

**Performance Management**

* Train and communicate current collection knowledge to all team members to ensure they are fully educated on brand guidelines and season strategy
* Utilize fashion expertise to inspire others and build collaborative partnerships in a team-focused environment
* Supporting the Team in maintaining the visual and housekeeping standards of the store
* Conduct coaching and counseling sessions with the team to review performance and provide constructive, timely feedback
* Oversee performance check in process for all store employees and establish individual goals
* Identify and create action plans for team members in collaboration with the District Manager
* Provide accurate monthly schedules by analyzing peak hours to ensure adequate floor coverage and timely submissions of payroll records for all employees
* The Store Manager may be assigned other responsibilities as the direct manager deems fit, pending the company’s business needs and career development purposes.
* Communicate Company set KPi’s and identify strategies to ensure performance standards are met
* Assisting with Store Events: Participating in the planning and the execution of promotional events, product launches, and other initiatives to drive foot traffic and boost sales.

**TEAM DYNAMIC**

* Liaison between Key holders and Assistant Managers to ensure clients experience high quality customer service, completing store operations efficiently and implementing sales strategies thus meeting and exceeding commercial goals.
* Provides training to Key holders and Assistant Managers which may include cross-department functions.
* Based on your experience with Intimissimi and performance, you may be selected to support NEW Stores Openings across the US as a team bonding opportunity and a chance to put your skills and knowledge to the test!
* Participate in nationwide contests within other Intimissimi locations to show our team spirit!

**CAREER DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES**

All Store Managers get the chance to learn new skills daily. We believe in hands-on experience training in different store functions to develop an entrepreneur mindset and spirit, such as: Guest Experience, Basic Store Operations, Business Acumen, Visuals Merchandising, Stock Management, and much more!

**#TeamworkMakesTheDreamWork**

We are all team players! Our leaders always encourage development between team members to support professional growth.

**#KnowledgeisPower**

Share your knowledge and experience with new team members! We strongly believe in consistent training and development of our teams. Many of our success stories started their careers from being part of our store teams and have grown to be future District Managers, Sales Directors, HQ Department positions and beyond!

**Be a part of the Calzedonia USA story and make your mark!**

**JOB REQUIREMENTS** 

* Eligibility to work in the US for any Employer
* High School graduate or equivalent
* Minimum 4 years of experience in customer service and contemporary retail industry preferred
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Commitment, being self-motivated and goal oriented
* Problem solving
* Ability to manage a large team
* You are able to work a flexible schedule, including nights, holidays and weekends
* You are a people person! Working with a team to accomplish store goals, genuinely enjoying an environment of fun music and building connections with our guests for the best shopping experience.
* You are able to lift in excess of 20 pounds and stand for long periods of time, bend, stretch, fora short distance engage in repetitive motions, push, pull and carry items (mannequins, clothing, totes, torsos, etc.) for a short distance including climbing a ladder and use a step stool

**COMPENSATION & BENEFITS PACKAGE** 

* Base Salary, plus monthly bonus based upon budget achievement, store volume and location.
* Medical Insurance
* Pet Insurance
* Paid Time off
* Paid Parental Leave\\*Must meet eligibility requirements
* 401(K) matching
* Pre-Tax commuter benefits for transit and parking (Depending on City/State)
* Sign on Bonus
* Referral bonus
* Employee Discount
* Free Uniform, and so much more!

**Accelerate your skills and build a foundation for your career!**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $63,000.00 - $68,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching

* Flexible schedule

title: Care Coordinator, MA
description:
**Job Title:** Care Coordinator, MA (Telemedicine Programs Specialist)

  


**Location:** Morristown, NJ

  


**Type:** Full-time


**Overview**



The Care Coordinator is a critical role designed to facilitate and enhance telemedicine services, including Remote Patient Monitoring (RPM) and Chronic Care Management (CCM), for patients residing in Skilled Nursing Facilities (SNF). This position serves as the pivotal link between the patients in the SNF and the remote clinical team of a third-party provider, focusing exclusively on managing and coordinating telemedicine care programs. The Care Coordinator does not perform duties within the SNF itself but rather works on behalf of a third-party company to ensure effective and successful delivery of care through telemedicine services.

  


**Responsibilities**



Act as the primary liaison between SNF patients and the remote clinical team, coordinating telemedicine services such as RPM and CCM.



Facilitate the creation and implementation of patient-centered care plans by working closely with remote healthcare providers, specifically tailored to telemedicine frameworks.



Ensure continuous monitoring and assessment of patient conditions, coordinating the flow of vital data between the SNF and the remote clinical team.



Educate and support both patients and SNF staff on the effective use of telemedicine programs, promoting optimal management of chronic conditions and healthcare outcomes.



Advocate for the patient’s needs, ensuring they receive comprehensive and effective care through the telemedicine programs.



Bridge communication and operational gaps between SNF staff and the remote clinical team to ensure seamless delivery of telemedicine services.



Manage and maintain patient records, ensuring accurate and timely communication of health data between the SNF and the remote clinical team.



Monitor and evaluate patient progress within telemedicine programs, working collaboratively with all parties to adjust care plans and interventions for better health outcomes.


**Qualifications**



Certification as a Medical Assistant or in a related healthcare field.



Experience in telemedicine, RPM, or CCM programs, with a strong understanding of care coordination within these settings.



Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively and coordinate between patients, healthcare providers, and facility staff.



Strong organizational and multitasking skills, with the capacity to manage complex care programs and detailed patient data.



Proficiency in electronic medical records (EMR) and telemedicine platforms, with a high level of digital literacy.



Knowledgeable in medical terminology, chronic condition management, and the specific requirements of telemedicine care delivery.



Independent worker with team collaboration skills, committed to enhancing patient care and outcomes through effective telemedicine coordination.


**Ideal Candidate**



The ideal candidate is a dynamic and empathetic professional, skilled in navigating the nuances of telemedicine and adept at coordinating care between remote clinical teams and patients in SNFs. This role is perfect for someone passionate about leveraging technology to improve healthcare delivery and patient outcomes in a telemedicine setting.

  


**To Apply**: Please submit your resume and a cover letter that highlights your experience with telemedicine programs, specifically RPM and CCM, and your proficiency in care coordination within these frameworks.

title: Experienced Veterinary Assistant
description:
**Join the VCA Nassau Suffolk Team**

**VCA Nassau Suffolk** is seeking a full time **Veterinary Assistant** to join our team! We work hard to deliver the best medical care to each patient, and we are excited to welcome a likeminded professional to the team! We have a unique culture in our hospital that values each person’s individual skill and personality, and we truly support your desire to grow medically. There’s something special about you and we are excited to learn more!

**Why join the VCA Nassau Suffolk Family?**


We are passionate about supporting our veterinary assistants and technicians and are committed to your continuing education and personal career development. At VCA Animal Hospitals, we are committed to equity, inclusion, and diversity and strive to be a place where a talented mix of people want to come, stay, and do their best work. We support a work environment where you can focus on your career, happiness, and the patients you serve.


Some of the benefits we offer:

* Access to the people and financial resources of a large veterinary community
* Growth & leadership opportunities
* Career development programs
* Veterinary Technology degree tuition support and scholarships
* Veterinary Technician license reimbursement
* Medical, dental & vision insurance
* Generous hospital discounts and product discounts
* Employer-paid life, long- and short-term disability insurance
* Paid vacation and sick time
* Paid parental leave
* 401(k)
* Free mental health resources and wellness subscriptions (Headspace)
* Referral bonuses
* Competitive wage
* Opportunities to give back through strong Shelter partnerships and VCA Charities

**Why We Want You**


As a member of the VCA team, you will help create and maintain a positive, low-stress atmosphere for our clients and patients. Your mission will be to win the confidence of every pet parent—by delivering an outstanding client experience—so we can provide exceptional care to every patient.


Whether you are a seasoned Veterinary Assistant or a Technician in training, we want you to use the knowledge that you’ve invested your time and talent in. The skills that will be utilized include, but are not limited to:

* Compassionate patient care
* Client education and care
* Pharmacy and medication administration
* Lab sample collection and processing
* Diagnostic imaging
* Surgical preparation and assisting
* Anesthesia monitoring
* Dentistry
* Medical recordkeeping

**The salary range for this position is $18 - $23 / hour**


Ready to grow with a collaborative and supportive team? Apply now- We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Social Worker
company: New Vanderbilt Rehabilitation and Care Center
description:
**Social Worker**





**New Vanderbilt Rehabilitation and Care Center** is seeking a dedicated **Social Worker** to join the team. We are a skilled nursing and rehabilitation facility that is dedicated to helping our residents maximize their potential and live their lives to the fullest. We offer a modern, comfortable, and secure facility staffed by caring professionals where individuals receive the finest sub-acute medical care, rehabilitation services, and 24-hour skilled nursing care. We are committed to maintaining a facility where compassionate care is provided in an environment of respect and dignity. It is also a great, supportive working environment for our dedicated staff!





**Benefits**





* Health insurance, dental and vision
* 401K
* PTO packages including sick time, vacation, personal and holiday.
* Competitive pay
* Positive work environment
* Employee of the month


**Responsibilities of the** **Social Worker:**





* Work collaboratively with members of all disciplines, internally and externally, to ensure the highest quality of care for resident's and families.
* Implement, analyze, and communicate comprehensive risks to ensure appropriate care is being provided.
* Meet with resident's and families to discuss progress, goals, obstacles, and overall expectations.
* Educate residents and families on continued services and possible equipment needs.
* Develop and maintain a quality working relationship with the medical community and other health related facilities and organizations.
* Completion of BIM’s, Mood, Psychosocial, Behavior, and Discharge observations timely and in accordance with established policies and guidelines.
* Interpret social, psychological, and emotional needs of residents.
* Appropriately manage complaints and grievances in accordance with facility’s established policy and procedure.
* Ensure that all charted progress notes are informative and descriptive of the services provided.


**Requirements of the** **Social Worker:**





* year of active patient/resident contact in a health care setting.
* Must have at least 2 years if experience in a long term care setting.
* Experience working with MDS, discharge planning and electronic medical records a plus.
* Bachelor’s Degree in Human Services, Psychology or Social Work.

title: ADON
description:
**Now Hiring Assistant Director of Nursing**


**Excellent Salary and Benefits**


**Sign on Bonus $$$**



Must be RN



**Department:** Nursing

  


**Job Summary:** Responsible for assisting the Director of Nursing in planning, organizing, staffing, directing, coordinating, reporting, budgeting, inventory control, and management of facility, people, supplies, and equipment in such a way that meaningful nursing service is established to render the optimum level of resident care. The ADON reports directly to the Director of Nursing.

  


**QUALIFICATIONS:**


* Must be a graduate of an accredited school of nursing and hold a current Registered Professional Nurse's license in the State of New Jersey.


* Must have working knowledge of nursing services, nursing administration, rehabilitation, general nursing, and geriatric nursing.


* Must be qualified to assume the position by training and /or previous experience of a supervisory status, preferably in a health care facility.


* Must possess the ability to make independent decisions and mature judgments.


* Must have the ability and the willingness to supervise and work harmoniously with professional and non-professional personnel.


* Must have the ability to plan, organize, develop, implement, and interpret the programs, goals, objectives, policies, procedures, etc. of the Nursing Department.


* Knowledge of rehabilitative and restorative nursing practices is preferred.

  


**JOB REQUIREMENTS**


* Must be physically and mentally capable of performing routine job duties.


* Excellence in all aspects of quality nursing including rehabilitative, and restorative.


* Good administrative, managerial, organizational, planning, and interpersonal skills.


* Leadership qualities that motivate and direct the nursing staff.


* Be personable with residents, families, and staff in a professional and cooperative manner.


* Must have compassion, tolerance, and understanding for the residents of the facility.


* Thorough knowledge of JCAHO, OBRA, IDPH, and HFS regulations.

  


**MAIN DUTIES:**


* Support the facility's philosophy of care and strive to achieve its goals and objectives.


* Assist the DON in planning, organizing, and directing the Nursing Department.


* Identify the needs, problems, and progress of nursing services and make recommendations for improvement.


* Assist in developing and administering nursing service policies.


* Assist in establishing standards of nursing practices.


* Assist in defining or revising job requirements, qualifications, and functions of nursing personnel.


* Supervise scheduling of all nursing department employees and coordinate nursing activities to ensure full staffing on a twenty-four (24) hour basis.


* Coordinate all nursing units weekly time schedule, as assigned.


* Enforce policies which are established by the Administrator, DON, and other departments which affect nursing. Ascertain that each employee in the nursing department is aware of the lines of authority and exercise disciplinary action or termination when necessary and provide appropriate documentation in the employee's personnel record.


* Develop and implement a systematic program of evaluation for nursing.


* Supervise, by daily rounds, and evaluate the performance of the:



o a) nurse supervisors



o b) charge nurses



o c) treatment nurses



o d) CNAs


* Provide guidance to the unit nurse in the administration of his/her unit.


* Ensure that nursing personnel provide treatments, medication, diets, rehabilitative nursing care, activities of daily living , protective services, and training in self-care as stated in the care plan to ascertain that optimum comfort and care is provided.


* Make rounds and observe individual residents who are experiencing episodes of acute illness, deterioration in health status, recent injury, recovering from surgery, etc., so as to be acquainted with the resident's status, both physically and emotionally and to ascertain that the staff is rendering proper care.


* Identify educational and clinical needs of the nursing staff and schedule in-services to address them.


* Report pertinent information concerning patient care, performance of personnel and other activities of the units to the DON.


* Assist in orienting new nursing employees to the facility, personnel policy, and unit responsibilities.


* Make recommendations for promotion, transfer and termination of employees.


* Check the time reports of all nursing staff for verification of accuracy and return them to the Administrative Assistant for payroll processing as assigned.


* Attend Medicare, Department Head, Infection Control, Performance Improvement, nursing department meetings, and others as deemed appropriate.


* Maintain up-to-date knowledge of any changes in JCAHO, Federal, and State regulations, assist in modifying department policies to assure compliance, and in-service all effected personnel accordingly.


* Furnish information regarding residents only to authorized agencies or people.


* Delegate the responsibility to daily review the documentation of dispensing controlled substances and narcotics. Reviews the records no less than weekly, or sooner if a discrepancy is noted, to ascertain that they are properly counted and documented from shift to shift.


* Audit sample EMR charting monthly to ascertain proper nursing charting and documentation of care given and directly confer with those employees who are not properly documenting.


* Follow established fire, disaster, safety, infection control and evacuation policies and procedures.


* Supervise, as assigned, review and follow up of consultant reports and recommendations.


* Perform other related duties as assigned by the Administrator and DON.

title: Front-Desk Representative – Part-Time
description:
**Front-Desk Representative – Part-Time**

**Excellent Benefits and Highly Competitive Compensation!**

Great opportunity to join our expanding practice and be part of our commitment to bringing empathy, compassion and a remarkable imaging experience to the communities we serve! Princeton Radiology Associates is a physician group practice providing diagnostic imaging services at 11 imaging centers and two hospitals throughout New Jersey and now in Pennsylvania.

Princeton Radiology Associates is currently seeking a part-time Front-Desk Representative to work in our outpatient imaging facility in Monroe.

**Summary of Position:** 

The Front-Desk Representative is responsible for greeting patients and families, collecting demographic and insurance information, walk-in scheduling, and performing any other duties necessary to provide efficient, timely services to the patients, their families, and providers.

**Responsibilities:** 

* Greet patient and ascertain their needs in a professional and courteous manner.
* Accurately registers patient demographic information.
* Promptly obtain and verify patient insurance.
* Advise patient of their financial obligations and collects appropriate amount.
* Interpret provider orders ensuring an appropriate ICD-10 code has been assigned and accurately reflects the clinical history as indicated by the provider.
* Prepare and process all registration documents.
* Document incoming medical records.
* Maintain appearance of waiting area.
* Promptly answer phone calls within the established customer service guidelines.
* Schedule walk-in patients.
* Assist with additional duties as needed.

**Qualifications:** 

* High School Diploma or GED required.
* Two years of medical office work experience preferred.
* Must be able to work: Monday-Thursday 3:00pm-7:30pm, Friday 3:00pm-6:00pm, and rotating Saturday 6:30am-2:30pm.
* Flexible to cover shifts as needed.
* Demonstrated proficiency with computer technology.
* Ability to handle multiple tasks on a timely basis and work in a team environment.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Demonstrated ability to speak effectively and present a pleasant, profession demeanor/image during telephone conversations or in person.
* Adherence to follow established procedures and make sound decisions based on those procedures.
* Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information according to policy.

Princeton Radiology offers competitive compensation with a comprehensive benefits package, featuring health, dental & vision insurance, company-paid life and long-term disability insurance, generous PTO (increases with years of service), sick time and 401k profit sharing plan with company match and profit-sharing contribution.

For more information regarding Princeton Radiology, visit our website at www.princetonradiology.com

We regret we are unable to respond to each resume received. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls or agencies please.

Princeton Radiology Associates is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Professional Dog Groomer
description:
Dog Groomers are responsible for providing quality grooming services to guests while maintaining a safe, clean and positive environment. A bather is scheduled daily for assistance.

Our salon is open seven days a week, with the exception of major holidays. **We offer employees a set, consistent schedule with flexibility when needed. We are looking for an applicant who is looking to work 4-5 days per week.**

**Compensation:** 50% commission on all services provided.

This is a W-2 position, employees are offered:

* Health, Dental and Vision insurance
* 401K
* Purina for Professionals & more!
* \\*Waiting period may apply; must be full-time employee for health benefits

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

* Brushing, Bathing, Conditioning, De-shedding
* Cutting, Shaving, Trimming, Hand Scissoring
* Nail Trim, Nail Dremel, Anal gland expression, Ear Cleaning
* Hand stripping, Asian fusion and Cat grooming ***a plus but not required***
* Performs grooming services in accordance with owner requests and breed standards
* Communicates effectively to clients regarding coat condition and provides guidance on at-home maintenance when needed
* Strict adherence to all policies and procedures to ensure the safety of all pets and staff
* Handling of dogs of all sizes and breeds
* Uses muzzle when needed
* Maintains own grooming equipment and workspace
* Record accurate groom instruction data in scheduling software

Education and Experience:

* Education: High School Diploma or Equivalent
* **Prior Experience: at least 2 years of professional grooming/cutting experience**
* A paid working interview will be scheduled to ensure quality grooming.

Technical Skills:

* Computer skills: able to use a computer following clear instructions
* Math/numeric skills: basic arithmetic is required.
* Reading skills: able to read instructions
* Listening: listens carefully to coworkers, customers, and animals (growling etc).
* Speaking: participates frequently and effectively to management, coworkers and clients.
* Telephone skills: maintains an exceptional phone presence even in difficult or complex situations. Responsible for follow-up/record keeping on calls.
* Problem-solving: identifies simple problems/probable causes; makes the necessary changes to solve the problem.
* Organized: monitors, records, and tracks the various issues.

Working Conditions and Physical Demands:

* The typical noise level for this position is moderate (i.e. dog barking)
* Sit/stand/walking for an extended period
* Lift up to 50lbs
* Squatting, kneeling, twisting/bending at the waist
* Ability to handle dogs up to 150lbs
* Hear and take care of animals and speak fluently with owners
* See clearly at a distance of 20 inches or less to read documents, view computer screen and insure appropriate dog behavior.

title: Delivery Driver Needed
description:
This is a Full-Time OR Part-Time driver position with VMP Logistics, LLC delivering packages for a national technology company!

We need reliable, independent, flexible, hard workers who pay attention to details, can quickly problem solve a wide range of situations, and win in a fast-paced environment!

Ideal candidates are enthusiastic, communicate effectively, and ready to get the job done.

Successful delivery drivers enjoy being out on the road driving, put safety first and care deeply about customer expectations and satisfaction.

We are looking for team players who desire to grow with the Company

 Military veterans are welcome!

 Commercial, DOT, CDL (or work-related) driving experience is a plus, but not mandatory

 As we grow, supervisory roles will be available

 21.00/hourly (paid weekly)

 10-hour shifts are typical

 4-day work week (40 hours) is typical

 Schedule for FT Team Members is a rotation where team members should not work more than 3 consecutive days, allowing for more personal time;

 A minimum of 2 paid 15-minute breaks during your shift and 1 unpaid 30 minute meal break

 Opportunity for performance incentives and bonuses

 Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance

 Paid time off begins accruing immediately at start of employment

 Successfully handle and deliver packages on time

 Uniforms

 Other safety and administrative gear necessary for job accomplishment

HIRING PROCESS takes approximately 1 WEEK to COMPLETE. It may take longer if you have an out-of-state driver’s license.

title: Client Service Representative
description:
**Job description**

Citizens Debt Relief is looking for highly motivated individuals to become our Client Service Representatives. Ideally, a candidate should be a self-starter and have a passion for helping others. This position is best suited for a person who can communicate effectively with a large portfolio of clients.

As a Client Service Representative, you will be responsible for assisting clients with various inquiries. Building relationships with our valued clients will be your top priority.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Manage the servicing of the existing clients, including handling customer servicing inquiries and dealing with escalated payment issues
* Ensuring the timely collection of statements and other documentation necessary for servicing
* Follow all changing guidelines within the servicing process and applicable policies due to changes in requirements or recommendations by CFPB, FRB and other regulatory agencies
* Determine the reason for cancellation and best course of action to assist in retention
* Increase contact rate effectiveness
* Responsible for managing high volume of phone calls for a large customer base
* Extensive knowledge of the firm's product offerings

**Qualifications**:

* The ideal candidate should demonstrate the ability to determine the best course of action for a client inquiries. Client Service Representatives must be able to work efficiently and with other departments to ensure client inquiries are handled in a timely manner. Must be able to multitask and be very organized juggling multiple tasks at one time.
* Customer Service skills (verbal & written)
* Familiarity with debt settlement products
* Empathetic
* A history of meeting performance targets
* Team Player
* Maintaining a positive attitude
* Professionalism
* Excellent time management and prioritization skills
* Superior organizational skills

**A Little About Citizens:**

Citizens Debt Relief is a leading consumer financial services firm based in the center of New York City. Our pioneered Citizens approach ensures a brighter financial future for our clients. By emphasizing full transparency, cooperation, and grit, our clients can pull themselves out of debt and realize all of their financial goals.

We at Citizens Debt Relief understand that no two clients have the same set of financial circumstances all with the same goal in mind, living without the burden of high-interest credit card debt. Our debt resolution specialists pinpoint and work with your exact needs, customizing an action plan that is designed to alleviate the burden of debt as well as provide insight for personal financial management practices. We provide you with the means to not only resolve your debt but also stay out of debt.  
Our sole mission is to serve our clients who are seeking options to become debt free.

title: Medical Office Receptionist - Orthopaedic Surgery & Pain Management
description:
**Job Title:** Appointment Scheduler  
**Location:** University Spine Center **Reports to:** Office Manager / Practice Administrator

**Job Summary:**

The Appointment Scheduler is responsible for efficiently coordinating patient appointments, ensuring the optimal use of physician and clinical staff time, and providing excellent customer service in an Orthopaedic Spine Surgery and Pain Management practice. This role is key to creating a positive patient experience and maintaining a well-organized schedule that supports the smooth operation of the practice.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Patient Scheduling:**
* Schedule, reschedule, and confirm patient appointments for office visits, surgeries, diagnostic tests, and follow-ups.
* Coordinate scheduling to minimize patient wait times while maximizing physician and staff productivity.
* Communicate appointment details clearly to patients, providing necessary instructions for pre-appointment preparations.
* **Patient Communication:**
* Answer phone calls and manage patient inquiries regarding appointments, cancellations, or changes.
* Verify and update patient demographic and insurance information in the scheduling system.
* Provide reminders and ensure patients are informed of any preparation or documentation required for their appointment.
* **Documentation & System Management:**
* Accurately input patient information and appointment details into the electronic health record (EHR) and practice management systems.
* Ensure all relevant information, including patient history and required documents, is available for the physician prior to each appointment.
* **Coordination with Medical and Office Staff:**
* Collaborate with clinical and administrative staff to optimize the physician’s schedule.
* Communicate with insurance coordinators to ensure proper pre-authorizations and insurance coverage are verified prior to appointments.
* Ensure that necessary diagnostic tests, medical records, and referral paperwork are completed in advance of patient visits.
* **Customer Service:**
* Greet patients in a professional and courteous manner over the phone.
* Address and resolve patient concerns or direct them to the appropriate department.
* Maintain patient confidentiality and adhere to HIPAA regulations at all times.

**Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or equivalent required; associate’s degree or medical office experience preferred.
* **Experience:** 1-2 years of experience in medical office scheduling, preferably in an Orthopaedic, Pain Management, or similar specialty practice.
* **Technical Skills:** Proficiency in using electronic health record (EHR) and practice management software (experience with eClinicalWorks or similar systems is preferred).
* Strong understanding of medical terminology, especially relating to orthopaedics and pain management.
* **Customer Service:** Excellent communication skills with the ability to handle a high volume of patient interactions professionally and with empathy.
* **Organizational Skills:** Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively in a fast-paced environment.
* **Teamwork:** Ability to work collaboratively with clinical and administrative teams to ensure seamless patient care.

**Working Conditions:**

* Full-time position, Monday through Friday.
* Primarily office-based in Wayne, NJ,
* May require occasional overtime to accommodate patient scheduling needs.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary based on experience.
* Health and dental insurance.
* Paid time off (PTO) and holidays.
* 401(k) retirement plan.

**This role is essential to the successful functioning of our practice and is a great opportunity for someone who enjoys interacting with patients and working in a dynamic medical environment.**

* 401(k)
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

title: Assistant Teacher, Children’s People Empowering People
description:
Program Overview

Offered in Spanish, People Empowering People Communities (PEP), is 10-week program for adults that

emphasizes the connection between individuals and community action. The curriculum focuses on values,

communication, life skills, problem-solving, parenting, and developing leadership skills. Dinner is provided

to program participants.

Children’s People Empowering People (CPEP) was developed to be a parallel course to PEP for children

of participants in the PEP program. It is an organic bridge for parents and children to share the course

experience, session by session. PEP aims to enrich the power of children ages 5-12 to assume leadership

roles in order to foster community action. The literacy-based curriculum includes a full spectrum of

activities to parallel the PEP course. Each week, children go home with a free book to build their home

library and reinforce what was learned in class with their parents. CPEP is offered in English.

Position Summary

The Assistant Teacher will assist the Lead Teacher with developmentally appropriate activities for a mixed

aged group of children and support a physically and emotionally safe environment that nurtures and

facilitates the development of both children and families. The Assistant Teacher helps to facilitate class in

a virtual setting, including breakout rooms.

Virtual CPEP classes will be held on Tuesday evenings from 6:00pm-7:30pm and in-person classes will be

held four times on Thursday evenings from 5:30pm-8pm (dinner is served at 5:30pm).

Responsibilities

* Assist the Lead Teacher with administrative tasks such as attendance, set up and clean up of

supplies.

* Engage and interact with children to support learning experiences and encourages students to

think independently and critically, and to express original ideas.

* Work with small groups of students, following the Lead Teacher’s lesson plans, via in-person or

Zoom breakout rooms.

* Assist with four (4) classes in-person for 2.5 hours.
* Assist with 6 classes via Zoom for 1.5-2 hours on Tuesday evenings.
* Assist with a graduation event for children.
* Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

* Must be age 16+.

ExperienceJob Description: Assistant Teacher Approved: 9/17/2024

177 Broad Street, 3rd floor | Stamford, CT 06901 | 203-965-7733 | www.spefct.org

* Experience working with youth in some capacity.
* Self-starter, ability to work independently
* Dynamic personality with an ability and willingness to collaborate.
* Passion for supporting youth and underrepresented populations of the community.
* Strong communication and organization skills.
* Proficient with Zoom.
* Bilingual: English/ Spanish, written/oral (Preferred)

About SPEF

Founded in 1996, the Stamford Public Education Foundation (SPEF) is a registered 501(c)3 non-profit

organization focused on elevating student success by delivering educational programs and solutions that

promote equitable access to quality public education in Stamford. Programming includes mentoring,

tutoring, book distributions, parent leadership training, Pre-K experiences, and more.

As an organization, SPEF envisions a community in which every student is prepared and inspired to

thrive. Further:

* We believe all students have the right to benefit equally from a quality public education.
* We believe SPEF has a responsibility to eliminate barriers that hinder students’ success.
* We believe SPEF has strategic relationships and unique insight to support students in their pursuit

of happiness.

SPEF is committed to policies and procedures that promote diversity, equity, and inclusion in all facets of

its operations.

Equal Opportunity Employer

SPEF is an equal opportunity employer, in compliance with state and federal statutes, we prohibit any

form of unlawful harassment based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, status as a

veteran, or status in any group protected by state or local law where we operate.

title: Superintendent
description:
**Job description**

Apartment Complex located in Scotch Plains, NJ is looking for a **Superintendent to live on-site (apartment is included as part of compensation) after a probationary period**. Must be able to move into a 1 bedroom apartment. The position will include the responsibility for the care and comfort of the residents including, but not limited to, general interior and exterior maintenance, repairs in apartments and building common areas, and responding to service requests of the residents.

**Responsibilities:**

Each super is responsible for the repair, maintenance, comfort, and well being of tenants in their designated buildings.

* Install or repair sheetrock for walls and ceilings.
* Install or repair hardwood floors.
* Install or repair kitchen cabinets.
* Install or repair terrace wood flooring.
* Replace or repair terrace sliding doors.
* Replace or repair electrical devices or wiring.
* Replace or repair plumbing in kitchens or bathrooms.
* Service clogged drains or sewer lines.
* Replace, repair or maintain components in boiler room for heating and hot water supply.
* Replace or repair wood under flooring and retile kitchen and bathroom floors.
* Replace or repair ceramic wall tiles in bathroom and kitchen.
* Replace or repair grout ceramic tile and caulk around tubs.
* Replace or repair air conditioning wall units.
* Replace or set up all kitchen appliances.
* Execute any and all other assignments that may be issued from time to time by their supervisor including but not restricted to snow removal.

**Requirements:**

To perform the tasks above, the Superintendent

* Needs to transport and move tools and materials for both first floor and second floor apartments.
* Needs to climb ladders and work safely overhead with electrical wiring, plumbing, sheetrock and spackle.
* Needs to get into crawl spaces for plumbing, heating and electric repairs and maintenance.
* Needs to move, transport, and install counters, sinks, bathroom vanities, air conditioning units, range hoods, and replacement glass for terrace doors.
* Needs to install replacement windows.
* Needs to replace, repair, and install door hardware.
* Needs to lead in the removal of snow in their assigned buildings and maintain safe conditions of sidewalks, steps and building entrances during freezing weather.
* When assuming “on call” duty on nights or weekends, all supers have to perform any or all of the above functions as may be required for specific and emergency situations.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* On call
* Weekends as needed

Work Location: In person

title: Intake Specialist
description:
**Company Overview**

*Looking to work with a great supportive team of professionals?* Founded in 1984, Realization Center is the oldest and largest free-standing, private chemical dependence treatment program in Manhattan and Brooklyn. It is a unique, comprehensive, full-service treatment program provides outpatient treatment focusing on patient centered care.

Realization Center serves a wide range of clients including individuals with substance use and mental health diagnosis. We offer specialized and focused treatment groups for men, women, LGBTQ+, Young adults and adolescent with substance use issues, as well as numerous mental health issues such as depression, anxiety, post-traumatic stress, sexual trauma, family of origin issues, domestic violence, anger and stress management, school or job difficulties, family conflict, parenting difficulties, relationship problems and legal issues as they relate to substance use/abuse. Our goal at RCI is to help our clients start and maintain their unique journey to lasting health and wellbeing.

**Intake Counselor** needed for successful and fast paced outpatient treatment center.

**Duties and responsibilities:**

* Engage, educate and assist clients looking to participate in substance use treatment
* Maintain comprehensive documentation of all intake related services to ensure compliance with insurance and OASAS guidelines
* Keep appropriate records on clients per Realization Center Outpatient guidelines, standards, and policies
* Receive scheduled and walk-ins. Assess potential clients for history of intoxication, drug use, suicidal/homicidal risk, and mental health disorder, reason for treatment and appropriateness for OP level of care treatment
* Address high-risk client issues with assistance of supervisor
* Participate in weekly supervision meetings and present your intake findings, communicate any necessary follow-up with the newly assigned case manager
* Perform other duties as delegated by your supervisor

**Required Qualifications:**

* Knowledge and interest in substance use treatment and mental health
* Excellent assessment skills
* Experience with court mandated community a plus

title: Production Operator - 3rd Shift
description:
**Requisition ID:** 54407  

**Position Type:** (US)Full Time  

**Workplace Arrangement:**


**About Kerry**
---------------


Kerry is the world's leading taste and nutrition company for the food, beverage and pharmaceutical industries. Every day we partner with customers to create healthier, tastier and more sustainable products that are consumed by billions of people across the world. Our vision is to be our customers' most valued partner, creating a world of sustainable nutrition. A career with Kerry offers you an opportunity to shape the future of food while providing you opportunities to explore and grow in a truly global environment.**Where you'll work:**
----------------------



Our Clark location creates flavor ingredients and beverages for Kerry customers and brands. We are a fast paced, never a dull moment manufacturing facility with a culture of accountability and teamwork. We’re proud of where we live and actively participate in community activities. If you've got an eagle eye for quality and are looking for a team to develop and grow with then this job might be the one for you!

  


**3rd shift opening, must be able to work 10:15PM - 6:30AM!**


**What you'll do:**
-------------------



As a Production Operator you’ll follow procedures for system start-up, operation, shutdown, cleaning, and batching. Some of those responsibilities include:


* Mixing chemical and food batches, monitoring and sampling in accordance with SOPs & recording process and production data.
* Troubleshooting dryer processes (work closely with Supervisors and Maintenance in troubleshooting problems), assisting with routine maintenance and maintaining the dryer up in a clean work environment.
* Overseeing cleanup of entire dryer system between products, Responsible for making sure blends are placed into the blending tanks correctly, utilizing process control sheets. This includes weighing up of any minor ingredients, double checking item numbers, batch quantities, and lot numbers.
* Ensure all paperwork is completed correctly and all filling instructions are followed for each order. Must be able to operate pumps, mixers, filters in a safe and efficient manner.
* Responsible for checking brix and acid on the blend and adjust it accordingly to be within the customer specifications.
* Complete Master Sanitation Sheet and assisting on cleaning when needed.
**What You'll Need to Be Successful and Safe:**
-----------------------------------------------



Minimum Requirements for Consideration:


* Minimum 6 months experience in warehouse/manufacturing environment. Must be able to lift up to 55 lbs., push up to a 450 lb. metal drum on a roller conveyor, and stand for prolonged periods.
* Read, write, speak the English language.
* Follow Proper housekeeping and sanitary GMP procedures to prevent product contamination; use clean tools and utensils, and properly stored or hung to prevent product contamination.
* Experience using a Manufacturing Execution System is a plus. (SAP) & be able to -Return material with necessary SSCC labels.
* Must be able to operate a computer and feel comfortable using two different HMI systems for operation (SAP and Wonder ware)
* Communication skills is a plus (Be able to report metrics on the shift exchange)
* Be able to work mandatory overtime over the weekend.
* Other duties as required.

  




The typical hiring range for this role is $16.91 – $24.39 per hour and is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications. This position may also be eligible for a shift differential and/or overtime. In addition to your pay, Kerry offers benefits such as a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and retirement contribution (all benefits and incentives are subject to eligibility requirements).



Kerry is an equal opportunity employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. Kerry will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditional upon the successful completion of a background investigation and drug screen. Additional information can be found at: Know Your Rights: Workplace Discrimination is Illegal (dol.gov).


Beware of scams online or from individuals claiming to represent us. A Kerry employee will not solicit candidates through a non-Kerry email address or phone number. In addition, Kerry does not currently utilise video chat rooms (e.g., Google Hangouts) to conduct interviews. Refuse any request that asks you to provide payment to participate in the hiring process (e.g., purchasing a “starter kit,” investing in training, or something similar). Kerry will not ask you to pay any money at any point in the hiring process with the exception of reimbursable travel expenses. In addition, any payments made by Kerry will be from official firm accounts bearing the Kerry name.


**Recruiter:**  

**Posting Type:** DNI
