title: Paralegal (Entry Level)
company: Pasternack Tilker Ziegler Walsh Stanton & Romano LLP
description:
For over 80 years, Pasternack Tilker Ziegler Walsh Stanton and Romano, LLP. has been defending the rights of New Yorkers. Our attorneys help hard-working people get the compensation they rightfully deserve. With 12 offices throughout the five boroughs, Long Island and Upstate New York, our firm serves clients in need of legal representation for Worker’s Compensation, Social Security Disability, Civil Service Disability Pensions, and Personal Injury claims.

We are currently seeking an experienced Paralegal to join our highly productive Social Security Disability practice. This position involves daily and constant work helping attorneys keep their cases well-organized and moving. The ideal candidate will be highly motivated, have a high standard of ethics and strong communication skills.

Duties/Responsibilities:

· Conducting claimant interviews for new cases

· Open new files, gather and analyze intake information and relevant documents.

· Heavy call volume which includes extensive contact with clients, attorneys, insurance adjusters, and medical providers, In person client appointments

· Case Management and File Reviews for preparation of upcoming hearings and settlements

· Read, interpret, and follow up on medical reports.

· Contact insurance carriers for payments and medical treatment issues.

· Performs other related duties as assigned.

Required Skills/Abilities:

· Excellent verbal and written communication skills; effectively shows empathy to claimants who are dealing with difficult circumstances.

· Upbeat with a can-do attitude; must be able to work independently and have a desire to assume significant responsibility.

· Understanding of legal language and principles, and other related matters.

· Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills.

· Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.

· Excellent time management skills with a proven ability multitask and meet deadlines.

· Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

· Ability to function well in a high-paced and at times stressful environment.

· Ability to maintain confidentiality, and to exercise discretion and good judgment.

· Proficient with Microsoft Office Outlook, Excel, and Word.

· Fluent in Spanish is a plus.

As part of a performance-based culture, you will work alongside a team of engaged like-minded compassionate professionals. Essentially, you would support a collegian team of legal experts, dedicated to fighting hard and winning big for our clients.

If you strive for excellence and are ready to hit the ground running with one of NYC’s top-rated law firms, submit a cover letter and your resume for immediate consideration.

title: Specialist – Wellness Program Administration
description:
We are currently seeking a full-time **Specialist, Wellness Program Administration** to join our on-site wellness team based out of **Jersey City, NJ.**


**Job Overview:**



The Specialist – Wellness Program Administration’s primary responsibility is to represent Optum Workplace Well-being at our client, coordinate and execute programs and events, manage projects, and support programming logistics and administration for broader team. Additional duties include identifying and initiating additional business opportunities for both Optum Workplace Well-being and the client.


**What you will do:**


* Manage and execute projects, events and programs to budget and timelines through the use of project plans, event calendars, vendor relationships, and other project management tools
* Coordinate program specific working teams, including delegation of deliverables, scheduling regular planning meetings, developing stakeholder postings and management of internal approval processes
* Facilitate all program logistics including contract execution, room reservations, event registration links, attendee management, etc.
* Execute programs and events, including coordinating day-of on-site logistics and troubleshooting issues as needed.
* Support the measurement and evaluation of programming including participant satisfaction, program impact, program value (e.g. effort/cost vs. impact) and program utilization
* Assist Wellness Inbox and Information Line


**What we are looking for:**


* Bachelor’s degree, preferably in business or event management, Health Promotion, Marketing or Public Health Administration
* 3+ years of work experience, preferably in event planning, wellness programming, sports recreation, and/or operations roles
* Strong background in project management
* Skilful in Zoom technology
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite particularly Excel and Power Point
* Experience in a corporate worksite environment
* Possess knowledge and interest in health, fitness and wellness-related fields (nutrition, exercise science, sports recreation, health promotion, human resources / organizational behavior)
* Demonstrable ability to prioritize workload and work in a deadline-driven environment
* Unrelenting commitment to delivering best in class Wellness services and offerings


**About Us:**



Plus One, part of the Optum Workplace Well-being portfolio of services, provides fitness and well-being services to clients across a broad range of industries, driving employee engagement in health and wellness programs. Our services include fitness, nutrition, ergonomics, wellness coaching and health promotion. Our team members believe that the most effective way to help people adopt a healthier lifestyle is through personal connections infused with hospitality, empathy and a lot of fun.


**Perks of working at Plus One, an Optum company\\*:**


**Health and financial:**


* Medical plan choices with Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) and Health Savings Account (HSA) options
* Dental and Vision coverage plans
* 401(k) Retirement & Savings Plan
* Life Insurance (team member, spouse and dependents)
* Short and Long Term Disability Plans
* Accident & Critical Illness Insurance
* Transportation and Parking Plans
* Paid parental leave
  


**Well-being:**


* Paid time off
* Wellness rewards program
* Free memberships to various fitness facilities and wellness subscriptions
* 24/7 health and wellness support through the Employee Assistance program
* Entertainment and consumer discounts
* Dedication to ensuring a cohesive and inclusive culture led by an internal diversity, equity and inclusion council
  


**Growth and development:**


* Free professional development courses through internal learning management systems
* Discounted certifications through industry leading agencies
* Free CPR/AED certifications
* Free continuing education courses and credits
* Employee Referral Reward program
  


* Please note, some of the benefits listed above are only available to team members who work full time hours.


**Equal opportunity statement**



Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere. Plus One, an Optum Company is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

description:
**Overview**


Joining the Con Edison Energy Storage Team is an ideal path to building your clean energy career and helping to deploy energy storage projects in a rapidly evolving energy landscape. The Specialist in Business Development will be responsible for creating and advancing business development efforts for Con Edison's Utility Dispatch Rights (Bulk Storage) procurements This role will lead the development of new processes to support the completion of third-party Utility Storage projects and includes external/internal stakeholder engagement, building and maintaining relationships with industry partners, New York agencies, and developers seeking to build energy storage in New York City and Westchester. The position will also include opportunities to support policy, economic, data, and new technology research to support our procurements. The Bulk Storage Procurement Group plays a critical role in helping New York City and Con Edison facilitate the energy transition by creating competitive market opportunities to secure long-term bulk energy contracts from third-party storage developers connected to both the transmission and distribution system in our service territory. The Specialist should be attuned to the market forces shaping the future of energy storage in Con Edison's service territory and opportunities for storage to participate in NYISO markets. They will be charged with describing the business proposition to potential procurement participants, facilitating stakeholder dialogue around storage deployment, and illustrating the benefits storage can provide for both grid operations and supporting the use of renewable sources of generation. By representing the Utility Dispatch Rights programs in stakeholder presentations and other communications, the Senior Specialist will play a critical role in expediting storage deployment in Con Edison's service territory.**Responsibilities**


**Core Responsibilities*** Lead the development of a proactive, collaborative culture to foster trust and efficiency of the Utility Dispatch Rights process among project development and industry partners, technology providers, financiers, NYC agencies, and the program team, and build, maintain and create new relationships.
* Engage with internal and external groups to develop processes and improve the solicitation and contracting experience
* Support policy, technology, and data analytics work related to Utility Dispatch Rights contracts
* Oversee all aspects of the Utility Dispatch Rights program outreach including planning, organizing, coordinating, and managing timelines and information
* Represent the Company at industry conferences and meetings with external stakeholders related to the development of EV programs and initiatives.
* Hybrid work arrangement including reporting to Company headquarters at 4 Irving Place in New York City, as well as attending industry conferences and events, and in-person customer/developer meetings.
* Perform other related tasks and assignments as required.

**Qualifications**


**Required Education/Experience*** Bachelor's Degree and 2 years' work experience or
* Master's Degree in Economics, public policy, business, or management and 2 years' work experience


**Preferred Education/Experience*** Master's Degree in Economics, public policy, business, or management and 2 years' work experience


**Relevant Work Experience*** Experience/knowledge in software applications such as MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), required. Required and
* Knowledge related to utility electrical systems (Distribution & Transmission), preferred. Preferred and
* Familiarity with the Department of Public Service (DPS) state regulatory process and related statutes such as the Climate Leadership and Community Protection Act (CLCPA) Preferred and
* Experience in sales, marketing, or customer/stakeholder outreach, preferred. Preferred and


**Skills And Abilities*** Effective interpersonal skills and
* Demonstrated written communication skills and
* Excellent organizational skills and
* Well organized, detail oriented and flexible to handle multiple assignments and
* Ability to drive multiple projects to successful completion and
* Possesses flexibility to work in a fast paced, dynamic environment and
* Ability to work within tight timeframes and meet strict deadlines and


**Licenses And Certfications*** Driver's License Required


**Physical Demands*** Sit or stand to use a keyboard, mouse, and computer for the duration of the workday


**Additional Physical Demands*** Must be able to respond to Company emergencies by performing a System Emergency Assignment to restore service to our customers.
* Must be able and willing to travel within Company service territory, as needed.

title: Head of Property Management - North America
description:
This is your opportunity to join AXIS Capital – a trusted global provider of specialty lines insurance and reinsurance. We stand apart for our outstanding client service, intelligent risk taking and superior risk adjusted returns for our shareholders. We also proudly maintain an entrepreneurial, disciplined and ethical corporate culture. As a member of AXIS, you join a team that is among the best in the industry.
At AXIS, we believe that we are only as strong as our people. We strive to create an inclusive and welcoming culture where employees of all backgrounds and from all walks of life feel comfortable and empowered to be themselves. This means that we bring our whole selves to work.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion or creed, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, age, marital status, civil union status, family or parental status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Accommodation is available upon request for candidates taking part in the selection process.
 AXIS Capital
 Head of Property Management – North America
North America*Basic Function Requirements*
Reports to the Global Head of Corporate Real Estate.
Lead the strategic and operational day-to-day management of the AXIS North American offices portfolio to ensure there is a consistently high standard of care and service delivery for both internal and external customers throughout the real estate lifecycle.
In addition to managing a team of staff integral to strategy implementation and location oversight, the Head of Property Management North America maintains a close working partnership with regional counterparts, local senior management, business line managers, and firm management as required. This leader also maintains strong relationships with 3rd party suppliers who are engaged for the delivery of goods and services, repairs and maintenance, workplace and asset management, and overall customer satisfaction.
The Head of Property Management North America oversees all aspects of site(s) management which at a minimum includes lease administration, transaction management, project management, workplace and facilities services delivery for all North America AXIS locations. In addition, driving a data culture and focus on managing portfolio cost of ownership, vendor performance, and all aspects of workplace optimization to ensure effective use of our workplace and operational spend is expected at a minimum.
Developing and implementing Property Management strategies that support corporate core values and objectives with a commitment to continuous improvement and innovation is expected. The leader ensures that business guidelines and compliance requirements are always adhered to and that the portfolio is managed in accordance with commercial whole life cost principles. A focus on continuous improvement and innovation is to be at the forefront of our thinking and approach.
Travel within the region may be required from time-to-time to support Property Management activities.*Principal Responsibilities and Dutie**s** Responsible for all Property Management functional areas and serves as a point of escalation for all Property Management issues to internal business units, ensuring effective control, optimized workplace management, and quality service delivery to AXIS’s portfolio, and end user clients.
* Spearhead the commercial and operational activities of the Property Management function while leading the team to execute on short- and long-term strategic initiatives.
* Strong commercial and financial acumen resulting in comprehensive capital and operational budgeting, diligent expense management, and reporting on same.
* Manage a team of directly employed staff, oversee staff training and development, coach and mentor staff to develop and realize their full potential while also facilitating succession planning.
* Ensure that the team’s goals and all agreed performance management metrics are satisfied or exceeded.
* Commitment to facilitating the team, with its execution of remit and responsibilities, to meet AXIS’s business needs with the aim of providing a first-class employee and guest experience.
* Build a team culture focus on the use of technology and data to identify opportunities, support recommendations and optimize outcomes and end user experience.
* Ensure that asset management, preventative maintenance, and utilities management activities are managed with appropriate controls and utilized to assure quality and performance outcomes, and optimize cost.
* Lead transformational change of program implementations with a focus on seamless execution and risk mitigation to the enterprise.
* Manage 3rd party supplier relationships in an effective manner, ensuring compliance with AXIS’s vendor management program and risk mitigation efforts with diligence to always protect the firm.
* Oversee the delivery of an effective health & safety program to ensure full compliance with the relevant laws and regulations.
* Support the workplace design evolution by providing ongoing support, client, and operational feedback to ensure a delivery that improves the employee experience.
 *Administration – Finance, Risk* *Mitigation**,* *Supplier* *and Contract Management** Overall management and coordination amongst the various functional teams within the Property Management service delivery.
* Focus on the cost of ownership and end-to-end management of the AXIS occupied real estate portfolio.
* Utilize data to identify improvement opportunities, matters requiring resolution, and recommendations to support changes within the workplace environment.
* Manage and control all aspects of capital and operational planning, budgeting, and expense management for AXIS’s real estate portfolio.
* Mitigate the firm’s exposure to business risk by continuously reviewing operational and maintenance procedures to eliminate single points of failure and the adequacy of business continuity plans.
* Landlord and lease management experience to assure a working relationship that assures landlord delivery of obligations, and equitable outcomes for AXIS Capital.
* Conduct client feedback meetings, noting any concerns raised and addressing them as appropriate.
* Undertake benchmarking comparisons, establish metrics, and provide leadership and a plan to realize “best in class” workplace and services delivery to the AXIS enterprise.
* Audit operational delivery by using appropriate SLA and KPI performance criteria and measurements to assure customer satisfaction and a focus on continuous improvement.
* Drive a commitment to standards that achieve a consistent delivery of service and end user experience within the office portfolio.
* Track and report compliance with AXIS standards and requirements as required.
* Ownership and focus on fire and life safety measures, demand and consumables management, and sustainability for all managed and operated sites.
*Skills** Strategic approach, and use of good judgement in the decision-making process, with the ability to develop implementation plans for execution.
* Creative problem solver who can use experience and data to identify solutions with sensitivity to organizational impact.
* Ability to work independently, use self-initiated follow up to meet deadlines, and to successfully manage multiple projects/programs concurrently.
* Proven ability to inspire confidence, motivate, and lead others.
* Well organized, initiative-taking, flexible and goal oriented.
* Excellent communication, interpersonal, presentation, and client management skills.
*Qualifications** Qualified to degree standard or higher in a Corporate Real Estate, Project Management, Finance and/or Facilities Management Services discipline with at least 15 years’ experience of Property Management.
* Deep financial planning, operational workplace and services delivery, and reporting experience with a proven ability to optimize cost and achieve value for spend and investment.
* Demonstrated roles in holistic real estate portfolio services delivery and vendor management, particularly in relationship to managing performance-based contract(s) and developing strategic alliances/partnership with workplace services suppliers.
* Technology literate: Microsoft Suite (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint), Lease Administration tools, Financial Reporting tools, and workplace service delivery and facilities management technologies.
* Experience in developing high performing teams; coaching and mentoring, implementing professional development programs, and the training of personnel.

What we offer:
For this position, we currently expect to offer a base salary in the range of $170,000 - 200,000. Your salary offer will be based on an assessment of a variety of factors including your specific experience and work location.
In addition, you will be offered competitive target incentive compensation, with awards based on overall corporate and individual performance. On top of this, you will be eligible for a comprehensive and competitive benefits package which includes medical plans for you and your family, health and wellness programs, retirement plans, tuition reimbursement, paid vacation, and much more.
Where this role is based in the United States of America, this role is *Exempt* for FLSA purposes.

title: Program Underwriting Manager – Commercial Auto
description:
This is your opportunity to join AXIS Capital – a trusted global provider of specialty lines insurance and reinsurance. We stand apart for our outstanding client service, intelligent risk taking and superior risk adjusted returns for our shareholders. We also proudly maintain an entrepreneurial, disciplined and ethical corporate culture. As a member of AXIS, you join a team that is among the best in the industry.
At AXIS, we believe that we are only as strong as our people. We strive to create an inclusive and welcoming culture where employees of all backgrounds and from all walks of life feel comfortable and empowered to be themselves. This means that we bring our whole selves to work.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion or creed, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, age, marital status, civil union status, family or parental status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Accommodation is available upon request for candidates taking part in the selection process.
Program Underwriting Manager – Commercial Auto
New York – Hybrid
How does this role contribute to our collective success?
The Program Underwriting Manager – Auto is responsible for the product management of all auto products (both ISO and manuscript) distributed across the North American Programs Platform; delegated underwriting authorities. The role will have responsibility for management of assigned programs, and the evaluation of new program submissions.
What will you do in this role?
Product Management* Responsible for product management for all auto products across all programs, including those that you do not directly manage.
* Develop and maintain a repository of all products within the auto family to include auto liability, auto physical damage, and contingent liability.
* Evaluate and approve all new product development and rate/rule/form changes within the department. Supervise all auto filings and regulatory compliance.
* Determine product competitiveness, pricing efficacy and market acceptance for all auto liability and physical damage covers, including contingent liability.


Program Management* Overall management of assigned programs, to include responsibility for development, implementation, and monitoring of business plans, coordination of AXIS resources, and achievement of financial goals.
* Manage delegated underwriting authority for assigned programs by maintaining program management agreements and underwriting guidelines. Conduct routine underwriting and rate/rule/form audits to ensure compliance.
* Underwrite auto referral accounts across the department.
* Identify and deliver expansion of AXIS product offering with existing programs.
* Train fellow Program Underwriting Managers with responsibility for programs with auto products on best-in-class commercial auto underwriting.


About You:
We encourage you to bring your own experience and expertise to the table, so while there are some qualifications and experiences, we need you to have, we are open to discussing how your individual knowledge might lend itself to fulfilling this role and help us achieve our goals.
What you need to have:* Deep expertise in ISO-based Commercial Auto products to include coverage, policy construction, and rating.
* Familiarity with ISONet and navigating the Commercial Lines Manual
* Direct experience in underwriting and managing Delegated Underwriting Authority (PAs, MGAs, MGUs).
* 8+ years in underwriting Commercial Auto (specially in medium, heavy and extra heavy Classes)
* Ability to negotiate contracts, develop business plans, and manage external stakeholders in the deliverance of business plans.
* In-depth financial and underwriting understanding of programs business, with the ability to assess and develop financial projections and forecasts on existing and prospective programs.
* Proficiency in Excel (build models and conduct analyses), Power BI, PowerPoint, and Word.


What we prefer you to have:* Prior management experience
* Ability to effectively interact at all levels of internal and external business partners
* Ability to bring order to a dynamic and ambiguous environment
* Sense of urgency and a “can do” attitude
* Ability to collaborate and mindfully communicate in a matrixed organization
* Bachelors degree
* Industry Accreditations


Role Factors:* Work in the New York office Tuesday-Thursday
* Travel domestically 1–2 times per quarter
* Attend industry events over weekends occasionally


What we offer:
For this position, we currently expect to offer a base salary in the range of $190,000 to $225,000 (NY), Your salary offer will be based on an assessment of various factors including your specific experience and work location.

title: Registered Nurse, FT or PD
description:
**Allaire Rehab & Nursing**is looking for a **Registered Nurse, RN** to join our incredible team!  


We're not just a workplace; we're a community driven by excellence. We take immense pride in what sets us apart - our exceptional leadership, a warm and friendly work environment, and a reputation that we've worked hard to earn. If you're ready for a rewarding career experience, your journey begins here!  


**Shift Hours:** **All Shifts Available****3PM-11PM; 11PM-7AM for both FT or PD**  



**Registered Nurse, RN Benefits:**

* Competitive wages based on experience
* Daily pay option available
* Flexible schedule
* Generous paid time off (PTO) package
* Medical, Dental and Vision insurance
* Supplemental disability and life insurance options available
* Flexible Spending Account
* **401k Matching for FT ONLY**
* Career advancement opportunities / tuition reimbursement
* Complementary uniform
* Friendly work environment
* Referral bonus
  


**Registered Nurse, RN Responsibilities**:

* Under the supervision of the Director of Nursing, the RN utilizes a general understanding of the principles of nursing and basic physical assessment skills in the development of and implementation of individualized nursing care plans to ensure that the needs of the residents are met.
* RN assists in the orientation of and supervision of nursing personnel, attends to the daily operations of the unit per shift, unit level, and assumes responsibilities of a leadership role as needed.
* Takes an active role in direct resident assessment and care;
* Supervises and coordinates nursing personnel in providing direct resident care in adherence to State and Federal regulations;
* Formulates individualized nursing care plans utilizing the nursing process;
* Assesses each resident daily and implements a change in the course of action as needed;
* Assists the physician on rounds and ensures that pertinent information is communicated to and from him/her and orders are taken correctly;
* Participates in the training and supervision of nursing personnel
* Utilizes effectively the general principles of leadership and supervision
* Manages conflict through effective problem-solving and communication skills
* Acts calmly and efficiently in handling emergency situations;
* Prepares daily assignment of duties, treatments, and miscellaneous tasks
  


Ready to take the next step in your career journey? We're excited to get to know you! Apply today and discover why Allaire Rehab & Nursing is the perfect place for your professional aspirations.  


Join us at Allaire Rehab & Nursing, a member of Allaire Health Services, and start a career that's not just about work, but about making a meaningful difference in the lives of others. Your future starts here. Come be a part of our extraordinary team!

title: Retail Store Manager - Sono Collection
description:
Job description



Job description


**Join the Lovisa America team:**



It is exciting times at Lovisa with many new stores opening across America, so we are looking for our next amazing Lovisa Sales Super Stars to join our growing team.


**Store Manager:**



You will be the Lovisa ambassador and lead your team by example. Sharing sales techniques and achieving your stores KPIs. If you’re someone that see’s yourself as a great leader and want to climb the retail ladder, then this is the role for you!


**Our Brand:**



Lovisa was created out of a need for on-trend fashion jewelry at ready-to-wear prices. Our trend spotting departments worldwide take inspiration from couture runways and current street style to deliver new, must-have styles to our customers.



We are a fashion-forward jewelry brand that caters to every woman, with 150 new styles being delivered to stores each week. We give exceptional customer service and apply our core belief, “It’s about the customer, always” in everything we do.



Established in Australia Lovisa launched its first store in 2010, Since then Lovisa has opened over 550 stores across 20 countries: New Zealand, The United States, Singapore, Malaysia, South Africa, United Kingdom, France, Germany, Belgium, Netherlands, Switzerland, Austria, Luxembourg. As we continue to grow, vast opportunities will arise and are on offer for self-motivated and enthusiastic leaders and Team Members.


**Lovisa Benefits**:


* Health Benefits


* Generous product discount


* Ongoing training, mentoring and support.


* Incentives galore.


* Ear piercing training.


* Career progression and growth.


* A culture that is committed to continuous improvement!


* Opportunity to join one of Australia’s fastest and most successful global retail brand!


**What we are looking for!**


* Are you an existing Store Manager or Assistant Store Manager with experience in creating a team environment, to coach, develop and motivate your team to deliver great results?


* Are you a leader who cares for your team and builds great relationships?


* Do you have a strong desire to deliver an exceptional experience to your customer?


* Do you have experience in delivering and driving targets? (KPI’s)


**To be successful in this role you will have:**


* Open availability to work any shift


* Must be 18yrs and older


* Store management experience for a retailer or hospitality


* Ability to perform in a fast-paced, high volume retail environment


* Strong people management skills and thorough understanding of performance management


* Excellent planning and organizational skills


* A proven track record of delivering results


* Exceptional communication skills


* Passion for retail and fashion!



If you are seeking a fast paced and exciting successful career with a variety of continued opportunities and with a brand that embraces a dynamic and passionate culture, then we would love to discuss this opportunity with you!



Job Type: Full-time
company_description: To bring brilliantly affordable, on-trend jewellery to the WORLD, whilst delighting our customers with our commitment to continually improve your Lovisa experience.

title: Science Teacher
description:
**Organizational summary:**

Since 1927, the Yeshivah of Flatbush has stood at the forefront of American Jewish education and has set the standard of excellence emulated by other academic institutions. It has imbued its students with a thirst for knowledge, a commitment to Torah and Zionism, a love of the Hebrew language and the dedication to serve the greater Jewish and secular communities. The school philosophy is a synthesis of Judaic studies, liberal arts and extracurricular activities that places great emphasis on the students' character development. It has evolved into a unique complement of Jewish and American values that focuses on all aspects of education and enables our graduates to meet the challenges of college and life. In the years to come, we look forward to continuing the traditions of excellence, innovation and leadership that have made us a world-renowned institution.
**Organizational mission:**

The mission of the Yeshivah of Flatbush is to:* **EMPOWER** our students to develop exceptional character and intellect.
* **EDUCATE** through a rigorous Torah b'Ivrit and General Studies program with a robust set of co-curricular opportunities in a supportive and nurturing environment.
* **INSPIRE** a love for and commitment to Torah U'Mitzvot, Medinat Yisrael, and Klal Yisrael with responsibility to advance the welfare of all humanity.

  


**Science Teacher:** Yeshivah of Flatbush Middle School is seeking a Science Teacher for grades 6 through 8. Must be prepared to teach in a student-centered, developmentally appropriate environment. Bachelor's degree required, Masters preferred. 3+ years experience. Please email resumes to Ms. Lizit Chalouh at lchalouh@flatbush.org

title: Head of Financial Planning & Analysis, US & Americas
description:
Job description
Our purpose – Opening up a world of opportunity – explains why we exist. Here at HSBC we use our unique expertise, capabilities, breadth and perspectives to open up new kinds of opportunity for our more than 40 million customers. We’re bringing together the people, ideas and capital that nurture progress and growth, helping to create a better world – for our customers, our people, our investors, our communities and the planet we all share.  

  

The role holder will lead, shape and steward the US and Americas performance. Delivering a cohesive and effective strategic overview that meets global regulatory requirements whilst offering quantitative and qualitative insight to support decision making within the bank. This role involves the oversight of all planning, forecasting and internal reporting processes in the US and across the Americas region US including responsibility of regional execution processes, regional analytical review and challenge processes and regional governance activities for group and regional exercises.  

  

As our Head of Financial Planning & Analysis, US & Americas you will:

  

* Lead and shape the Financial Planning and Analysis function in the US and Americas, bringing together the skills and capabilities across the region to deliver effective support to senior management through a true US and Americas operating model
* Lead the delivery of all forecasting exercises across the region and countries
* Review, challenge and interpretation of the results, and to communicate the results to executive levels up to the Local Boards and sub-committees. This includes effective analytical challenge of key outputs (profitability, capital on local and Group basis, dividends, leverage, etc) and key results drivers (RWAs, loan impairments, trading book losses, AFS reserves, NII, fees, income and costs, etc)
* Lead the work to streamline our internal financial reporting, working closely with global and regional colleagues across FP&A, Business Finance and Strategic Cost Management specifically to ensure a fit-for-purpose suite of rationalized, consistent reporting that supports management decision making
* Lead the regional and in-country teams to deliver high quality, timely, value-add analysis across all internal and external reporting, Financial Resource Plan (FRP), and other analytical processes
* Partner with the business and with the regional and country CEOs, CFOs and other strategic decision makers, to help them understand business performance and inform and drive strategic decision making
* Oversee the delivery of reports including to ExCo, HNAH and HLAH Boards, and commentary to support external results
* Adopt the Group Compliance Policy by escalating any identified compliance risk in liaison with Global Compliance Officer, Area Compliance Officer or Local Compliance Officer. The term ‘compliance’ embraces all relevant financial services laws, rules and codes with which the business has to comply
  

For this role, HSBC targets a pay range between $250,000 and $320,000.  

  

The final fixed pay offer will depend on the candidate and a number of variables, including but not limited to, role responsibilities, skill set, depth of experience and education, licensing/certification requirements, internal relativity, and specific work location.  

  

At HSBC, our overall goal is to provide a competitive Total Reward Package, with an appropriate mix of fixed pay, and variable pay, as part of an employee’s overall total compensation and benefits. Variable pay generally takes the form of discretionary, annual awards (sometimes referred to as a “bonus”). Additionally, HSBC offers a wide range of competitive and flexible benefits designed to help you improve your health and well-being, finances, and lifestyle.


Requirements
You´ll likely have the following qualifications to succeed in this role:

  

* Commercially minded and customer focused, with outstanding leadership skills, demonstrating ability to use initiative and effect change through people in a large matrix organisation
* Excellent interpersonal skills, strong stakeholder management and business writing skills
* Able to cope with pressure, and meet deadlines and multiple deliverables
* Demonstrated ability to find workable solutions to problems
* Advanced communication skills, both written and presentational, to many different senior managers at a strategic, business and technical level
* A varied finance career across multiple finance and risk disciplines (e.g. Stress testing, Business Information & Analysis; Financial & Regulatory Reporting; Capital Management; Legal Entity CFO; Accounting Policy; Change Management)
* Exceptional drive and commitment with the ability to work and thrive in a fast changing, results driven environment
* Solid controls background (internal and external audit experience will be ideal)
* Advanced understanding of HSBC’s financial statements and how we present them to the external world, including business performance, strategy, and key metrics particularly capital and risk-weighted assets
* Very strong knowledge of the external environment – regulatory, competition, economics, etc
* Evidence of operating confidently at Executive level
* Strong understanding of regulatory capital and the drivers that move this, including P&L drivers and capital deductions
* Strong understanding of Risk Weighted Assets and the drivers that move these across all asset classes

title: Credit Specialist
description:
Job description
Our purpose – Opening up a world of opportunity – explains why we exist. Here at HSBC we use our unique expertise, capabilities, breadth and perspectives to open up new kinds of opportunity for our more than 40 million customers. We’re bringing together the people, ideas and capital that nurture progress and growth, helping to create a better world – for our customers, our people, our investors, our communities and the planet we all share.  

  

Provides credit related advice for the complex financing needs of our customers and support to Relationship Managers by structuring, negotiating, underwriting, and closing (documenting) new credit opportunities. This includes tasks such as preparing marketing pitches, negotiation of term sheets with clients, drafting credit applications, working with lawyers to perfect collateral as well as working on specific credit project as required from time to time.  

  

As our Credit Specialist you will:


* Provide good customer service at all times to both internal and external clients. Meeting with key clients for delivering large complex credits
* Proactively identify and develop new business opportunities for new and existing clients
* Closely work as partners with Credit Risk function
* Maintain and build strong relationships across all teams in Group Private Bank
* Risk assessment and credit recommendation
* Understand credit policy and be aware of periodic changes and updates
* Balanced objectives of client and risk management
* Minimize credit losses
* Work closely with the Head of Credit Advisory to create training content for Relationship Managers
* Attend client events as well as meeting with COI to build the lending portfolio

For this role, HSBC targets a pay range between $200,000.00 and $270,400.00  

  

The final fixed pay offer will depend on the candidate and a number of variables, including but not limited to, role responsibilities, skill set, depth of experience and education, licensing/certification requirements, internal relativity, and specific work location.  

  

At HSBC, our overall goal is to provide a competitive Total Reward Package, with an appropriate mix of fixed pay, and variable pay, as part of an employee’s overall total compensation and benefits. Variable pay generally takes the form of discretionary, annual awards (sometimes referred to as a “bonus”). Additionally, HSBC offers a wide range of competitive and flexible benefits designed to help you improve your health and well-being, finances, and lifestyle.


Requirements
You´ll likely have the following qualifications to succeed in this role


* Understanding and expertise in the various credit products expertise the HSBC Private Bank offers including Private Equity Capital Calls, Financials Sponsors (LP interested and Co Investment), Art, Aircraft, Yacht, Life Insurance Premium Financing and Privately held shares

title: Social Media Lead
description:
**Company Profile**

Vee International is a pioneering leader in the sexual wellness industry, dedicated to innovation, quality, and improving the lives of our customers. As a vertically integrated manufacturer we thrive on creating cutting-edge products and bringing them to market swiftly and efficiently. Our team is composed of passionate, driven professionals who are committed to excellence and continuous improvement.

**Job Summary:**

As a Social Media Lead at Vee International, you will be a key driver in shaping and executing our social media strategy to amplify brand visibility, foster engagement, and drive growth. This role demands a blend of creativity, strategic thinking, and data-driven analysis to craft compelling content and impactful campaigns. You will oversee a diverse range of social media platforms, lead in-house and offshore teams, and contribute to broader marketing goals. We seek a proactive individual with excellent communication skills, strong organizational abilities, and a keen eye for detail who thrives in a dynamic, collaborative environment.

**Key Responsibilities:**

Strategic Planning & Execution:

* Develop and execute a comprehensive social media strategy aligned with Vee International’s brand values and business objectives.
* Set clear objectives, KPIs, and goals for each campaign, ensuring they drive engagement and conversions.
* Lead the Social Media Activation Plan, integrating educational content, humor, inclusivity, and sustainability.

Content Creation & Management:

* Design and produce high-quality, engaging content tailored for various social media platforms, including posts, images, videos, and infographics.
* Ensure consistency in brand voice and style across all content, staying current with industry trends and audience preferences.
* Manage a content calendar to ensure timely and relevant posts, including educational and interactive content.

Audience Engagement & Community Management:

* Cultivate a vibrant online community by engaging with followers through comments, messages, and mentions.
* Proactively manage interactions to enhance brand reputation and build lasting relationships with the audience.
* Conduct interactive sessions, Q&As, and polls to increase follower engagement and gather valuable feedback.

Advertising & Campaign Optimization:

* Plan and execute targeted social media advertising campaigns to reach specific demographics and drive measurable results.
* Continuously optimize ad performance based on analytics and feedback to maximize ROI and engagement.

Analytics, Reporting & Insights:

* Monitor social media performance using tools such as Google Analytics, Facebook Insights, and others.
* Generate comprehensive reports, analyze data, and provide actionable recommendations to refine strategies and improve outcomes.

Competitive Analysis & Market Trends:

* Stay informed about industry trends, competitor activities, and emerging social media platforms.
* Leverage insights to adapt and innovate social media strategies, maintaining a competitive edge.

Collaboration & Coordination:

* Oversee and direct the Creative Content Designer & Coordinator and Community Manager, providing direction, running meetings, and reviewing deliverables.
* Collaborate with the marketing team to ensure alignment with overall marketing initiatives and campaigns.
* Coordinate with in-house and offshore staff, as well as service agencies, to execute social media plans effectively.
* Ensure a seamless workflow between content creation, approval, and publication.

Professional Presentation:

* Maintain a polished and professional appearance to meet ‘trend-tastic’ and urgent video production needs in-house.
* Ensure all public-facing content reflects a high standard of professionalism and brand integrity.

**Qualifications:**

Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).

* Proven experience in a social media leadership role, preferably within a relevant industry or sector.
* Expertise in social media platforms, trends, and best practices, with hands-on experience in content management and creation.
* Proficiency in social media management and analytics tools, including Jira and Hootsuite.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills with a creative approach to content creation.
* Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and make strategic decisions based on insights.
* Experience with social media advertising platforms and techniques.
* Proven ability to manage and coordinate with offshore teams and service agencies effectively.
* Flexibility to adapt to emerging trends and new social media technologies is essential

Vee International is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, or any other protected status under applicable law. We encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply and join our team.

title: Assistant Project Manager - Facilities Maintenance and Operations
description:
**Job Summary**

The Assistant Project Manager is responsible for assuming the duties of the Facilities Operations Manager when they are unavailable. This position will oversee a team of facility maintenance technicians and facility operations specialists. Projects range from regular preventative and reactive maintenance to minor construction projects.

**Pay Rate:** Up to $135,000 per year

**Experience**: The successful Assistant Project Manager shall possess 5 years of recent experience in building mechanics and preventative maintenance in facilities of high-rise buildings of at least 3,000,000 sq ft. and knowledge of systems related to:

* Elevators
* Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS);
* large chiller plants;
* low pressure boilers;
* computerized fire alarm systems;
* emergency generators;
* high voltage switchgear;
* Building Automation Systems;
* HVAC systems

**Essential Job Functions:**

* **Manage the day to day operations of the facilities under contract**
* Ensuring project Safety/Security
* **Manage the preventative and reactive maintenance programs for all facilities utilizing CMMS systems**
* Assists in developing project scopes and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility
* Develop detailed plans to track special projects
* Use appropriate verification techniques to manage changes in project scope, schedule, and costs
* Measure project performance using appropriate systems, tools and, techniques
* Report and escalate to management as needed
* **Manage the relationship with the client and all stakeholders**
* Perform risk management to minimize project risks
* Establish and maintain relationships with third parties/vendors
* **Ensure contract compliance**
* Following established and/or developing methods and standards
* Recruitment/Staffing/Management/Employee Relations/Supervision of employees
* Task train all contract employees on proper, safe, efficient, effective use/handling of all tools, equipment, methods, chemicals, devices, apparel, procedures, processes.
* Plan, organize and supervise maintenance and repairs performed by building staff. Responsible for maintaining and improving buildings
* Responsible for buildings quality control. Inspects facilities and work areas to eliminate deficiencies
* Continually evaluate the effectiveness of maintenance procedures and programs and makes changes to improve quality, efficiency and effectiveness.
* Review employees work hours to verify accuracy and approves payroll

**Job Experience Requirements:**

* The Assitant Facilities Operations Manager shall possess at a **minimum 5 years of recent** experience (within the past 7 years) in the management and supervision of building mechanical maintenance operations for large commercial office buildings.
* **Experience in a building of a similar size (3,000,000 sf)**
* **Experience in using Computerized Maintenance Management Systems (CMMS)**
* Experience directing or supervising mechanical operations and maintenance in buildings

**Required Skills:**

* Ability to obtain a government security clearance, upon hire
* Exceptional communication skills (written and verbal)
* Ability to write and deliver reports
* Strong organizational skills
* Ability to multi-task
* Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions
* Proficiency in using Microsoft Office and Google applications
* Ability to organize and prioritize job duties and assignments
* Ability to work in a team environment and be a leader
* Ability to work independently
* Ability to effectively utilize available resources to maximize productivity

**Physical Requirements:**  
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; stoop; kneel; crouch; or crawl; and talk; or hear. The employee is occasionally required to sit. The employee must frequently lift and/or move more than 100 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision and depth perception.

**Working Environment:**  
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently exposed to moving mechanical parts. The employee is occasionally exposed to wet and/or humid conditions; high, precarious places; fumes or airborne particles; toxic or caustic chemicals; outside weather conditions; risk of electrical shock; and vibration. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate to occasionally loud.

**Action Facilities Management, INC (AFM)** - is a Woman-Owned Small Business and a Minority Business Enterprise that was established in 2001 to provide government and commercial clients in 11 states and the District of Columbia. AFM's core competencies are in the areas of integrated facilities management such as operations and maintenance; janitorial support; security support; emergency management, and administrative assistance.

title: Crane/Rigger planner
description:
**Position Overview:**

The Crane Lift Planner is needed for tank installations utilizing cranes.

Duties would include:

* Perform site visits and meet with customers and construction managers to: determine lift parameters, crane sizes and other required equipment (lifts, man baskets, etc.) to install tanks.
* Provide quotes based on equipment and personnel required
* Develop lift plan and lift plan drawings for customer approval and as required for RFQ’s received from customers.
* Schedule cranes, lifts, and any other equipment for job and execute jobs on site.
* Execute lift work as lift supervisor; hands-on outdoor work.

Requirements:

* 2 or 4 year Mechanical engineering degree and minimum of 3 years’ experience working with cranes; or 10 years’ experience in crane and rigging with 5 years as lift supervisor or commensurate experience in crane and rigging industry evidenced by master rigger and/or lift supervisor license or certifications.
* Good spatial reasoning abilities
* High regard for recognized job site safety requirements and procedures.
* Ability to travel 60% of time, extensively by car and truck throughout Northeast from VA to ME.

For over 125 years, OPW has led the way in designing and manufacturing world-class retail fueling, fluid handling and car wash system solutions for the safe and efficient handling and distribution of fuels and critical fluids. OPW makes above ground and below ground products for both conventional, vapour recovery and clean energy applications in the retail and commercial markets. Additionally, OPW supplies loading arms, valves and dry-break couplings, tank truck equipment, rail car valves and equipment, and car wash systems. OPW has manufacturing operations in North America, Europe, Latin America and Asia Pacific, with sales offices around the world. OPW is part of the Dover Corporation, which is publicly traded on the New York Stock Exchange under 'DOV'. To learn more about OPW’s 125 years of providing industry-leading solutions, visit our website at www.opwglobal.com.

Dover is a diversified global manufacturer with annual revenue of over $7 billion. We deliver innovative equipment and components, specialty systems, consumable supplies, software and digital solutions, and support services through five operating segments: Engineered Products, Fueling Solutions, Imaging & Identification, Pumps & Process Solutions and Refrigeration & Food Equipment. Dover combines global scale with operational agility to lead the markets we serve. Recognized for our entrepreneurial approach for over 60 years, our team of approximately 24,000 employees takes an ownership mindset, collaborating with customers to redefine what's possible. Headquartered in Downers Grove, Illinois, Dover trades on the New York Stock Exchange under "DOV." Additional information is available at dovercorporation.com.

title: Organizational Change Analyst, Grade-18 - Lower Hudson Valley, New York City and Long Island Region
company: New York State Department of Motor Vehicles
description:
**Minimum Qualifications**

To apply, you should have:

* A bachelor’s degree in any field + two years of experience working on a project team or managing projects.

OR

* A master’s degree in any field + one year of experience working on a project team or managing projects.

**Preferred Qualifications**

You will be a great candidate if you are:

* Highly self-motivated.
* Able to solve problems or find out-of-the-box ways to achieve the agency’s goals.
* A great communicator-both written and oral.
* Detail-oriented and accurate in analysis.

We would love to hear from you if you have:

* Great analytical skills and ability to collect, analyze, and interpret data.
* Project management experience.
* Experience using Excel, Word, Outlook, Teams, SharePoint, and WebEx.
* An understanding of graphic design and experience creating or editing media.
* Experience and/or certification in an established OCM Model (Prosci, Acuity, Cornell, etc.)

**Overview & Responsibilities:**

The Department of Motor Vehicles (DMV) is an agency dedicated to delivering innovative solutions and exceptional service to our customers. We are committed to fostering a collaborative and inclusive work environment that empowers our employees to achieve their full potential.

DMV operates in a dynamic environment marked by ongoing change. At the heart of our efforts is the Change Management Office (CMO). Our CMO assist with enabling change within the agency by developing structured approaches to help acclimate employees and the agency to the future state of the organizational change.

Joining the CMO means becoming part of a team dedicated to shattering the perceptions of the DMV. You will be a valued member of a team of collaborators with the common goal of driving DMV forward. We proudly promote a respectful, empowering, and inclusive work environment where there is room for growth and new opportunities to help drive your career forward.

This position is based in Manhattan – New York City. You can expect to lead change activities in the lower Hudson Valley, New York City and Long Island Region as well as Capital Region and Central and Western NY Region areas as needed. The incumbent will report to the Organizational Change Manager for the Lower Hudson Valley, New York City and Long Island Region.

What will you do?

* Participate in the active execution of engagements, focusing on the people side of change for organizational changes and processes.
* Collect and analyze data related to organizational changes.
* Conduct impact assessments and assist in the development of change management strategies and associated materials.
* Engage and collaborate with stakeholders to ensure alignment and support for change initiatives.
* Assist in the development and execution of effective communication plans to keep all stakeholders informed and engaged throughout the change process.
* Identify barriers and propose recommendations to eliminateresistance and promote acceptance of the change amongstakeholders as well as provide support to Change Managers in addressing resistance and overcoming obstacles.
* Assist in coordinating training sessions and develop communication materials as necessary.
* Track and measure the effectiveness of change initiatives.
* Perform other duties as assigned.

What’s in it for you?

* 13 paid holidays
* Paid vacation and sick leave
* Flexibility and work-from-home opportunities
* Affordable health insurance plans
* Family dental and vision benefits
* Membership in the New York State Employees’ Retirement
* System (ERS)
* Access to New York State Deferred Compensation to help save extra money for retirement.
* Opportunities for student loan forgiveness and tuition assistance programs
* Promotional opportunities to grow your career.

Hours of the position will be discussed at the time of interview, including questions regarding flextime, compressed work week and telecommuting. Telecommuting, if granted, is a maximum of 50%.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $65,001.00 - $82,656.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY 10007 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY 10007: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: Collections Manager
description:
**Position Title:** Collections Manager

Advanced Recovery Group is seeking a skilled Collections Manager to oversee a team of collection agents in the (MCA) Merchant Cash Advancement collections field. The ideal candidate should exhibit exceptional communication and negotiation skills, coupled with the ability to learn legal procedures related to pre-and post-judgment cases quickly. If you're someone with innovative ideas and fresh perspectives geared toward enhancing team efficiency, then ARG is the perfect fit for you!

**Company:** 

Advanced Recovery Group (ARG) functions as a comprehensive collection agency, providing efficient management solutions with professionalism and effectiveness. Positioned to lead in the commercial collections industry, ARG is dedicated to delivering exemplary service to financing entities throughout the US.

**Benefits and Perks:** 

- Comprehensive Compensation

- Base Salary Pay Range: $70k-$100k.

- Plus, uncapped monthly commission based on team performance.

- Medical/ Dental/ Vision/ Life/ Disability/ 401 (k) Benefits Packages for individuals

- Paid Time Off after 90 Day Review & 13 Paid Holidays

- Quarterly Team Building Outings

- Weekly Sponsored Lunches

- Valuable Inclusive Work Environment

**Role Description:** 

Responsibilities:

- Supervise and mentor a team of 10+ collection agents, offering guidance, support, and ongoing training as required to enhance productivity and success rates.

- Generate regular reports on team performance and financial transactions.

- Manage and resolve escalated calls promptly.

- Monitor and track key performance indicators (KPIs). As well as oversee daily cash collection activities.

- Prepare cash forecasts based on historical payment data and current outstanding balances.

Requirements:

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills along with being highly organized and detail oriented.

- Advanced computer skills, including familiarity with collections platforms, MS Office Suite, and Excel.

- Capacity to manage large volumes of data with an analytical mindset with problem-solving abilities.

**Company Culture:** 

At Advanced Recovery Group (ARG), our company culture is deeply rooted in dedication, professionalism, and innovation. We foster an environment that encourages collaboration and empowers individuals to bring forth their unique perspectives and ideas. With a focus on excellence in service delivery, we prioritize continuous improvement and learning, ensuring that our team stays ahead in the dynamic landscape of financial services. At ARG, we value diversity and inclusivity, recognizing the strength that comes from embracing varied backgrounds and experiences. Together, we strive to create a supportive and rewarding work environment where every team member can thrive and contribute to our collective success.

**Your Background:** 

- 2+ years of experience in managing a collections team of 10+ staff, preferably in Commercial Financing/ MCA.

- Preferred: Bachelor’s degree in accounting or finance

- 2+ Years of debt collection preferred.

- North Jersey-based/In-office position.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $70,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid sick time
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

title: Warehouse Associate
description:
**About Us:**  

Sheba Foods is a leader in authentic African cuisine, delivering fresh and frozen meals across the country. We take pride in providing high-quality products, and we’re looking for a detail-oriented and hardworking Warehouse Associate to join our team. If you enjoy working in a fast-paced environment and have a passion for logistics, this role is for you!
  
  

**Job Overview:**  

As a Warehouse Associate, you will play a key role in supporting our daily operations. Your responsibilities will range from receiving shipments and organizing products to ensuring that all outgoing orders are accurately picked, packed, and shipped to our customers. This is a physically active position that requires teamwork, precision, and a positive attitude.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Product Handling: Receive, unload, and organize incoming shipments, ensuring all products are properly stored and tracked.
* Order Fulfillment: Pick and pack customer orders efficiently, ensuring that all products meet the company’s quality standards.
* Shipping & Receiving: Assist in preparing shipments, verifying shipping details, and ensuring timely delivery of goods.
* Inventory Management: Help maintain accurate inventory records and participate in regular stock checks and audits.
* Warehouse Organization: Maintain cleanliness and organization of the warehouse to ensure a safe and efficient work environment.
* Quality Control: Inspect products for damage or discrepancies and report any issues to management.
* Team Collaboration: Work closely with other departments to ensure smooth operations across the company.


**Skills and Qualifications:**  

* Attention to Detail: Strong focus on accuracy to ensure all orders are correctly packed and prepared for shipment.
* Physical Fitness: Ability to lift heavy items (up to 50 lbs), stand for extended periods, and perform physical tasks as needed.
* Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to identify and resolve issues related to inventory, orders, or equipment.
* Team-Oriented: Strong communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively with other team members.
* Adaptability: Able to work in a dynamic environment where priorities can shift quickly.
* Previous Experience: Prior experience in a warehouse or logistics environment is a plus, but we are willing to train motivated candidates.


**What We Offer:**  

* Competitive Pay: We offer a competitive salary with opportunities for advancement.
* Flexible Scheduling: We understand the importance of work-life balance and offer flexible shifts to suit your needs.
* Employee Benefits: Discounts on Sheba Foods products, paid time off, and health benefits.
* Career Growth: As Sheba Foods continues to expand, there will be opportunities for career progression within the company.
* Supportive Work Environment: Be part of a team that values hard work, collaboration, and a positive attitude.


Why Join Us? At Sheba Foods, we believe in fostering a culture of respect, teamwork, and growth. As a Warehouse Associate, you'll be a crucial part of our success, ensuring our customers receive the best possible service. Join us and help us continue to deliver exceptional products to homes across the nation.

title: Order Filler
description:
Nibav Lifts Inc. is a pioneer in the home elevator industry, offering eco-friendly and innovative vertical mobility solutions that redefine comfort and convenience. Our commitment to customer satisfaction and sustainability sets us apart, and we are looking for individuals who share our vision and passion. Join our fast-growing company and be part of a team that’s elevating the industry!
  
  

**Position Overview:**  

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Order Filler to join our dynamic warehouse team. As an Order Filler, you will be responsible for accurately picking, packing, and preparing orders for shipment, ensuring our customers receive their products on time and in perfect condition. You’ll be a key player in keeping our operations running smoothly and ensuring customer satisfaction.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Order Picking: Efficiently locate and select products from the warehouse to fulfill customer orders based on order sheets or electronic devices.
* Packing & Shipping: Carefully pack items to ensure they are secure and ready for shipment. Label and prepare orders for timely delivery.
* Inventory Management: Monitor stock levels and communicate any shortages or discrepancies to the warehouse supervisor. Assist with stock replenishment when needed.
* Quality Control: Perform quality checks on products before packing to ensure they meet company standards. Report any damaged or defective items.
* Organization & Maintenance: Maintain a clean and organized work area. Ensure all tools and equipment are in proper working condition.
* Collaborative Teamwork: Work closely with other warehouse staff and supervisors to improve efficiency and meet daily productivity goals.


**Qualifications:**  

* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Previous experience in a warehouse or order fulfillment role is preferred but not required.
* Ability to lift and move items up to 50 lbs.
* Strong attention to detail and accuracy in order processing.
* Basic knowledge of inventory software or ability to learn quickly.
* Good communication and teamwork skills.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and meet tight deadlines.
* Willingness to stand, bend, and move throughout the shift.


Why Join Nibav Lifts Inc.?
  
* Competitive Pay: We offer a competitive hourly wage with the opportunity for overtime.
* Health & Wellness: Comprehensive benefits including health, dental, and vision insurance, as well as paid time off.
* Career Growth: Opportunity for professional development and advancement within the company.
* Positive Work Environment: Join a supportive and collaborative team where your contributions are valued.
* Cutting-Edge Industry: Be part of an innovative company revolutionizing home mobility solutions.

title: RN, Oncology/Hematology-Infusion
description:
Overview

*At Essen Health Care, we care for that!* 

*As the largest privately held multispecialty medical group in the Bronx, we provide high-quality, compassionate, and accessible medical care to some of the most vulnerable and under-served residents of New York State. Guided by a Population Health model of care, Essen has five integrated clinical divisions offering urgent care, primary care, and specialty services, as well as nursing home staffing and care management. Founded in 1999, our over 20-year commitment has fueled an unwavering dedication toward innovating a better healthcare delivery system. Essen has expanded from a single primary care office to an umbrella organization offering specialties from women’s health to endocrinology, from psychiatry to a vast array of other specialties. All clinical services are offered via telehealth or in-person at over 35 medical offices and at home through the Essen House Calls program.* 

*Essen Health Care is the place Where Care Comes Together! We are looking for the most talented and effective individuals to join our rapidly growing company. With over 1,100 employees and 400+ Practitioners, we care for over 250,000 patients annually in New York City and beyond. From medical providers to administration & operational staff, there is a career here for you. Join our team today!*

Job Summary

Job Summary: Oncology RN’s main duty is to supervise and provide nursing care to our cancer patients. They monitor patient’s condition, develop care plans, develop symptom management protocols, and administer medication.

The responsibilities of our oncology nurses goes beyond direct patient care, with roles as research, manager, consultant, and patient educator. He/she will work hand-in-hand with physicians and other healthcare team members to ensure the greatest quality of care for the patient.

Responsibilities

* Create individualized care plans on patient under their supervision and care.
* Recognize and treat cancer-related issues.
* Collaborate with a team of healthcare professionals to share expertise and knowledge.
* Do cancer research to enhance treatment protocols assigned to cancer patients.
* Give supportive resources on the patient and the families to promote positive outlook.
* Teach patients and the families regarding treatment expectations.
* Watch and record the patient’s progress on a constant basis.
* Chart the patient’s response to treatment and medication.
* Performs other related duties as assigned.

Qualifications

* Licensed to practice as a Registered Professional Nurse in New York State
* Education: Bachelors Degree in Nursing
* Prior experience in Oncology is preferred
* Willing to train! 1 year experience as an RN
* Fulltime 9-5 Mon-Fri
* Current BLS/CPR and ACLS certification
* Must IV-Infusion experience/ willing to get certified
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills for professional role

Equal Opportunity Employer

***Essen Health care is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we seek candidates who desire to work in and serve an ethnically diverse population.***

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Travel nursing, Permanent

Pay: $80,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year

* 401(k)

* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Cardiology

* Internal Medicine

* Urology

**To apply:** Please visit us atwww.NannySmith.com
  
**and click on For Job Seekers or click on the following link:** https://jobs.crelate.com/portal/thenannysmith/Apply
  
  

**More details:**  

A family in Summit is looking for an active caregiver for their two daughters. The typical schedule will be Monday to Friday 2:00 pm to 6:30/7:00 pm with flexibility to pick up more hours when needed. The family is hoping the nanny can work the first two weeks as full time to help with the transition, if possible.
  
  

**Ideal nanny:**  

The ideal nanny for this family is someone who is loving, creative, engaging, and patient with their girls. A nanny who is fluent in Spanish, as their last caregiver was with them since birth and has taught them to be bilingual.
  
  

**Duties:**  

Pickup and drop off at school and activities. Helping with homework and tutoring if needed. Keeping the children engaged in fun, educational activities, games trips to the park, and arts and crafts. Bathing the children. Preparing meals for the children. Making dinner for the family 1 to 2 nights a week is a plus but not required. Grocery shopping. Picking up and dropping off dry cleaning. Doing the children's laundry. Vacuuming and basic tidying up after the children. Cleaning the entire home. No pet care is required.
  
  

**About the children:**  

This 6-year-old is super sweet, compassionate, and funny. She loves reading, animals, and swimming. She is a dancer, actress, and gymnast after school. She also enjoys science and marine life.
  
  

The youngest, 4 year old is described to be outgoing, energetic, and loving. She is in preschool and loves sports, gymnastics, dancing, singing, and being outdoors, specifically the park.
  
  

**About the parents:**  

These hard working parents are laid back, easy going, and fun. Their discipline style is time outs when necessary.
  
  

**Benefits:**  

Salary plus paid vacation days off, paid holidays off, paid sick days off, and paid personal days off. Health insurance stipend if needed.
  
  

**Position Code:** E917SM
  
  

**To apply:**  

Please visit us at www.NannySmith.com and click on For Job Seekers or click on the following link: https://jobs.crelate.com/portal/thenannysmith/Apply
  
  

Applicants will be subject to various background screens and must be able to provide valid work and childcare references.
  
  

Qualified candidates should apply today!
